loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 34 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Mary Joy is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizer and farm supplies .

Mary Joy has been farming rice for eight years, and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 40 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like shampoo, biscuits, spices, etc. to sell.

Wilma has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for thre years and also earns an income from food vending.

Wilma aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like shampoo, biscuits, spices, etc., to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Eva works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income as a fish pond operator. Eva is borrowing PHP 21,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fishing materials for her fishing business, like fishing net and gasoline.

Eva has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials, like fishing net and gasoline.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a selling native bags business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Nenita is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy an additional stock of native bags to sell for her selling native bags business.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of native bags

loans.name: Perigrena

texts.en:
Perigrena is 54 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Perigrena has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years, and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 58 years old and widowed with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Rosalia has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 49 years old and married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Rebecca has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from a buy and sell charcoal business.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 57 years old and married with five children.

Nilda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Nilda has borrowed and paid 28 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Nilda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en: Lusine is an experienced agronomist from Sisian town of Syuniq region. She lives with her husband and 5-year-old son. To cover her family's needs, Lusine is engaged in the cultivation of wheat, potato and garlic. Her husband helps her sell the agricultural products in the local market. As their needs are growing day by day, Lusine needs to expand her agribusiness to be able to effectively meet her family's needs. She needs a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase seeds, fuel for land cultivation and hire workers for cultivation process. She previously took a loan from a local financial institution, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to the hard work during the recent times, Lusine was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Lusine and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fuel for land cultivation and hire workers for cultivation process

loans.name: Evacueta

texts.en: Evacueta finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities, she plants flowers and ornaments. Not only is she doing her hobby, but she earns an income as well. At her age and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full pledge member of PMPC. She thanks the cooperative for the capital in supporting her gardening activities. Recently, she applied for a loan of Php20,000 to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. In the future, Evacueta wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita operates a motor transport business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. For her to continue her business, she requested a loan to pay for motor spare parts and repair. She dreams to own motor units and be able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to pay for motor spare parts and repair

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 45 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She farms vegetables in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Janeth has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been farming vegetables for 2 years and also earns an income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested a new loan to further build her business.

Janeth aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell handicraft/native products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase materials needed for her business for her buy and sell handicraft/native products business.

Eden has been in this business for ten years. She earns more income from buying and selling charcoal.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Eden has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for her business

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 28 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Christine is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Christine has been pig fattening for 8 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 31-year-old married woman in the business of cattle purchase and sale with the help of her husband for the past 6 years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is very motivated to provide her family with good food, health and clothing. She is in her 11th loan cycle and has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize the loan amount to purchase more cattle. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 51-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. 

The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality.  

At present she owns two cows.  With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another cow. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Farakh

texts.en:
Farakh is a 45-year-old married woman who has been doing a business of cattle purchase and sale, with the help of her husband, for many years. 

Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of three children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing. 

She is in her third loan cycle and has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize the loan amount to purchase more cattle. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Zaib

texts.en: Zaib is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a shop keeping business for 5 years. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Zaib needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. Zaib has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. In this way, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items to sell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to help her coffee crops in this new season.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр занимается тепличным бизнесом в Приветном уже 8 лет. Он выращивает ранние культуры на 1.13 га земли в теплицах, под дугами, агроволокном и на открытом грунте. Выращивает в основном редис, помидоры, капусту, перец, кабачки, лук. 
На сумму в 30 000 гривен, полученную от Кива, Александр планирует закупить семена, удобрения, химикаты, дрова, уголь, а также купить дуги, отремонтировать теплиц и установить отопление в теплицах.
texts.en: Alexander has been involved in a greenhouse business in Privetnoye for 8 years already. He grows early spring crops on 1.13 hectares of land in greenhouses, under wires, agricultural fabric and open soil. He primarily grows radishes, tomatoes, cabbage, peppers, zucchinis, and onions. Alexander is planning to use the loan of 30 000 hryvnia received from Kiva to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, wood, coal, and also wires, to repair greenhouses and install heating in greenhouses.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, wood, coal, and also wires, to repair greenhouses and install heating in greenhouses

loans.name: Jeanilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jeanilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling medicines. Jeanilyn is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Jeanilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Juliet works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell ready to wear products. Juliet is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Juliet has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 41 years old and married with six children, five of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell accessories business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional accessories to sell in her business.

Liezel has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Liezel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional accessories to sell in her business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 48 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Delia has borrowed and paid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for five years and also earns an income from a general store.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Minerva is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Minerva has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothes, such as shoes, slippers, blouses, etc., to sell.

Minerva has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothing, such as shoes, slippers, blouses, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
As a parent of ten children, Emelda works hard to support her family.

She has a business farming rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Emelda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers for her rice farming business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Emelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat is a 38-year-old married woman; she has been running a business selling milk with her husband (also shown in the photo) for many years. She has 1 buffalo and 4 cows, which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Nusrat has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Nusrat is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Dena

texts.en:
Dena is 54 years old. She is married and has five children who attend school. They live in their own house, which has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She operates an agricultural retail business, selling produce from her home to her neighbors and passersby. Two of the major challenges she faces include the outbreak of disease and pests.

With the loan of 50,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase more seedlings and a water pump for water irrigation on her farm. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and a water pump for irrigation.

loans.name: Rasheedan

texts.en: Rasheedan has successfully built her business, which is selling milk, with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has attained a good number of customers and earns a good income to contribute to the family income. Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her fourth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR in order to purchase another cow. This will enable her to expand her milk sales to more cities and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Ligaya works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Ligaya is borrowing 26,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her general store business.  She has successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Ligaya has been sustaining her business activities through the 22 loans she has previously borrowed from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lavenia

texts.en:
Lavenia is 46 years old.  She is married and has five children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Lavenia has been farming rice for 18 years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman and has been blessed with four kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Fatuma operated a fish selling business, which has been operational for over two years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. Fatuma dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy apparel merchandise to start her business, in order to provide better opportunities for her 1-year-old son

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en:
Nasira is a 34-year-old woman. She has always been passionate about education. After completing her schooling, she started teaching in her neighbor’s school. 

Two years later, the school owner and his family moved away and left the school to Nasira. She has now been running this school for two years. She hired educated staff members to help her manage the school and has been doing a great job. Students and staff members alike are very satisfied with Nasira's management. 

She requires a loan of PKR 100,000 to buy benches for her classrooms and a water tank to provide clean water for her students, and to repair the school. She wants to provide her 80 students with a comfortable learning environment that will help them further their education goals.

loans.use: to buy benches for her classrooms and a water tank to provide clean water for her students, and to repair the school.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish and vegetables vending business in the Philippines.

Rosita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish and vegetables to sell.

She has been in this business for twelve years now.

Rosita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 47 years old. She is married and has two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and has been in business for 10 years.  She also earns additional income from poultry.  

Marissa has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy sacks of charcoal to sell in her business.  Prior to requesting this loan, she has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Saeed

texts.en:
Saeed, age 35, has been in the business of selling animals for many years. She started her business of animal selling with the support of Kashf Foundation. She is supporting her children’s needs. With the help of her husband, she is running a successful business to lead them to a decent life. 

She buys animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, brings them up, and then her husband sells them in the market. 

Now she is requesting a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase more animals such as baby goats. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of renovating her house.

loans.use: to purchase more animals such as baby goats

loans.name: Irena

texts.en:
Irena lives in Torunik village of Syunik region with her husband and 22-year-old son. 

She is an experienced farmer. To assist her husband in earning a living, Irena is engaged in breeding livestock of pigs, calves, colonies of bees, and hens, and in the cultivation of wheat, barley, apples, pears, and nuts. 

To continue the agribusiness in a sustainable way and develop it further, Irena needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase forage for feeding the livestock. She and her family will be grateful to all the lenders for their goodwill in helping them develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Lorenso

texts.es: Lorenso hace 8 meses inicio con la venta de Hielo, anteriormente tuvo una legumbrera pero por los malos resultados tuvo que cerrar, gracias a que pudo mantenerse y tener alguna utilidad para su hogar Lorenso quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar un congelador y ampliar sus existencias de Hielo, con el dinero restante comprara algunas verduras para reactivar su legumbrera poco a poco y con la ayuda de dios consolidarse y tener un negocio rentable y útil para sus vecinos.
texts.en: 8 months ago, Lorenso began selling ice. Previously he had a vegetable stand, but due to poor results he had to close. Thankfully, he could support himself and be useful to his home. Lorenso wants to request a loan to buy a freezer and increase his ice supply. With the remaining money, he will buy some vegetables to restart his vegetable business little by little, and with god's help, establish and have a profitable, useful business for his neighbors.

loans.use: to buy a freezer to increase the ice supply, and will use the remaining money to restart his vegetable stand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Doña Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Doña Mercedes” esta integrado por tres personas muy trabajadoras. 

En México se acostumbra que en la mesa, a la hora de la comida, nunca falten las tortillas, alimento principal para las familias. Las tortillas, al centro de la mesa, siempre están envueltas en una servilleta bordada a mano, como las que crea doña Inés. Ella utilizará su crédito para comprar más material y seguir haciendo servilletas y manteles. 

Por otro lado, Maria Mercedes y Porfirio son esposos desde hace 30 años, tienen cuatro hijas de las cuales ahora ya solo una depende de dicha pareja. Don Porfirio se dedica a vender frutas y legumbres en su comunidad y utilizará su crédito para comprar más mercancía. 

Doña Mercedes, como le dicen de cariño, es la representante del grupo y es por eso que decidieron nombrar así a su grupo. Ella tiene 48 años de edad y maneja una pequeña tienda de abarrotes desde hace 10 años. Doña Mercedes comentó “Fue iniciativa propia porque anteriormente vivíamos frente a una escuela primaria y se me ocurrió iniciar a vender dulces, chicharrones, gelatinas que yo misma preparaba en casa". Después, al mudarse a su casa actual, optó por instalar una tienda formal pero esto fue con ayuda de los prestamos de VisionFund México. Poco a poco pudo comprar más productos como leche, refrescos, azúcar, productos enlatados, etc. Doña Mercedes esta muy agradecida con KIVA y VisionFund porque podrá comprar más mercancía. Doña Mercedes argumenta que no tiene ninguna dificultad pero realmente ella es muy positiva, no le importa tener competencia por todos lados. Uno de sus sueños es que su negocio crezca y seguir apoyando con los gastos del hogar y en la educación de su hija. 

*La foto se tomó en un jardín en el corazón del municipio donde habitan los integrantes. Doña Mercedes lleva una capa azul.
texts.en:
The “Doña Mercedes” group  has three very hard-working members.

In Mexico customarily at dinner hour, tortillas are always on the table, a staple food for families.  The tortillas will be in the center of the table and are always wrapped in a napkin embroidered by hand, like the ones  Inés makes.  She will use her loan to buy more material and continue making napkins and tablecloths.

For their part, Maria Mercedes and Porfirio have been husband and wife for 30 years.  They have four children, of whom only one, a daughter, remains their dependent.  Porfirio works selling fruits and vegetables in the community and will use his loan to buy more merchandise.

Doña Mercedes, as they affectionately call her, is the representative of the group and so they decided to name their group after her.   She is 48 years old and has managed a small grocery store for more than 10 years.  Mercedes says, "It was our own project because previously we lived across from an elementary school, and it occurred to me that I could begin selling sweets, chicharrones, and jello desserts that I made myself at home."  Later, after moving to their current house, Mercedes chose to start an actual store, this time with the help of the lenders of VisionFund Mexico.  Little by little she was able to buy more products such as milk, soft drinks, sugar, canned goods, etc.  Mercedes is very grateful to KIVA and VisionFund because she will be able to buy more merchandise.   Mercedes claims to have no problems but in fact has a very positive attitude and doesn't worry about the competitors around her.  One of her dreams is that the business will grow and continue to contribute to the costs of the home and of her daughter's education.  

*The photograph was taken in a garden located in the heart of the city where the members live.  Mercedes wears a blue shawl.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables and groceries to sell, and materials for making embroidered cloths

location.town: San Pablo Tlachichilpa, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is a 59-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Concepcion, Iloilo. Felomina has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now. This is their main source of income.

Felomina is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets. With this, they will be able to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Felomina hopes to make their business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets.

loans.name: Ghafooran

texts.en: Ghafooran is a 44-year-old married woman and has been involved in manufacturing 'parandas' for many years. Paranda is considered as a traditional hair accessory in a country like Pakistan. Women use it for a traditional look on special occasions like Eid (a holiday) and weddings. She makes beautiful parandas, especially for bridal hairstyles. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Taking a loan from Kashf helped her account for expenses she thought she could never bear. She is striving hard to meet her family expenditures. She is responsible for providing them a good environment with good food, clothing, and education. She needs a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy raw material including colorful threads, beads, mirrors, and pearls for embellishment. This would help in attracting more customers. She wants to use the earned revenue for building a separate room for her children.

loans.use: to buy raw material including colorful threads, beads, mirrors, and pearls

loans.name: Al- Ahlam Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Ahlam. It consists of four women. They all live in traditional and simple families in Hodeidah city, Yemen. They know one another through friendship and neighborhood connections. They applied for a loan of 200,000 Yemen rials (YER) from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB). 

Rahma is a 23-year-old married woman with 9 children. She is the leader of the group. Rahma lives with her family in their own house in a poor area. She studied until elementary school. She got married when she was very young, and for this reason, she couldn't complete her study. She is very dynamic and vigorous. Her husband has an unfixed income and it is very a small. Rahma and her husband and their children live in a very old house which needs to be renovated from the inside. Rahma's husband doesn't have enough money to do the necessary renovation for the house. Rahma decided to help her husband in make the repair and maintenance for the house. Unfortunately, she doesn't have enough money to do that. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase construction materials to renovate her house from the inside.

Rahma's dream is renovate all her house from the inside in order to provide her family with a better and secure future.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to renovate her house from the inside.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 40 years old and married with nine children, eight of whom are in school.
 
She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippines peso (PHP) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Elena has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Elena aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Godelive

texts.en:
Godelive is 36 years old. She is married with four children aged between 4 and 13, and all of them go to school. She has been selling fertilizers for eight years. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for maize production. The profits from the farming will be used to improve her savings. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for maize production.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen, aged 43 years, is a married woman and has three kids who attend school. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Hellen has operated a farming business for the past eight years. Her potential clients are neighbours and passersby. She dreams of expanding to large-scale farming in the future. 

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase more seedlings and herbicides to kill pests. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and herbicides to kill pests.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery es una mujer de 58 años de edad, divorciada, madre de una hija de 29 años y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es emprendedora, buena madre, optimista, paciente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en un mercado céntrico y popular, un sitio caracterizado por la variedad de comercios dedicados a la fruta, verdura, carne y comida.
Rosmery es de tez pálida, cabello negro corto, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el español. Su trabajo es la cocina de comidas típicas de la ciudad, como; el plato Paceño (choclo, habas, papa, queso frito), Chairo (sopa a base de chuño), fricase (sopa de cerdo), picana (sopa de ají con papa y carne de res y cerdo), quesumacha (comida a base de queso y quinua), timpu (sopa de carne con papas y arroz), sajta de pollo (ají, pollo, papas, chuño). 
Ella sueña tener algún día un restaurante de comida nacional. Su deseo es ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de muebles como; mesas y sillas donde poder servir sus exquisitas comidas.
Es por esos motivos que Rosmery solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosmery is a 58-year-old woman. She is divorced and has a 29-year-old daughter.

Rosmery sells food. She is a good mother, and an entrepreneurial, optimistic, patient, responsible and hardworking woman. She works at a central marketplace which is well-known for its wide variety of stores that sell fruits, vegetables, meat and foodstuff in general.

Rosmery is light-skinned. She is not very tall and has short, black hair. Her mother tongue is Spanish. She works selling traditional food such as Paceño (corn, beans, potato and fried cheese), Chairo (a soup made with freeze-dried potatoes), Fricase (pork soup), Picana (chili soup with potatoes, pork and beef), Quesumacha (a dish made with cheese and quinoa), Timpu (beef soup with potatoes and rice), and chicken Sajta (chili, chicken, potatoes, and freeze-dried potatoes).

Her dream is to have her own restaurant and sell traditional Bolivian food. She would like to expand her business and buy furniture, such as tables and chairs, so that she can offer her delicious food.

This is why Rosmery is requesting a loan to buy tables and chairs to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to expand her business.

loans.name: Leocardia

texts.en:
Leocadia is a hardworking widow from Bubaare, Kashari Mbarara district. She is a single parent of two children after losing her husband, who died before his firstborn could even fetch a jerrycan of water. As of now, the last born is 18 years old and is also studying at school.

This client has been struggling to cater for the family as a single parent. She depends largely on agriculture, which is always hit by pestilences and poor climatic conditions. Additionally, Leocadia sells second hand clothes to supplement the meagre income.

To get relief, she has been coming to Ugafode for financial assistance, which we have been rendering to her. She hopes to expand her piggery project and improve her banana plantation.

Her sole objective is to help her children attain a level where they can take care of themselves and herself when she will be struggling for her life in her old age. She is thankful for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy pigs and mulch

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
The person in the photograph is Zipporah.  She is 46 years old, married, and blessed with three children.

She does vegetable and dairy farming. She is borrowing a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides to boost her vegetable farming. This will help improve the crop yield, hence more supply to the market. Zipporah hopes her income will increase, and hence be in a position to cater to her children's needs and education.

She is happy with Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pestcides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar electricity system.

loans.name: Saul Antonio

texts.es:
Saúl ha sido caficultor desde hace 30 años y desde hace 1 año se certifico como productor orgánico en FCC. Saúl esta convencido que una agricultura limpia y saludable vale la pena por eso sueña con hacer de su finca una empresa productora de café orgánico certificado y otros cultivos que sirva para realizar investigación en el proceso de producción orgánica y que dichos conocimientos y experiencias puedan ser replicados por otros productores, para esto el necesita $5.600.000, con este préstamo el puede fortalecer y mejorar sus cultivos, Saúl tiene 3.500 árboles de café y le gustaría llegar a tener 6.000. A nivel personal Saúl quiere ampliar sus conocimientos en agricultura orgánica, terminar sus estudios profesionales como agrónomo y apoyar a su hija para que termine sus estudios universitarios.

La conversión y producción de café orgánico es un proceso integral al largo plazo independiente, saludable, balanceado y amigable con el medio ambiente lo que representa un desafío para los campesinos de Colombia y Saul ha decidido no arriesgar su salud; la de su familia ni la de los consumidores, al seguir usando químicos. La FCC están convencida que vale la pena apoyar y fortalecer estas iniciativas alternas. Un préstamo con Kiva representa un futuro sostenible por su producción, su tierra, y su familia.
texts.en:
Saúl has been a coffee grower for 30 years. One year ago, he became certified as an organic producer within the FCC (Federación Campesina del Cauca). Saúl is convinced that clean and healthy agriculture is worth the trouble, so he dreams of turning his farm into a certified organic producer of coffee and other crops that can be used to study the process of organic production. That knowledge and experience could then be replicated by other producers.  For this,he needs 5,600,000 Colombian pesos. 

With this loan, Saúl can strengthen and improve his crops. He has 3,500 coffee trees and he would like to eventually have 6,000. On a personal level, Saúl wants to increase his knowledge of organic agriculture, finish his professional studies in Agronomy, and support his daughter so that she can finish her university education. 

The process of converting to and producing organic coffee is key to a future that is independent, healthy, balanced, and environmentally-friendly. It represents a challenge for the farmers of Colombia, and Saúl has decided not to risk his health, that of his family, or that of the consumers by continuing to use chemicals. The FCC is convinced that supporting and strengthening these alternative initiatives is worth the trouble. 

A Kiva loan represents a sustainable future for Saúl's production, his land, and his family.

loans.use: to organically produce coffee and study the organic cultivation of coffee and other crops

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Vanessa is 32 years old and she has one child who is in school.

Vanessa has a food vending business in the Philippines. Vanessa requested a loan of PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Vanessa has been in this business for four years. In the future, Vanessa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Kamene

texts.en:
Kamene is a married woman. She has six children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Kamene has operated a fresh milk selling business for the past two years, selling from her home to her neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during rainy season when the business is low. 

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase gallon containers for storing milk before selling in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase gallon containers for storing milk before selling it in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start his business selling fast food at a venue, and from a food cart.

loans.name: José David

texts.es:
José de 32 años de edad,  es bachiller, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos en esta relación han procreado dos hijos.

José se dedica a la carpintería desde que tenía 12 años de edad, oficio que el papá le enseño, ya que su padre se ha dedicado siempre a esta actividad de carpintería de cajas para la funerarias del municipio. Él trabaja como empleado elaborando las cajas para las funerarias, pero también tiene una carpintería en la casa fábrica camas, jugueteras, sillas, mesas, etc.  en este trabajo le ayuda el padre en un horario de las 4 pm a las 7 pm ya que el otro trabajo lo hace de las 7 am a las 4 pm

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar un cepillo eléctrico, una sierra cortadora de madera que esto le hace falta para dejar en buen estado los muebles esto le ayudara mucho, ya que se le arruinaron las sierras que tenía y comprarla así de una sola vez con lo que le queda es difícil por eso ha acudido al crédito y de las ganancias ira pagando su cuota del crédito.

Los sueños de José son los de tener una carpintería grande y en un futuro independizare ya a elaborar cajas, ya que ese negocio es bastante rentable y así darle todo los que sus hijos necesiten, su estudio y que se preparen académicamente y que su esposa  no le falte nada.
texts.en:
José, 32, has his diploma.  His wife is a homemaker and they've had two children together.

José has made a living  as a carpenter since he was 12 years old.  His father taught him the job, because he, too, has always worked in the field of carpentry making caskets for the town.  José works as an employee making caskets, but he also has a shop at home and makes beds, toy chests, chairs, tables, etc.  In that job his father helps him from 4 p.m. to 7 p.m., because the other job is from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m.

The loan he's requesting from CrediCampo is to buy a wood brush, a power saw that he needs to leave the furniture in good condition.  This will help him a lot because the saws he had got ruined.  It's difficult to buy it all at once, so he's asking for the loan.  He'll make his loan payments with his profits.

José's dream is to have a big furniture shop and go out on his own in the future to make caskets, because it's a very profitable business.  That way he can give his children everything they need, their education and academic preparation, and his wife will have everything she needs.

loans.use: to buy a wood brush, a power saw

loans.name: Arquimides Antonio

texts.es:
Arquímides se dedica la albañilería desde hace 10 años, este trabajo lo aprendió de un amigo que lo invitaba a que trabajar como ayudante y así aprendió el trabajo y lo ha seguido haciendo; pero también, por las tardes trabaja la agricultura.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar dos sacos de abono para el cultivo de la milpa que ha hecho, ya que las de invierno le fue mal en esta espera prepararla bien y espera en Dios que sean buenas, ya que este crédito lo utilizara para la agricultura. Con el crédito anterior compro 5 pliegos de lámina, 3 bolsas de cemento y 4 horcones para construir el baño de su casa que estaba muy viejo; pero también con este préstamo busca el alquiler de 7,000 metros cuadrados de tierra para el cultivo y gracias a ese crédito él ya tiene el baño en buen estado

Sus sueños, son poder ayudar a sus hijos que terminen los estudios y tener maíz este próximo año  para que no falte la tortilla en la casa, ni la comida. Con las ganancias que obtenga
de esta cosecha, sembrara más el próximo año y así poder tener más y así cada año poder cultivar más.
texts.en:
Arquimides has been a bricklayer for 10 years. He learned this work from a friend who invited him to work as an assistant and that is how he learned the trade. He has continued doing it, but he also farms in the afternoon.
The loan he is requesting is in order to buy two sacks of fertilizer to cultivate the field he made since that from the winter went badly and in this he hopes to prepare it well.  He hopes to God that it will be good since this loan will be used for agriculture.  With the previous loan, he bought five sheets of corrugated tin, three bags of cement, and four uprights in order to construct the bathroom of his house which is very old.  But also with this loan he looks forward to renting 7,000 square meters of land to cultivate and thanks to that loan he already has the bathroom in good condition.
His dreams are to be able to help his children finish their education and have corn this next year so they won't have a shortage of tortillas or food in the home. With the earnings he will make from this harvest, he will plant more next year so he can have more and plant more every year.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of fertilizer in order to cultivate the field he made since that from the winter went badly and this time he hopes to prepare it well.

loans.name: El Molino Group

texts.es:
En la comunidad donde habita el grupo El Molino, el maíz es el alimento básico para las familias. Para hacer la masa de maóz, los granos se calientan con agua y con con cal durante algunos minutos, después la mezcla se muele bien para obtener la masa y esta puede tener distintas tonalidades como blanco, amarillo, negro, azul y rosado. Además, la masa de maíz permite elaborar una gran variedad de platillos mexicanos: tacos, quesadillas, gorditas, enchiladas, chilaquiles, huaraches, tacos dorados, tostadas y los famosos tamales. Esto no podría lograrse sin la ayuda de un molino de nixtamal.


Las integrantes del grupo platican que en casa de Lucía hay un molino al cual acuden personas de la comunidad para preparar su nixtamal y en referencia a este, al solicitar su crédito a VisionFund México, eligieron el nombre que ahora las identifica.

Lucia aún conserva su molino pero invertirá su crédito en alimento para becerros al igual que Maximina. Mientras que María Cruz y Nicolasa invertirán en alimento para sus borreguitos. Rosaura por otro lado, invertirá 

Rosaura tiene 32 años de edad, es mamá de dos niños de los cuales solo uno de ellos estudia. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora “Solo termine mi educación primaria y de inmediato me fui a trabajar a otra ciudad donde tomé algunos cursos de estilismo, regresé y decidí poner un local para dar mis servicios”. Afortunadamente, su clientela crecía poco a poco y con el tiempo, Rosaura se vio obligada a buscar otro local más grande. Después conoció al padre de sus hijos quien se dedicaba a vender ropa y a pesar de su separación, ella aprendió del negocio y ahora en su estética también vende ropa. Asimismo aprovecha los espacios en mercados para vender esta mercancía. Esta vez, Rosaura necesita invertir en más ropa. Ella es muy feliz con sus dos actividades aunque menciona que la distancia es una dificultad para ella. Todas las mañanas se tiene que levantar a las 5:30 am para poder prepararse y llevar a su hijo a la escuela y llegar a su establecimiento justo a tiempo para abrir. Rosaura atiende a sus clientes de 8 am a 7 pm y de allí hace una hora más para regresar a casa. Es así que su sueño es tener un local más cerca. Sonriendo comentó “No sé pero no me gustaría dejar nunca mi estética es el negocio al que más cariño le tengo”. 

*La fotografía se tomo en un jardín en el centro del municipio donde viven los integrantes. Rosaura viste un chaleco azul*
texts.en:
In the community where the El Molino ('The Mill") group lives, corn is the basic food for families. To make corn meal, the grains must be heated with water and lime for a few minutes.  Then, everything must be mixed together to form the dough, which is a combination of distinct colors (white, yellow, black, blue, and pink). This corn dough is used to make a wide variety of traditional Mexican dishes, including tacos, quesadillas, enchiladas, gorditas, chilaquiles, masa tortillas, fried tacos, tostados and the famous tamales.  This type of cooking would not be possible without a corn mill.

There is a corn mill in Lucía's house where people from the community go to prepare this typical corn grain mixture. Because of the importance of the corn mill, the members chose this as their group name. They are requesting support from VisionFund México. 

Lucia still maintains her mill, but she will invest her portion of the loan in food for her calves; Maximina will do the same. Maria Cruz and Nicolasa will invest in food for their lambs.

Rosaura is the final member of the group. She is thirty-two years old and is the mother of two children; one of them is in school.  She is a very enterprising woman and says, "I only finished primary school. Immediately after, I started working in another city where I took a few styling classes. I then returned to my hometown and decided to start my own small shop where I could offer my services." Fortunately, her customer base has grown bit by bit over time and she is consequently looking for a larger space for her shop. She met the father of her children, who sold clothes.  Despite the fact that they are now separated, she still learned the business and she now sells clothing too.  Rosaura also takes advantage of the local markets and sells her merchandise at a stall there. 

Rosaura needs to invest in more clothing. She is very happy with her two selling locations although the distance between them is sometimes difficult. Every morning, she gets up at 5:30am to get ready, bring her son to school, and get to her shop in time to open. Rosaura helps customers from 8am to 7pm and then spends another hour traveling back home.

For this reason, she dreams of having her shop closer to home. With a smile on her face she says "I don't know, but I would like to never leave my little shop since it is one I love most."

The photograph was taken in a garden in the center of town where the members live. Rosaura is the one wearing the blue vest.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

location.town: San Juan Jalpa, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for fishing boat building such as plywood, nails, paint and others

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.ru:
Виталий — из Гладковки. Ему 32 года, он женат и у него маленькие дети. Уже 12 лет он занимается тепличным хозяйством: выращивает на 1.1 га в теплицах ранние и поздние овощи — огурцы, капусту брокколи, капусту пекинскую и белокачанную, баклажаны, помидоры. 
Виталий на 40 000 гривен хочет закупить пленку, удобрения и семена, а также установить отопление в теплицах, чтобы урожай созревал быстрее и не перемерзал. Виталий считает, что у его бизнеса неплохие перспективы и поэтому последующую прибыль намерен вкладывать в содержание и расширение своего тепличного хозяйства.
texts.en:
Vitalyi is from the village of Gladovka. He is 32 years old, married, and the father of young children. For 12 years he has been engaged in greenhouse farming: on 1.1. ha [2.7 acres] of greenhouse soil,    he grows early and late   vegetable crops:  cucumbers, broccoli, napa cabbage, white cabbage, eggplant/aubergines, and tomatoes.

Vitalyi needs 40,000 UAH to buy greenhouse film, fertilizers and seeds to install a heating system in his greenhouses, so that his crops would ripen faster and be protected from frost. Vitalyi believes that his business has a good outlook, and therefore he intends to invest his revenue into the maintenance and expansion of his greenhouses. 
.

loans.use: to purchase plastic covering, fertilizers and seeds as well as install a heating system in his greenhouses.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 37 years old and married with two children.

Alma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Alma has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Alma aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a gasoline retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy additional containers of gasoline to sell for her gasoline retailing business.

Dina has been in this business for two years. Dina earns more income from her general store.

Dina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Fabrice

texts.en:
Fabrice is 31 years old. He is married with one child, age of two, who does not yet go to school. He has been farming for six years. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers and pay for workers for maize production. The profits from the farming will be used to buy land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and pay workers for maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy thread for traditional outfits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic covering, seeds, fertilizers and arches for his greenhouses.

loans.name: Jesus Pan De Vida Group

texts.es: El grupo “JESUS PAN DE VIDA” esta conformada por mujeres trabajadoras. Dedicadas a prestar servicios y al comercio minorista. Katherine tiene 20 años de edad es conviviente con un hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatillas para niños y damas y caballeros. Y en sus días libres se dedica a la venta de lencería a través de catálogos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más zapatillas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Katherine es la que se encuentra adjuntada en la parte superior derecho por motivos que no pudo estar presente en la reunión por motivos laborales.
texts.en: The "Jesus Pan de Vida" group is composed of hard-working women who make a living offering services and in retail commerce.  Katherine, 20, lives with her dependent son.  She makes her living from the sale of shoes for children, ladies and men.  And in her spare time, she sells lingerie from catalogs.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of more shoes.  The group thanks the Kiva investors for the loans offered.  Katherine is the one to be found in the attachment in the upper right  because she couldn't be present in the meeting for work-related reasons.

loans.use: to buy shoes for children, ladies and men.

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma is 41 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Anselma is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Anselma has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Anselma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Arlene works hard to support her family.

She has a bamboo-stripe-weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and raising pigs. Arlene is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional bamboo and other materials for her bamboo weaving business.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bamboo and other materials for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a new receiver for the TV in her house

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 46 years old and married with ten children.

Brenda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Brenda has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Brenda aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 31 years old. She is married with two children, aged 1 and 4, who do not yet go to school. She has been farming for maize production. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for maize production. The profits from the farming will used to improve her standard of living.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for maize production.

loans.name: Luciano Eladio

texts.es:
Luciano  tiene 64 años de edad, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos, el primer hijo que el tiene ya tiene familia separada y a sus tres últimos hijos son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela que les queda cerca de la comunidad, los hijos de Luciano se ha convertido en el motivo de la lucha de trabajar cada día para brindarles un futuro mejor y una mejor condición de vida.
	
Durante 30 años ha venido trabajando con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación en el trabajo de carpintero en su casa de habitación ubicado en su comunidad, también teniendo una segunda actividad como agricultor en su comunidad. 

Los fines con que el desea realizar un préstamo, es en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como block y hierro para la construcción de su vivienda y  es para  la realización de su más grande sueño en la construcción de una vivienda para tener las condiciones de vidas adecuadas.

Una de las más grandes aspiraciones de Luciano es poder vender sus productos en su comunidad para que las personas conozcan del trabajo que el y sus hijos realizan, he dar estudios a sus hijos para que lleguen a profesionales.
texts.en:
Luciano, 64, is married with four children. His oldest son already has his own family, and his three younger sons are excellent students at the school near their town. Luciano's children have become his motivation to work hard every day so that he can offer them a better future and better living conditions.

For 30 years, he has been working from home as a carpenter with plenty of effort and dedication. He also has a second business activity as a farmer in his town.

With this loan, his goal is to buy construction materials, such as blocks and iron, to build his home. He will then accomplish his greatest dream of building a home to have adequate living conditions.

One of his greatest wishes is to be able to sell his products in his town so that people will come to know his work and that of his children. He would also like to give his children an education so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Edgardo Enrique

texts.es: De madres y hermanas  confeccionistas proviene la aptitud en este arte que practica Edgardo para generara ingresos y sostener a su familia. Como operarias la madre, su hermana y Edgardo decidieron emprender su propia aventura independiente en su propia casa y vender prendas de vestir en pueblos aledaños, como Sabanagrande, Palmar de Varela, y otros ubicados en la Ruta oriental de  departamento del Atlántico. Así fue como tomando sus ahorros compraron maquinarias, equipos, herramientas e insumos y se pusieron a coser hace 2 años. Sus productos los venden puerta a puerta en todos los pueblos del municipio del Atlántico y para ello compran directamente la materia prima e insumos y accesorios en almacenes especializados de confecciones, donde les ofrecen descuentos especiales. Su meta mas adelante es lograr una mayor productividad con nuevas maquinarias, para incrementar sus ventas y ganar aun mas. Pues Edgardo sueña con darle estudios a sus 5 hijos, hasta convertirlos en profesionales exitosos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas e insumos , preparándose así para la época mas comercial de año, el último trimestre. Con esta inversión producirá blusas y camisetas que son los productos mas solicitados por su clientela en esta temporada y con ellos conseguirá tener buena venta.
texts.en:
Edgardo's aptitude in the art of sewing stems from having a mother and sisters who sew. This business activity generates an income to sustain his family. As workers, he, his mother, and his sister decided to start up their own independent business in their own home, selling clothing garments in nearby towns such as Sabanagrande, Palmar de Varela, and other towns on the eastern route of the Atlántico department. They saved up to buy sewing machines, equipment, tools, and supplies and started sewing two years ago.

They sell their products door-to-door in all of the towns in Atlántico. They buy their materials, supplies, and accessories directly from sewing warehouses where they are offered special discounts. Their goal is to obtain better productivity with new machines to increase their sales and earn even more.

Edgardo dreams of giving an education to his five children so that they can become successful professionals. He is applying for a Kiva loan, his first with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to buy primary materials and supplies. He will then prepare for the biggest commercial season of the year, the last trimester. With this investment, he will produce blouses and shirts, which are the products his clients demand most during this season. With these products, he will achieve good sales.

loans.use: to buy primary materials and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman and a mother of five children from Concepcion, Bohol. She is engaged in a fishing business with her husband. Fishing has given them their income for the past 10 years. Edna earns a supplemental income from her hog-raising business. 

Edna is requesting a loan from CEVI to buy new fishing nets and additional piglets to raise. With a loan, she will be able to improve her fishing and hog-raising businesses thus augmenting her income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is 37 years old, married to Caroline, and blessed with three children aged between five and six months. He has been selling herbal products and cosmetics to his customers for the last 10 years and earns a monthly income of KES.40,000 (Kenyan Shillings).
	 	
He has applied for his first loan of 30,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy  more stock of herbal medicine and cosmetics for sale.                                                                                           
 
Andrew will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs.He hopes to grow his business and open a bigger studio.

loans.use: to buy more stock of herbal medicine and cosmetics

loans.name: Bartolo

texts.es:
La agricultura es una actividad solamente apta para toda aquella persona que ama la tierra como a una madre, como una engendradora de futuros para la vida.  Buenos futuros de esperanzas para generaciones siguientes. Es el trabajo de Bartolo de 34 años de edad  casado y cuenta con cuatro hijos de los cuales uno ya tiene familias separadas y los tres últimos son estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad.
	
La actividad que Bartolo realiza es la siembra de: papas, zanahorias, frijol y maíz. Dicha actividad lo realiza en su comunidad donde el vive, sus productos lo comercializa en el mercado local de Sololá el eligió esta actividad porque cuenta con conocimiento de manejo en las hortalizas que lo heredo de su padre. La segunda actividad que el realiza es jornalero en su comunidad, el lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 10 años y tiene una muy buena experiencia en cultivos.

El uso que Bartolo le dará al crédito es para la compra de semillas de zanahoria y abonos químicos e orgánicos para que su producción se de zanahorias para que sea buena este año.  Uno de los grandes sueños de el es la construcción de unos cuartos para sus hijos y para que ellos tengan las condiciones de vidas adecuadas y ver que sus hijos se conviertan en profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
Farming is an activity which is only suitable for those who love the earth like a mother, as a creator of futures in life, good futures full of hope for future generations. This is Bartolo's work. He is 34 years old and married with four children, of whom one already has his own family. The three youngest children are studying at the local school.

Bartolo's business activity is growing potatoes, carrots, beans and corn. He works in the same town where he lives and sells his products at the local market in Sololá. He chose this business activity because he has knowledge of growing crops, which he inherited from his father. His second business activity is a job as a day laborer in his town. He has had this activity for 10 years and he has very good experience with crops.

Bartolo will use this loan to buy carrot seeds and chemical and organic fertilizer so that his carrot crops will be good this year. One of his biggest dreams is to build rooms for his children so that they will have adequate living conditions, and to see them become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy carrot seeds and organic and chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 45 years old and single.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Clarita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Clarita has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 24,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

Edna has been in this business for 23 years. Edna also earns other income from raising livestock.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Artesanos Del Oro Group

texts.es:
La historia, el arte y la cultura son principales características de un fantástico municipio del Estado de México que además fue reconocido como "Pueblo Mágico". El lugar es famoso por albergar majestuosas casas, monumentos y el palacio municipal, pero principalmente por su cafetería: un vagón de tren que simplemente quedó detenido. Anteriormente, la población estaba llena de minas de oro, pero fueron vaciadas en su totalidad. Ahora ya solo quedan recuerdos y los pequeños carros donde solían transportar el mineral. Hoy en día los habitantes son empleados, comerciantes o artesanos.

Los integrantes del grupo “Artesanos del Oro” están muy orgullosos por pertenecer a un lugar con tanta historia y precisamente decidieron utilizar la palabra que hace referencia a su actividad.

Angélica pertenece al grupo, ella tiene 37 años de edad y está casada desde hace 15 años con el señor Sergio quien trabaja como chofer en la capital del país. La pareja tiene tres hijos, de los cuales dos estudian la preparatoria y uno la secundaria por lo que los gastos escolares son importantes y el sueldo del señor Sergio no siempre es suficiente. Afortunadamente, desde hace 15 años también se han dedicado a la cría y engorda de cerdos. Con su préstamo, Angélica comprará alimento para los cerdos que tiene en casa: 16 de grandes y 10 más de apenas unos meses. Invertir de esta manera (mayoreo) le ayudará ya que explica que en un sólo día, sus 10 cerdos grandes llegan a comer hasta 30 kilos de alimento que tiene un costo aproximado de $250 pesos (USD$ 20) y es precisamente el costo de la comida de los alimentos lo que representa el mayor reto en esta actividad.

“Me gusta cuidar mucho a los cerditos mas pequeños. Mi sueño es llegar a tener un pequeño ranchito donde tengamos diferentes tipos de animales como borregos, pollos, caballos, vacas, etc". Sin embargo la preparación académica de sus hijos también es primordial para Angélica:su hijo mayor quiere estudiar odontología, el segundo contabilidad y el más pequeño quiere ser veterinario y muestra demasiado interés por los animales que crían sus padres.  

Por otro lado, Magalli y Abigail, hermanas e integrantes, tuvieron la oportunidad de viajar a la ciudad de Mérida y participar en una feria para vender sus artesanías de ocoshal y latón. “El primer día ya nos queríamos regresar porque solo vendimos dos piezas". En los siguientes días el panorama cambio totalmente porque lograron vender más de 70 piezas en total. Ellas están muy agradecidas por esta oportunidad que les brindó VisionFund México ya que lograron conseguir incluso clientes de otros países quienes les han encargado algunos pedidos.

Acerca de los demás clientes: Carmen invertirá su préstamo en su carpintería, Antonio en medicamento para sus cerdos, Magalli y Abigail en material para sus artesanías.  

*La foto fue tomada en el patio de la casa de Magalli y Abigail, lugar donde llevan a cabo sus reuniones de grupo. Angélica viste sudadera azul marino.
texts.en:
History, art, and culture are the main characteristics of this fantastic municipality in Mexico, which has been recognized as a "Magical Town". This place is famous for its majestic houses, monuments, and its municipal palace, but mainly for its café: a railroad car which simply stopped moving. The town was once full of gold mines, but they were completely emptied out. Now all that is left are the memories and the small carts that used to transport minerals. Today the city's inhabitants are employees, tradespeople or artisans.

The members of the “Artesanos del Oro” ("Gold Artisans") group are proud to belong to a place with so much history, and they decided to use exactly the word that references its activity.

Angélica, 37, belongs to this group. She has been married to Sergio for 15 years. He works as a driver in the country's capital. The couple has three children, of whom two are studying at a preparatory school and one is studying at secondary school. Their school expenses are important and Sergio's salary is not always sufficient. Fortunately, they have also been raising and fattening pigs for 15 years. 

With this loan, Angélica will buy feed for the pigs they have at home: 16 large pigs and 10 more which are just a few months old. Investing in this way (wholesale) will help her. As she explains, her ten biggest pigs can eat up to 30 kilos of feed in a single day, which costs about 250 pesos (about 20 U.S. dollars). The cost of feed is the greatest challenge in this business activity.

"I really like taking care of the little piglets. My dream is to have a small ranch where we will have different types of animals such as sheep, chicken, horses, cows, etc." However, her children's education is also very important for Angélica. Her oldest child wants to study dentistry, her second child wants to study accounting, and the youngest wants to be a veterinarian, showing interest for the animals his parents take care of.

Meanwhile, Magalli and Abigail, sisters and members of the group, had the opportunity to travel to the city of Mérida to participate in a fair to sell their woven leaf and brass artisan crafts. "On the first day, we already wanted to come home because we only sold two pieces." During the following days, the story completely turned around and they managed to sell 70 pieces in total. They are very grateful for this opportunity, which was provided by VisionFund México, because they also managed to obtain clients from other countries who have made some orders.

Regarding the other borrowers: Carmen will invest the loan in his carpentry business, Antonio will invest in medication for his pigs, and Magalli and Abigail will buy materials for their artisan crafts.

This photo was taken on Magalli and Abigail's courtyard, where the group meetings take place. Angélica is wearing a navy sweatshirt.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of groundnuts and gallons of palm oil.

loans.name: Guadalupe Monserrate

texts.es:
En un sitio llamado Higuerón en la ciudad de Portoviejo  cada quince días se reúnen los socios  del Grupo De Crédito San Antonio De Higuerón, este es un lugar en el cual la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y cría de animales.
En este lugar vive la señora Guadalupe, tiene 37 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de  esta  relación tienen tres hijos de 20, 18 y 7 años, todos sus hijos estudian en universidad, colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Guadalupe es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto  ayudarle a su marido con los gastos de estudios de sus hijos se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa, zapatos y productos de Belcorp, Yanbal, Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja casi todos los días ya sea en las mañanas o tardes depende de lo que necesiten sus clientes, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, zapatos y ropa. Lleva tres ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos compra productos de promoción que luego vende al precio normal con lo cual le quedan mejores ganancias. Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en:
In a place called Higuerón in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the San Antonio De Higuerón credit group meet together every 15 days. This is an area where the majority of people work either in farming or raising animals. 

This is where Guadalupe lives. She is 37 years old and has a life partner with whom she has three children that are 20, 18, and 7 years old. All her children are studying, one in the university, one in high school, and the youngest in primary school. Her husband is a shopkeeper.

Guadalupe is a housewife who in order to have her own resources, and in this way help her husband cover the costs of education for their children, also has her business. She sells clothes and shoes as well as Belcorp, Yanbal and Avon products (beauty products, make-up, perfume and accessories for women). She works almost every day either in the morning or afternoon, depending on her client’s needs. She sells her products on credit and collects installments every eight days. She has been working at this activity for eight years, and manages to make a living. 

This loan will be used to buy perfume, creams, make-up, shoes and clothes. She has completed three cycles in the credit group and likes it because with the loans obtained she can buy promotional products and then sell them at normal price, which gives her better earnings.
