Her dream is to have her own store. 
.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, make-up, shoes and clothes.

loans.name: María Palmira

texts.es:
En un sitio llamado Higuerón en la ciudad de Portoviejo  cada quince días se reúnen los socios  del Grupo De Crédito San Antonio De Higuerón, este es un lugar en el cual la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y cría de animales.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 64 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de  esta  relación tienen cinco hijos mayores de edad. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña María se dedica a la cría de pollos en una pequeña granja, compra los pollos en Portoviejo cuando están pequeñitos los tiene por dos o tres meses y luego los vende enteros o por libras a personas de la localidad y muchas veces entrega en tiendas. Ella también le da parte del crédito a su marido el cual se dedica a la venta de legumbres al por mayor, el trabaja en el mercado de mayoristas de la ciudad, de esta forma ellos se ganan la vida honradamente. 
Este crédito es para comprar más pollos, frutas y legumbres. Lleva tres ciclos en el Grupo De crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
In a place called Higuerón in the city of Portoviejo, the lending club Santo Antonio de Higuerón meets every 15 days. Most of the inhabitants in this area work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Maria, 64, is married and has 5 grown children. Her husband is a merchant. Maria raises chickens on a small farm. She buys the chickens in Portoviejo when they are little and keeps them for two or three months before selling them whole or by the pound to neighbors and nearby stores. She also will share credit with her husband who sells vegetables at wholesale, working in the wholesale market in the city. The two of them together earn an honorable living.

This loan is to buy more chickens, fruit and vegetables. She has been in the group for three cycles and likes it because of the loans. Her dream is to have good health.

loans.use: to buy chickens, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Katiuska María

texts.es:
En un sitio llamado Higuerón en la ciudad de Portoviejo  cada quince días se reúnen los socios  del Grupo De Crédito San Antonio De Higuerón, este es un lugar en el cual la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y cría de animales.
En este lugar vive la señora Katiuska, tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 7 y 3 años, el mayor estudia en escuela. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. 
Doña Katiuska es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder sacar adelante a sus hijos se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y productos de Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien,  lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, zapatos y ropa. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en:
In a place called Higuerón in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the San Antonio De Higuerón communal bank meet every 15 days. The majority of inhabitants in this area work in agriculture and livestock.

Katiuska, 28, lives in this area. She is a single mother of two children, ages 3 and 7. Her older child is in school. She lives in her parents' house.

Katiuska is a stay-at-home mom. To earn her own income and provide for her children, she sells clothing, shoes and Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories). She works three days per week for two to three hours per day. She sells products on credit and collects every eight days. She has had this business activity for eight years and it is going very well. Perfume and cosmetics are the products she sells most.

She will use this loan to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, shoes and clothing. She is a founding member of the communal bank, and she likes it because the payments are easy to make. Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, shoes, and clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her pig raising capability and take care of her son.

loans.name: Milton Alexi

texts.es:
En un sitio llamado Higuerón en la ciudad de Portoviejo  cada quince días se reúnen los socios  del Grupo De Crédito San Antonio De Higuerón, este es un lugar en el cual la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y cría de animales.
En este lugar vive don Milton, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 5 años el cual estudia en escuela. La mujer trabaja en un hospital.
El señor Milton es chofer profesional y trabaja en un camión transportando mercadería para una empresa de la localidad, pero para generar mejores ingresos para su hogar hace 7 años surtió en su casa una pequeña tienda de víveres, el con la ayuda de su mujer han podido programar sus horarios para que siempre haya alguien en su negocio y sus clientes puedan tener la mejor atención, esta es la razón por lo cual su negocio crece cada día más por la buena atención que le brindan a los clientes.
Este crédito es para  comprar productos de primera necesidad para surtir aun más su tienda. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace 3 ciclos y le gusta porque con los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su tienda
texts.en:
In Higuerón in the city of Portoviejo, the lending group San Antonio De Higuerón meets every 15 days. The inhabitants of this area mostly work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Milton, 32, is married and has a 5 year old son who is in school. His wife works in a hospital. Milton is a professional driver and works in a truck transporting merchandise for a business, but to make more money he started a small grocery store in his home 7 years ago. With the help of his wife, they have been able to plan their schedules so that someone is always at the store and their customers can get better attention. Due to their good customer service, his business is growing day by day.

This loan is to buy basic goods to stock their store. He has been with the lending group for three cycles and likes it because the loans finance his business. His dream is to continue improving his store.

loans.use: to buy basic grocery products to stock his store.

loans.name: Evelyn Edith

texts.es:
En un sitio llamado Higuerón en la ciudad de Portoviejo  cada quince días se reúnen los socios  del Grupo De Crédito San Antonio De Higuerón, este es un lugar en el cual la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y cría de animales.
En este lugar vive la señora Evelyn, tiene 21 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  pero aun no tiene hijos. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Evelyn es una muy buena esposa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) su forma de venta es puerta a puerta. Ella trabaja cuatro días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Lo que más vende son los perfumes. Lleva más de 5 años que se dedica a las ventas con la cual ayuda a su marido a salir adelante en el hogar.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In Higuerón in the city of Portoviejo, the lending group San Antonio De Higuerón meets every 15 days. The inhabitants of this area generally work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Evelyn, 21, is married but does not yet have children. Her husband is a driver. Evelyn is a very good wife who sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women) in order to have her own resources. She sells door to door, working 4 days a week. She sells on credit and collects money every 8 days. Perfumes are her best sellers. She has been in this field for more than 5 years and the sales help her husband to get ahead at home.

This loan is to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics and costume jewelry. She's been with the lending group since it began and likes it because of the help she gets from the loan. Her dream is to give her children the very best.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es: María de 57 años de edad es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable siempre esta buscando la manera de salir adelante, es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo de 21 años de edad, ella se dedica desde hace 17 años a la venta de ropa, comercializa de forma ambulante, María  esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de ropa por mayor para damas y caballeros y asi obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria is 57 years old and is very responsible and hardworking woman who is always looking for a way to get ahead.  She is a single mother and lives in a home of her own with her 21 year old son.  She has been selling clothing on foot for 17 years.  Maria is asking for a loan to buy men’s and women’s clothing in quantity so she can increase her income.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Ana, tiene 58 años de edad, está soltera, tiene 2 hijos, vive con ellos y su madre en  el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Tiene su propio negocio de venta de ropa como su fuente de ingresos. Vende camisas, blusas, short, jeans, etc. Este negocio lo tiene hace 5 años y las ventas las realiza de forma ambulante. Anterior a este negocio se dedicaba a vender tortillas de maíz. Ha solicitado varios prestamos para mantener su negocio, actualmente solicita otro por 21,000 lempiras, el que invertirá en la compra de jeans, camisas y blusas para vender y así podrá tener más producto para incrementar las ventas. Su plan es crecer como comerciante y crecer en su negocio para darle sustento a su familia.
texts.en: Ana is 58 years old, single, and lives with her two children and her mother in Azacualpa, Santa Barbara.  She has her own clothing sales business as a source of income and sells shirts, blouses, shorts, jeans, etc.  She has had this business for five years and sells on foot.  Prior to this business she used to sell corn tortillas.  She has requested several loans to maintain her business and is currently asking for a loan in the amount of 21,000 Lempiras to buy jeans, shirts, and blouses so she can have more inventory to sell.  She plans to grow her business and to grow as a merchant so she can support her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Calixto

texts.es:
La agricultura es una actividad solamente apta para toda aquella persona que ama la tierra como a una madre, como una engendradora de futuros para la vida.  Buenos futuros de esperanzas para generaciones siguientes. Es el trabajo de Calixto de 63 años de edad  soltero y cuenta con cinco hijos de los cuales uno ya tiene familias separadas y los cuatro últimos son estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad.
	
La actividad que Calixto realiza es la siembra de verduras. Dicha actividad lo realiza en su comunidad donde el vive, sus productos lo comercializa en el mercado local de Sololá el eligió esta actividad porque cuenta con conocimiento de manejo en las hortalizas que lo heredo de su padre. La segunda actividad que el realiza es jornalero en su comunidad, el lleva realizando dichas actividades durante 45 años y tiene una muy buena experiencia en cultivos de verduras.

El uso que Calixto le dará al crédito es para la compra de insumos agrícolas tales como semillas y abonos ya que para el son indispensables contar con esos productos para que el pueda realizar su trabajo para así tener un ingreso económico par el sostenimiento de su familia.

Uno de los grandes sueños de el es la construcción de unos cuartos para sus hijos y para que ellos tengan las condiciones de vidas adecuadas y ver que sus hijos se conviertan en profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
Agriculture is a suitable job only for those people who love the earth like a mother, like a creator of futures for life, good futures of hope for the following generations.

Agriculture is Calixto's job.  He's 63 years old and single, and he has five children; one already has his own family and the other four attend school in the community.	

Calixto's job is growing vegetables, which he does in the community where he lives.  He sells his crops in the local market in Sololá.  He chose this job because he knows how to handle vegetables, which he learned from his father.  The second job he does is day laborer in his community.  He has done these jobs for 45 years and has very good experience growing vegetables.

Calixto will use the loan to buy agricultural inputs such as seeds and soil amendments, products that are indispensable to him for doing his job.  That way he'll have an income to support his family.

One of his big dreams is to build some rooms for his children so they have decent circumstances and to see his children become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as seeds and soil amendments

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal por catálogos desde hace varios años, comercializa en las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su casa y ya tiene clientela establecida  por la calidad de los productos y los precios, Blanca está solicitando un crédito para la compra de shampoo, crema, desodorantes, perfumes, acondicionadores, etc. para obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Blanca lives with her husband and daughter in a home of her own.  She sells personal products via catalog and has been doing so for several years.  She sells in the various neighborhoods near her home and has steady customers around town, given her prices and the quality of her products.  Blanca is asking for a loan to buy shampoo, cream, deodorants, perfumes, conditioners, etc. so she can increase her income.

loans.use: to buy personal products for sale.

loans.name: Lina Evelyn

texts.es:
En un sitio llamado Higuerón en la ciudad de Portoviejo  cada quince días se reúnen los socios  del Grupo De Crédito San Antonio De Higuerón, este es un lugar en el cual la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y cría de animales.
En este lugar vive la señora Lina, tiene 39 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de  esta  relación tienen tres hijos de 21, 13 y 11  años, los dos menores estudian en colegio y  escuela. Su esposo es chofer y tiene un taller de cerrajería.
Doña Lina es una mujer muy trabajadora y colaboradora con el hogar, ella realiza el crédito para ella y para ayudarle a su esposo con su negocio, él tiene un taller de cerrajería en la localidad, allí elabora puertas, ventanas y otras estructuras con el hierro, el trabaja todos los días ya que no le falta trabajo, mientras que ella también se dedica a la cría de pollos para lo cual tiene una pequeña granja en la cual cría sus pollos y se gana algo extra para el bien de su familia. Ella también en ocasiones le ayuda a su marido ya que sus actividades le permiten tener algo de tiempo.
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar alimento para pollos, hierro y pintura. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In a place called Higuerón in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the San Antonio De Higuerón credit group meet together every 15 days. This is an area where the majority of people work either in farming or raising animals. 

This is where Lina lives. She is 39 years old and has a life partner with whom she has three children that are 21, 13, and 11 years old. The two youngest children are studying, one in high school, and one in middle school. Her husband is a driver and also has a metalwork shop.

Lina is a very hardworking woman who contributes to her household. She is taking out this loan for herself and to help her husband with his business. He runs a metalwork shop in the area, where he makes doors, windows and other structures out of iron. He works every day because there is a lot of work to be done, while she also works raising chickens. For this she has a small barn where she raises her chickens and makes a little extra to benefit her family. Sometimes she also helps her husband when her activities leave her some free time. 

She will use this loan to buy chicken feed, as well as iron and paint. She has completed three cycles in the credit group and likes it because it is a very close-knit group. Her dream is to continue moving forward and give the best she can to her children.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed, as well as iron and paint.

loans.name: Dmytryi

texts.ru:
Предыдущую финансовую помощь от Кива Дмитрий вложил в приобретение грузового автомобиля «Газель» для работы на своем участке. Бизнес продолжает понемногу развиваться. Немного увеличился доход с огорода, получилось сделать пристройку к дому для кухни и санузла. Также вышло сделать и дома небольшой ремонт. Рядом с домом Дмитрий открыл небольшой магазин, стал торговать дополнительно продуктами питания. 
В этот раз на 40 000 гривен Дмитрий планирует закупить уголь для отопления в будущем сезоне. Уголь хочет приобрести заранее, потому что он очень дорожает и неизвестно, будет ли в продаже зимой.
texts.en:
Dmytryi used his previous Kiva loan to purchase a "Gazelle" truck, which he uses to work on his plot of land. He is still developing his farming business, little by little, and has seen an increase in his income.  He was able to build an addition to his house to create a kitchen and bathroom, and he also did some other minor home repairs. He has also opened a small shop next to his house, where he now sells his extra produce.

Dmytryi is taking a new loan of 40,000 hryvnia to buy some coal to heat his greenhouses over the next season.  He wants to buy coal early, as prices go up fast, and you can never know for sure if coal will still be available in the winter.

loans.use: to buy coal to heat his greenhouses.

loans.name: Benito Edgard

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Benito ; el socio tiene 01 hijo es viudo y tiene 51 años de edad, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de carpintería, el socio elabora diferentes tipos de muebles como camas, mesas entre otros, él socio  desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera pueda continuar apoyando a su familia.
El  socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de maderas.
El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a member of the “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN” communal bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Benito is 51 years old, a widower, and has a son.  He works as a carpenter and makes various kinds of furniture such as beds.  He wants to continue working in this manner so he can continue to support his family

He is asking for a loan to buy lumber.

He is very grateful for the loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Gladys Celia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MAQUIMANTA PURISUN, este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Gladys Celia, la socia tiene 26 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de botica, la socia vende diferentes tipos de medicamentos para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera continuar apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de jarabes entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas
texts.en:
She is a member of the MAQUIMANTA PURISUN communal bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Gladys Celia is 26 years old, single, and has a son.  She has a drugstore and sells different types of medications for her customers, and would like to continue working to support her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy syrups and other things.  She is grateful for the loan and is committed to meeting her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy syrups.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana está estudiando derecho, está cursando el tercer año y trabaja en la fiscalía, vive con sus  padres y comenta que su meta principal es ser una profesional bastante preparada y ser útil a la sociedad y a su país.
Ana esta poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder sobresalir en sus estudios,  y es por eso esta poniendo su mejor esfuerzo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder estar mas cerca de cumplir con su ideal de ser una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Ana has been studying law and is in her third year of working for the prosecutor.  She lives at home and says that her main goal is to become a well-prepared professional so she can be helpful to society and to her country

Ana is putting forth her best effort so she can complete her education.  She is asking for this loan to pay tuition and get closer to meeting her goal of becoming a good professional.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy peanuts.

loans.name: Jose Hernaldo

texts.es:
El éxito consiste en no desanimarse nunca, razón principal por la que José Hernaldo día a día trabaja arduamente para lograrlo. Tiene 23 años, está soltero y es egresado de la carrera de Ingeniería Industrial, carrera que estudió puesto que desde adolescente le interesaba el mundo de las empresas y las industrias. Hace dos años y medios trabaja como jefe de bodega en una empresa privada, a pesar de no estar en el área que se especializó, labora con muchas energías, puesto que asegura que es una oportunidad más para seguir adquiriendo conocimientos. 
Con ánimos de seguir profesionalizándose, José solicita el crédito para lograr pagar un posgrado. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que desea obtener mejores ofertas de trabajo. Sabe que tarde o temprano llegará a laborar en lo que más le apasiona y podrá poner en práctica todos los conocimientos adquiridos tantos los adquiridos en clases como en al jornada diaria. Es un joven carismático, inteligente y emprendedor, agradece el apoyo de su familia, quienes siempre lo motivan a cumplir sus sueños. Entre sus planes futuros está adquirir una maestría, espera cumplir su meta.
texts.en:
Success consists in never giving over to discouragement, which is why José Hernaldo works hard day after day to succeed. He is 23 years old, single, and has a diploma in industrial engineering, a career he studied because he has been interested in the world of business and industry since adolescence. For two and a half years he has worked as warehouse manager in a private company. Despite the fact that he is not working in the area of his specialization, he puts all his energy into his work, because he knows that it is another opportunity to continue learning new things.

His desire to continue his professional studies pushed Jose to request a loan that will allow him to finance graduate school. He has put all his confidence in this loan because he wants to accede to better job offers. He knows that sooner or later he will find a way to work in the field he is passionate about and put everything he has learned into practice, both the lessons learned in classes and those learned in daily life.  He is a charismatic, intelligent and proactive young man who gives thanks to his family for their support, for constantly encouraging him to realize his dreams. Among his dreams for the future is to graduate with a Masters degree, and he hopes to realize this goal.

loans.use: to finance a graduate degree.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabali est majoritairement composé des femmes mariées vivant avec leurs maris et leurs enfants dans des familles monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila dans la commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié.Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, chaussures plastiques, jus, habits, céréales et ustensiles. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Aminata (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une réputation dans la vente des chaussures plastiques. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 40 paires de chaussures plastiques en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila et en ambulant à une clientèle constituée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Aminata espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 85 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinjecté dans l’activité et subvenir aux petits besoins des enfants.
texts.en:
The group Sabali is composed mostly of married women living with their husbands and children in monogamous families. The women average 31 years of age and five children each, all living in Kanadjiguila, in Commune du Mandé / Cercle de Kati. They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. The group members have small-scale businesses involving plastic shoes, juice drinks, clothing, grains, and utensils.

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members had decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Aminata (the woman sitting at the far left in the photo) is known for selling plastic footwear. She intends to use her loan to purchase 40 pairs of plastic shoes wholesale in Bamako. By going door to door, she sells retail to a customer base composed mostly of women in Kanadjiguila.

With this loan, Ms. Aminata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 85,000 francs CFA that will be used to reinvest in her business and to meet the children’s sundry needs.

loans.use: to purchase plastic footwear

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es: Reina de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, desde hace 4 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Reina esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal, para seguir con la elaboración y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Reina is 33 years old and lives in a home of her own with her life partner.  She has been making and selling tortillas out of her home for four years.  She uses her income to pay some of the household expenses and is asking for a loan to buy dried corn and lime so she can continue production and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy dried corn and lime.

loans.name: Sewa Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Sewa vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 47 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village M’péba de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de tubercule et de grains. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  7eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Kadiatou  (la 1ere  femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de tubercules dans le village et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 7 sacs de pomme de terre à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison à dans le marché une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Kadiatou  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 75 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The five women in the Sewa group all live in traditional families. They are on average 47 years old with two children, and all live in the village of Segou M'péba (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, kinship, marriage and their income-generating activities in the village. They are retail merchants of  tubers (potatoes) and grain cereals. To expand their business, the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are in their seventh group loan cycle. 

Mrs. Kadiatou (the first woman standing from left to right in the photo) is a great tuber saleswoman, in the village and its surrounding area. She will use her loan to buy seven bags of potatoes in Segou. Retail sales are for cash and often on credit; either at home or in the market, to a mixed clientele. 

Mrs. Kadiatou hopes to achieve an average monthly profit of 75,000 CFA francs, which will be used for her children's small needs and also to expand her business. She wants to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: buy tubers (potatoes)

loans.name: Sinisigui Group

texts.fr:
Mariées équitablement dans des ménages monogamiques et polygamiques, les cinq membres du groupe Sinisigui ont en moyenne 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila dans la commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, fruits (bananes et oranges), tomates, jus et habits. Dans l’intention d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame  Fatoumata  (femme  assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de fruits (bananes et oranges). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 8 corbeilles d’oranges et 7 corbeilles de bananes à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila et parfois en ambulant à une clientèle mixtes. Madame Fatoumata  compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married [and equally divided] among monogamous and polygamous household, the five members of the group Sinisigui average 36 years of age and 4 children each. The women all live in Kanadjiguila, in Commune du Mandé / Cercle de Kati. And they know one another through ties of community and their revenue-generating businesses in Kanadjiguila. The group members have small-scale businesses involving fruit (bananas and oranges), tomatoes, juice drinks, and clothing. 

Intending to increase their business capital, the group members had decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Fatoumata (the woman sitting at the far right in the photo) is a major vendor of fruit (bananas and oranges). She intends to use her loan to purchase 8 baskets of oranges and 7 baskets of bananas in Médine. Her sales are made retail to a mixed customer base in Kanadjiguila and sometimes by going door to door.  

With this loan, Ms. Fatoumata is planning on a profit of 80,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and satisfying sundry household needs.

loans.use: to purchase fruit

loans.name: Walegnoumadon Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Walegnouma est composé de six femmes mariées majoritairement dans des ménages  monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 35ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Ouenzindougou commune du Mandé cercle de Kati et se sont  connues à travers des liens de voisinage.Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de,  chaussures plastiques, boissons, habits et sables. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Hadiaratou (femme arrêtée à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des chaussures plastiques  de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  50 paires de chaussures plastiques  en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Ouenzindougou à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Hadiaratou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The group Walegnouma is composed of six women married for the most part in monogamous households. The women average 35 years of age and four children each, all living in Ouenzindougou, in Commune du Mandé, Cercle de Kati. They know one another through ties of community. The group members have small-scale businesses involving plastic shoes, beverages, clothing, and sand.

With the goal of increasing their cash, the group members had decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Hadiaratou (the woman standing at the far right in the photo) is famous for selling plastic footwear of all sorts. She intends to use her loan to purchase 50 pairs of plastic shoes wholesale in Bamako. She sells retail to a customer base composed mostly of women in Ouenzindougou.

With this loan, Ms. Hadiaratou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA that will be used to reinvest in her business. Her goal is buy a plot of residential land through this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase shoes

loans.name: Uvaldo Encarnacion

texts.es: Uvaldo de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, no tiene hijos todavía, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 10 años, comercializa en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. parta poder continuar con sus cultivos y así obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: 31 year old Uvaldo lives in his own home with his life partner.  They don’t have any children yet.  He has been raising corn for ten years and sells around his home.  He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, compost, insecticide, etc. so he can continue with his farming and be able to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Tagne Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Tagne vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Angoulême de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce d’habillement, d’artisanal et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  2eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Assitan (la 1ere femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de pagne wax dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 8 pièces de pagne wax à Ségou et Bamako. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Assitan espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 25 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four women in the Tagne group all live in nuclear families. They are on average 42 years old with six children, and all live in the Angoulême neighborhood of Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, kinship, marriage and their income-generating activities in the neighborhood. They are retail merchants dealing in clothing, handicrafts and food preparations. To expand their business, the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are in their second group loan cycle.

Mrs. Assitan (the first woman standing from left to right in the photo) is a great seller of pagnes wax (colorful West-African fabric) in the neighborhood and its surrounding area. She will use her loan to buy eight lengths of pagne wax in Segou and Bamako. Retail sales are for cash and often on credit; either at home or in the market, to a mixed clientele.

Mrs. Assitan hopes to achieve an average monthly profit of 25,000 CFA francs, which will be used for her children's small needs and also to expand her business. She wants to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: buy pagnes wax (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica desde hace 5 años al cultivo de maíz, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la comercializa en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, don manuel esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografia para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo.
texts.en: Manuel is 38 years old and lives in a home of his own, along with his family.  He has been raising corn for five years and sells his harvest around his area.  Manuel is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, insecticide, etc. and also to improve the land shown in the image, so he can continue farming.  This is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 53 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Emma is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Emma has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Winfride

texts.en: Winfride is aged 29 years. She is married with two children, aged 1 and 4, who do not yet go to school. She has been selling fertilizers for maize production. With the loan, she would like to buy more fertilizers for maize production. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for maize production.

loans.name: Isha

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Isha. She is married and has seven children, aged 27, 22, 19, 18, 16, 15 and 12 years. In 2005, Isha established her kola nuts, palm oil, honey, wood, rice, etc., business. She began her business because she was brought up by her aunt, who was doing a local produce business. She got her experience from her aunt whom she was assisting in doing her business.  

Later she got married, and her husband gave her some amount of money to start her own business. She started selling local produce. Working six days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,815,800 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Isha requires a loan in order to buy piles of wood, bags of rice, kola nuts, gallons of honey and palm oil.  

In the future, Isha plans to reinvest in and improve her business and develop her land. The loan will help her maximized more profits and achieve her dreams. Her major challenges are inadequate capital and delays in payment from her customers. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy piles of wood, bags of rice, kola nuts, gallons of honey and palm oil.

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  femmes du groupe Badenya vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 47 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village Somonodougouni de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de condiment et de l’habillement. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  14eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Téné    cheickné (la 3eme femme assise de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiment de tout genre dans le village et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  une grande quantité de condiment à fana et à konodimini chez les maraichers. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Téné    cheickné    espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 20 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The five women in the Badenya group all live in traditional families. They are on average 47 years old with four children, and all live in the village of Somonodougouni of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, kinship, marriage and their income-generating activities in the village. They are retail merchants dealing in condiments and clothing. To expand their business the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are in their fourteenth group loan cycle.

Mrs. Téné cheickné (the third woman sitting from right to left in the photo) is a great seller of all kinds of condiments, in the village and its surrounding area. She will use her loan to buy a large quantity of condiments from greengrocers in Fana and Konodimini. Retail sales are for cash and often on credit; either at home or in the market, to a mixed clientele.

Mrs. Téné cheickné hopes to achieve an average monthly profit of 20,000 CFA francs, which will be used for her children's small needs and also to expand her business. She wants to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Bendia Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de cinq femmes, les membres du groupe Bendia sont majoritairement  mariés dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge de 32 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila  dans la commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et  de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font la vente de, légumes (concombres et tomates), arachides, habits et maïs. Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  3ème cycle de  prêt  solidaire.
Madame Bassira (femme arrêtée en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite) est une grande vendeuse de légumes (concombres et tomates). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 corbeilles de tomates et 3 corbeilles de concombres. Elles s’approvisionnent en légumes à Médine.  La revente se fait au comptant ou à crédit en ambulant et parfois par commande à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Bassira compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer les soins de santé des enfants. Elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The group Bendia is composed of five women married for the most part in monogamous households. The women average 32 years of age and five children each, all living in Kanadjiguila, in Commune du Mandé /Cercle de Kati. They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and their revenue-generating businesses. The group members sell vegetables (cucumbers and tomatoes), peanuts, clothing, and corn.

Concerned about building up their inventories, the group members had decided to turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Bassira (the woman standing second from the left in the photo) is a major vendor of vegetables (cucumbers and tomatoes). She intends to use her loan to purchase 3 baskets of tomatoes and 3 baskets of cucumbers. She gets her supplies of vegetables in Médine. By hawking and sometimes by special order, she sells retail to a customer base composed mostly of women paying with cash or credit.

With this loan, Ms. Bassira hopes to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used to ensure the children’s healthcare. Her goal is to increase her business volume through this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables

loans.name: Avelino

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Avelino ; el socio tiene 02 hijos es conviviente y tiene 26 años de edad, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias a trabajar en turismo ,el socio es guía de turismo, el socio  lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día , a la vez el socio brinda el servicio de taxi en sus ratos libres, él socio  desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera pueda continuar apoyando a su familia.
El  socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de boletos turísticos.
El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
He is a member of the “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN” communal bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Avelion is 26 years old, lives with his wife two children.  He works as a tour guide and has been doing this for some time.  Things are going well for him, thanks to his dedication.  He also drives a taxi in his spare time and wants to continue working so he can continue to support his family.

He is asking for this loan to buy tourist passes.  He is grateful for this loan and is committed to making his payments.

loans.use: to buy tourist passes.

loans.name: Benso Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de cinq femmes, les membres du groupe Benso sont majoritairement  mariés dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge 40 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et  de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font la vente d’habits (pagnes wax) de plusieurs qualités, condiments, savons et charbon du bois. Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  3ème cycle de  prêt  solidaire.
Madame Mama (femme arrêtée à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une bonne réputation dans la vente des habits (pagnes wax) de plusieurs qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 30 pièces de pagnes wax. Elles s’approvisionnent en pagnes wax à Bamako.  La revente se fait au comptant ou à crédit en ambulant et parfois par commande à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Mama compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer la scolarisation et les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The group Benso is composed of five women married for the most part in monogamous households. The women average 40 years of age and five children each, all living in Kanadjiguila, in Commune du Mandé /Cercle de Kati. They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and their revenue-generating businesses. The group members sell clothing made of Wax ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa) of several qualities; condiments; soaps; and charcoal.

Concerned about building up their inventories, the group members had decided to turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Mama (the woman standing at the far right in the photo) is famous for selling clothing of Wax ‘pagne’ cloth. She intends to use her loan to purchase 30 pieces of such clothing. She gets her supplies in Bamako. By hawking and sometimes by special order, she sells retail to a customer base composed mostly of women paying with cash or credit.

With this loan, Ms. Mama hopes to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used to ensure the children’s education and healthcare.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Memuna. She is married and has six children, aged 30, 25, 23, 18, 14 and 10 years; five are school-going children. 

In 1999, Memuna established her local foodstuff  — rice beans, tola, millet, couscous, dry okra, etc., — business. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,600,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Memuna has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase bags of rice, beans, dry okra, millet, etc. In the future, Memuna plans to reinvest in and expand her business more. Her previous plans were to expand her business, in which she succeeded as her business has grown.   

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, beans, dry okra, millet, etc.

loans.name: Djalabatigui Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de neuf femmes, les membres du groupe Djalabatigui sont majoritairement  mariés dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge 36 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila dans la commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et  de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font la vente de, légumes (haricot vert et piments), habits, pâtes d’arachides et bananes. Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  2ème cycle de  prêt  solidaire.
Madame Sitan  (femme assise en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite) a une bonne réputation dans la vente de légumes (haricot vert et piments). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  3 sacs d’haricots vert et 3 sacs de piments. Elles s’approvisionnent en légumes à Médine. La revente se fait au comptant ou à crédit en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Sitan  compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer la scolarisation et les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The group Djalabatigui is composed of nine women married for the most part in monogamous households. The women average 36 years of age and five children each, all living in Kanadjiguila, in Commune du Mandé / Cercle de Kati. They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and their revenue-generating businesses. The group members sell clothing made of Wax ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of vegetables (green beans and chili peppers), clothing, peanut butter, and bananas.

Concerned about building up their inventories, the group members had decided to turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Sitan (the woman sitting second from the left in the photo) is famous for selling vegetables (green beans and chili peppers). She intends to use her loan to purchase 3 sacks of green beans and 3 sacks of chili peppers. She gets her supplies in Médine. By hawking, she sells retail to a customer base composed mostly of women paying with cash or credit.

With this loan, Ms. Sitan hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used to ensure the children’s education and healthcare.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Sanouya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sanouya est constitué de quatre femmes, les membres sont majoritairement  mariées et vie dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 37 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe mènent  des activités génératrices de revenu  différent, notamment la vente de, mèches, légumes et produits cosmétiques. Dans  le souci d’élargir et d’agrandir   leurs activités, elles ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso   et  sont  à leur  3ème  prêt  en solidaire.
Madame Sokona (femme arrêtée à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une bonne notoriété, car les mèches légume très prises par les femmes à Kanadjiguila. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  15 paquets de mèches. Elles s’approvisionnent à Bamako.  Elle mène ses activités au comptant  à Kanadjiguila à une clientèle de femmes. Madame Sokona compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen de 40 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour satisfaire son besoin et investir le reste dans son activité. Madame a pour objectif de fidéliser  ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’en profiter beaucoup de prêt.
texts.en:
The group Sanouya is composed of four women. The group members are for the most part married and living in monogamous households. The women average 37 years of age and six children each, all living in Kanadjiguila, in Commune du Mandé / Cercle de Kati. They know one another through tontines in the district and through their revenue-generating businesses. The group members run different revenue-generating businesses, especially selling hair extensions, vegetables, and cosmetic products. 

Concerned about expanding their businesses, the women had decided to turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan. 

Ms. Sokona (the woman standing at the far left in the photo) is famous, since hair extensions and vegetables are highly prized in Kanadjiguila. She intends to use her loan to purchase 15 packets of hair extensions. She gets her supplies in Bamako. She operates her business  involving cash with women customers in Kanadjiguila.

With this loan, Ms. Sokona hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used to support herself. The rest will be used in her business. Her goal is to enhance loyalty in this Soro Yiriwaso partnership, so as to take advantage of many loans.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions

loans.name: Zaimarie

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Zaimarie. She is divorced and has 2 children - a school-going 6-year-old and a 1-year-old baby. 

In 2013, Zaimarie established her building materials business (cement, iron rods, paint, lockers, etc.). She began her business because she stopped school at secondary level and got married, and then assisted her husband in his business. Later they divorced after having two children, so she went to her mother who gave her an amount of money to start her own business. 

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 2,500,000 every month from this business, but her major challenge is inadequate capital. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000 in order to buy bundles of iron rods, bags of cement, cartons of lockers, and tins of paint. 

In the future, Zaimarie plans to reinvest her profit in the business and also to expand. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bundles of iron rods, bags of cement, cartons of lockers, and tins of paint.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en una zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 5 años a la crianza de ganado de engorde y lechero, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de vitaminas y concentrado para continuar con su trabajo y asi obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: This 28 year old young man’s image has been pixelated because he lives in a high risk area.  He has been selling meet and dairy livestock for five years in the markets near his home.  He lives in a home of his own with his wife and daughter.  He is asking for this loan so he can continue working and obtain better earnings.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more palm oil for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of onions, salt and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build an oven and make home improvements.

loans.name: Raden

texts.en:
Raden is a 36-year-old married man from Concepcion, Iloilo. Raden earns an income through his sari-sari or variety store business. He sells various goods to the people in his place. Raden also earns income through his fishing business.
 
Raden is asking for a loan to buy more groceries like canned goods, biscuits, bread, snack foods, noodles, soap, shampoo, toiletries, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, and seasonings to sell. Through this, he will be able to improve his daily income thus allowing him to provide for their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like canned goods, biscuits, bread, snack foods, noodles, soap, shampoo, toiletries, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Unisa

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Unisa. He is married and has 4 children aged 15, 11, 9 and 6 years old, who all go to school.  

Unisa owns a food (bread) business. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 4,457,000 every month from this business. 

He has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans, and he now requires a new loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000 in order to purchase bags of bread flour and other ingredients for production.   

Unisa's previous plan was to build a bakery, which has now been completed and is in full operation. The loans helped him greatly, and he is now financially secure and has an average life with his family. He now hopes to build a modern house.

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase bags of bread flour and other ingredients for production.

loans.name: Fany

texts.en:
As the married parent of seven children, Fany works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and food vending. Fany is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Fany has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 32 years old. She is married to Boniface and together they are blessed with six children whose ages are between 12 and 3 years old.

Caroline sells cereals, a business she has done for the last 12 years, earning a monthly income of KES 30,000. Caroline has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 30,000 which she will use to buy more sacks of maize and beans for retail sales.

With the anticipated profits, Caroline will be able to pay school fees for her school going children as well as her loan. Her hope and dream for the future is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Saramaya Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de quatre femmes, les membres du groupe Saramaya sont majoritairement  mariées et vie dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 31 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du  Mandé / cercle de Kati. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe mènent  des activités génératrices de revenu  différent, notamment la vente de, condiments (oignons)	habits et bananes plantains. Dans  le souci d’élargir et d’agrandir   leurs activités, elles ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  3ème  prêt  en solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata  (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une bonne notoriété, car  les oignons très prises par les femmes à Kanadjiguila. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 8 sacs d’oignons. Elles s’approvisionnent à Médine.  Elle mène ses activités au comptant  à Kanadjiguila à une clientèle de femmes. Madame Fatoumata  compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen de 30 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour satisfaire son besoin et investir le reste dans son activité. Madame a pour objectif de fidéliser  ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’en profiter beaucoup de prêt.
texts.en:
The group Saramaya is composed of four women, most of them married and living in monogamous households. The women average 31 years of age and four children each, all living in Kanadjiguila, in Commune du Mandé / Cercle de Kati. They know one another through tontines in the district and through their revenue-generating businesses. The group members run different businesses, especially selling condiments (onions), clothing, and plantains. 

Concerned about expanding their businesses, the women had decided to turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan. 

Ms. Fatoumata (the woman sitting at the far right in the photo) is famous, since onions are highly prized by the women in Kanadjiguila. She intends to use her loan to purchase 9 sacks of onions. She gets her supplies in Médine. She operates her business in cash with women customers in Kanadjiguila.

With this loan, Ms. Fatoumata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used to support herself. The rest will be used in her business. Her goal is to enhance loyalty in this Soro Yiriwaso partnership, so as to take advantage of many loans.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is from Kaqavadzor Village in the Aragatsotn region, where she lives with her husband and son. With the help of her family members, she is engaged in breeding livestock, including cows, calves, pigs, piglets, hens and colonies of bees. Liana is also engaged in the cultivation of barley and grass. Liana's husband sells the agricultural products in the local market. Agribusiness is the most important source of income for the family. 

As the autumn is progressing, Liana needs to make some investments in her agribusiness in order for it to function in a sustainable way. A loan of USD 2,500 will support this hard-working woman and her family greatly, enabling them to purchase some forage (grass and combined forage) for the livestock. With the help of the loan, the family will maintain and develop their agribusiness. Liana and her family members highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding her livestock.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 37 years old and married with four children, and she works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, toothpaste, sanitary pads, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc. to sell.

Eunice has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

She aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, toothpaste, sanitary pads, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married, and has five children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

For the past two years, she has operated a business selling fruits and vegetables. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenges are the high cost of transportation to her place of operation and stiff competition.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Deme Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe Dème est constitué de quatre femmes  tous mariées équitablement et vie dans des ménages polygamiques et monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djicoroni l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font du commerce,  tel que la vente de, fruits (bananes), arachides, verres et charbon du bois.  Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  prêt en prêt solidaire.
Madame Barro (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des fruits (bananes). Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 1 corbeille de banane. Elles s’approvisionnent  à Médine. La revente s’effectue à  Djicoroni au comptant à une clientèle de mixtes. Madame Barro compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins de ses enfants et investir le reste dans ses activités. Madame compte beaucoup sur le partenariat  de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs qui est l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
The group Dème is composed of four women, all of them married and living in polygamous or monogamous households. The women average 37 years of age and four children each, all living in Djicoroni,  a district in Bamako. They know one another through tontines in the district and through their revenue-generating businesses. The group members work in commerce, such as in selling fruit (bananas), peanuts, glasses, and charcoal. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members had decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan. 

Ms. Barro (the woman sitting at the far left in the photo) is famous for selling fruit (bananas). She intends to use her loan to purchase a basket of bananas. She gets her supplies in Médine. Her sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash in Djicoroni.

With this loan, Ms. Barro hopes to make an average monthly profit of 10,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet her children’s needs. The rest will be used in her business. She is counting a lot on this Soro Yiriwaso partnership to achieve her goals, including expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit (bananas).

loans.name: Kanee

texts.en:
Kanee is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids, who attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Kanee operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over four years. She mentioned disease outbreaks causing losses as a challenge in the business. Kanee dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Adalberto Esteban

texts.es:
Adalberto con 52 años de edad, es casado y padre de 2 hijos. 

Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a diversas actividades de manera independiente, con lo que ha generado ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. 

Hace un año, comenzó a realizar la actividad de comprar y vender cerdos, pues los obtiene, los cría, engorda y al momento de la venderlos los ofrece a un precio más alto, debido al peso adquirido por el animal, esto le permite obtener los recursos para continuar con el cuidado y sustento de sus hijos. 

El titular es un hombre luchador, pujante, se esmera cada día para salir adelante motivado por su familia, esto lo impulsó a solicitar el crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de cerdos y lechones para engordarlos y venderlos, así podrá tener disponibilidad suficiente para cumplir con los pedidos que le solicitan y mejorará su margen de utilidad e ingresos. 

De esta manera, Adalberto espera avanzar un paso más hacia el cumplimiento de su sueño principal, que es formalizar su negocio y montar un expendio de carne, que sea rentable y perdurable en el tiempo y lograr una estabilidad económica para darle a sus hijos la oportunidad de una mejor educación y tener buenas condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Adalberto, 52, is married and has two children.  During his productive lifetime he has worked independently in many activities to earn an income to support his family.

A year ago he began buying pigs which he raises and sells for more money based on the weight gained by the animal.  This is how he earns a living in order to care for his children.

Adalberto is a hard-working, energetic person who does his best every day to provide for his family.  That is why he is requesting a loan to buy pigs and suckling pigs to raise and sell.  This will allow him to fill the orders he receives and to raise his profit margin and income.

Adalberto hopes to take another step toward reaching his main goal which is to formalize his business and establish a profitable butcher shop for a longer lasting, more stable economy to give his children an opportunity for a better education and lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise so he can improve his business.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe Djèkafo est constitué de neuf femmes  tous mariées et vie majoritairement  dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 35 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Lafiabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font du commerce,  tel que la vente de, condiments, des fruits et légumes  (tomate, oignons, chou, gombo et autres …).  Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 2ème  prêt en prêt solidaire.
Madame Alimata (femme arrêtée à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des oignons à Lafiabougou. Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 7 sacs d’oignons. Elles s’approvisionnent  à Médine. La revente s’effectue à Lafiabougou au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Alimata compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins de ses enfants et investir le reste dans ses activités. Madame compte beaucoup sur le partenariat  de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs qui est l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
The group Djèkafo is composed of nine women, all of them married and living for the most part in monogamous households. The women average 35 years of age and two children each, all living in Lafiabougou, a district in Bamako. They know one another through tontines in the district and through their revenue-generating businesses. The group members work in commerce, such as in selling condiments and fruit & vegetables (tomatoes, onions, cabbage, okra, and more…). 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members had decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan. 

Ms. Alimata (the woman sitting at the far left in the photo) is famous for selling onions in Lafiabougou. She intends to use her loan to purchase 7 sacks of onions. She gets her supplies in Médine. Her sales are made to mostly women customers paying with cash in Lafiabougou.

With this loan, Ms. Alimata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet her children’s sundry needs. The rest will be used in her business. She is counting a lot on this Soro Yiriwaso partnership to achieve her goals, including expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Ena Rocio

texts.es:
Ena es una joven muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.

Desde hace 2 años se viene dedicando a la venta de recargas y minutos a celular en el municipio de Tierra Alta, Córdoba.

Con este pequeño negocio intenta sostener y sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo de 1 año.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de tarjetas para recarga de celular y de esta forma poder capitalizar su negocio y mantenerlo a flote.

Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos.
texts.en:
Ena is a very young entrepreneur who is determined to get ahead and prosper.  For two years she has been selling prepaid cellphone cards in the municipality of Tierra Alta, Córdoba.  With this small business she is able to support her one-year-old son.

The loan she is requesting is to buy a variety of prepaid cellphone cards so she can capitalize her business and continue her activity.  She hopes to continue working thanks to good-hearted people who support this type of projects.

loans.use: To buy prepaid cellphone cards.

loans.name: Guillermina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Guillermina es madre de seis hijos entre los 15 y 22 años. Aparte a su familia, se dedica a la cultivación agricultura desde hace 15 años. 

Ella aprendió este negocio empíricamente, es decir a través de observación de otras personas. 

Ella y su familia viven una zona rural de Colombia en la cual no es fácil tener acceso a servicios financieros como los que aporta Interactuar. 

Su crédito lo va usar para comprar insumos agropecuarios como semillas, productos para el control de plagas, y abonos para poder preparar sus cultivos. 

Gracias a este crédito, la economía de su familia y la calidad de vida mejorarían pues pudiera aumentar sus ingresos. 

Guillermina sueña terminar con la legalización de los papeles de su tierra. 

¡Impacte la vida de Guillermina y su familia con un crédito!
texts.en:
Guillermina is the mother of six children between the ages of 15 and 22.   In addition to raising a family she has been working in agriculture for 15 years.  She learned the trade on her own having observed how other people do it.

She and her family live in a rural area of Colombia with no easy access to financial services such as those provided by Interactuar.  She plans to use her loan to buy farm supplies such as seeds, disease control products and manures to prepare her cropland.

Thanks to this funding the family economy and quality of life will improve from the increase in income.  Guillermina's dream is to finish the legalization process of her land deed.

You can have an impact on Guillermina's life and family by contributing to this loan.

loans.use: To buy manures, seeds, sprays and supplies to prepare her land.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
Padre de 3 hijos y con un gran deseo verlos convertidos en todos unos profesionales, es el motivo que llena de entusiasmo y animo la señor José, de 27 años de edad, a trabajar incansablemente en su criadero de cerdos pues aspira que con este humilde empleo pueda brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.

Ya que su deseo es poder brindarles una buena educación a todos sus hijos, necesita de una actividad capaz de generar los recursos suficientes para cubrir estos gastos y sin descuidar los gastos primordiales del hogar.

Se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de cerdos y alimento para los mismos; los cuales criara y engordara para su posterior venta. 

José está muy motivado con este gran proyecto ya que sus hijos demuestran buenas actitudes estudiantiles y disposición para triunfar y hacer que su padre se sienta más que orgulloso de sus hijos.
texts.en:
A father to three children and wanting to see them all learn a profession is the motivation that fills 27-year-old José with the enthusiasm and drive to work indefatigably at his pig-raising business. José aspires, with this humble work, to offer his children a better quality of life.

As he wants to give all of his children a better education, José needs a business that will generate a high enough income to cover the costs of schooling while still being able to cover household bills.

José needs to applying for a loan in order to buy pigs and pig fees. José will raise and fatten up the pigs to sell at a later date.

José is very motivated to carry out these plans as his children are proving to be good students and are ready to do well and make their father proud.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten up and feed to look after the pigs and improve his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, anti-disease treatments and more.

loans.name: Dative

texts.en:
Dative is 23 years old, is married, and has been farming for three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more fertilizer for maize production. The profits from farming will be used to improve her savings.

The agricultural sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for maize production.

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en: Armenuhi is an experienced farmer from the town of Talin. She lives with her husband and mother-in-law. The three of them are extensively engaged in agribusiness, which is the main source of their income. They are involved in cattle breeding, in aviculture, and in pig keeping. As life gets more expensive day by day, Armenuhi wants to expand her agribusiness in order to meet her family's needs more effectively.
