A loan of $2,500 will be a great support to this hardworking woman and her family, enabling her to purchase 10 piglets and forage to feed the livestock. Armenuhi and her husband rely on the goodwill of the lenders and are very grateful to them for their support and for the needed loan to sustain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for 10 piglets and for forage to feed the livestock

loans.name: Dina Luz

texts.es:
Dina es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de su hijo de 11 años que ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia.

 Hace un tiempo montó su venta de huevos, para lo cual tiene cierta cantidad de gallinas que le permiten tener algunas ventas. 

Dina desea impulsar su negocio y mejorarlo de una manera efectiva, es por esto que busca que un préstamo le permita comprar más gallinas para poder incrementar su capacidad de producción de huevos y así responder a la demanda de sus clientes por los huevos.

De esta manera sus ventas se incrementarán considerablemente, además de que su negocio resurgirá y podrá salir adelante. 

Además, Dina espera que con mayores ingresos su hijo pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida y el acceso a una mejor educación. 

Dina sueña con tener un gran negocio donde pueda utilizar toda la capacidad que pueda para sacarlo adelante y así ofrecerle a su hijo un futuro económico estable.
texts.en:
Dina is a single mother and head of her family. She has an eleven-year-old son. Dina has faced many adversities in life but she has always had the strength to get ahead and continue moving forward with her family.

Some time ago Dina started a business selling eggs, for which she has a number of hens.

Dina wants to drive her business forward and make improvements to it. As a result she is applying for a loan in order to buy more hens and increase egg production. She will then be able to respond to customers' demands.

With these hens, Dina's sales will increase considerably, her business will grow and Dina will be able to get ahead in life.

Dina also hopes that, with a higher income, her son will have a higher quality of life and access to a better education.

Dina dreams of having a big business where she will work as hard as she can in order to get ahead and offer her son a financially-stably future.

loans.use: to buy chickens and laying hens in order to improve her business and to be able to support her son.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Porfirio de 42 años de edad,  estudio hasta tercer grado. La esposa se dedica  a los oficios  domésticos  y han procreado dos hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad. 

Porfirio se dedica a la apicultura desde hace  20 años,  este oficio se lo enseño el padre ya que él quería que  aprendiera este oficio al igual que él. Para seguir con este mismo oficio, es que decidió continuarlo siempre el padre le ayuda para irlo guiando con el mantenimiento de las colmenas esto lo hace en un horario de las 6:00 a.m.  a las 11:00 a.m. o de 2:00 p.m. a las 5:00 p.m. un día por medio él va a ver las colmenas a una distancia de 30 minutos y viaja a pie.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar dos quintales de azúcar para darles de comer a las colmenas para que produzcan más miel y así el ingreso sea mejor. Esto le ayudara mucho porque entre más miel saca más ganancias tendrá.

El sueño de Porfirio es poder tener más colmenas, para obtener más ganancias y esto lo hará con todo el sacrificio y esfuerzo para salir adelante con sus hijos y que un día sean profesionales y que no les falte nada en el hogar.
texts.en:
Porfirio is 42 years old and has a third grade education. His wife takes care of the household chores; the couple has two children, ages four and two.

Porfirio has been working in apiculture for 20 years. He was taught the trade by his father, who wanted his son to learn this work. Porfirio decided to continue working with bees as his father always helped and guided him in looking after the beehives. Porfirio works from 6am until 11am and then from 2pm until 5pm. Porfirio walks to the beehives, which are  30 minutes from his home.

Porfirio is applying for a loan from "CrediCampo" in order to buy two hundredweights of sugar to give to beehives so that they produce more honey and to increase Porfirio's income. This loan will be of great help as the higher honey production is, the higher profits that José will earn.

Porfirio's dream is to have more beehives in order to make higher profits. He will do this through sacrifice and effort in order to get ahead with his children so that they may, one day, have a profession and so that they never need for anything at home.

loans.use: to buy two hundredweights of sugar to give to beehives so that they produce more honey.

loans.name: Mastona

texts.ru:
Мастона 24-летняя молодая девушка. Она талантливая и умелая. Мастона благодаря своему умению шитью зарабатывает на жизнь. Она у себя дома берет заказ на пошив женских национальных платьев. Ей нравится оказывать услугу женщинам клиенткам и видеть их восторженные лица за примеркой готового платья. Мастона сейчас хочет расширить деятельность, так как уже приобрела годовой опыт в этой сфере. За счет суммы кредита она хочет приобрести новую швейную машинку. 
Мастона еще не замужем. Она живет в районе Дангара вместе с матерью, двумя старшими братьями, двумя невестками и племянником. Полученный доход от деятельности Мастона тоже вносит в бюджет семьи. Она надеется при поддержке кредиторов KIVA расширить и удвоить доходность своего швейного дела.
texts.en:
Mastona is 24 years old, and a talented and skillful young woman.  Thanks to her skills as a seamstress, she is able to make a living.  She takes orders from customers and sews women's traditional Tajik dresses from home.  She really enjoys providing her sewing services and she loves to see how happy and excited her customers are when they come to try on their new dresses.  After one year of experience in her field of work, Mastona wants to expand her activity.  She will use the amount of her loan to buy a new sewing machine.

Mastona is still single.  She lives in the Dangara district of Tajikistan with her mother, her two older brothers, her sisters-in-law and her nephews.  With her income, Mastona contributes to the budget of the family.  With the support from her Kiva lenders, she is hoping to expand and double the profits she makes with her sewing business.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 24 years old; she has been farming for five years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer for maize production. The profits from farming will be used to buy a house.

The agricultural sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for maize production.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en: Herbert is a 29-year-old married man with four children who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is very hardworking and strives to see to it that his family is okay. He buys and sells cocoa as his main business and also has his own cocoa garden. He wants a loan to buy cocoa to sell. Like other cocoa businesspeople, Herbert faces a challenge of seasonal changes, but is determined to take his business to greater heights.

loans.use: To buy cocoa for resale

loans.name: Kankelen Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Kankelen vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce d’habillement, de cosmétique et de condiment. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  3eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Ami (la 2eme  femme assise de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de  pagne  wax dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  2 pièces de Bazin  riche à  Bamako. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Ami espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 60 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The five women in the Kankelen group all live in nuclear families. They are on average 35 years old with two children, and all live in the Hamdallaye neighborhood of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, kinship, marriage and their income-generating activities in the neighborhood. They are small retail merchants dealing in clothing, cosmetics and condiments. To expand their business the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are in their third group loan cycle.

Mrs. Ami (the second woman sitting from left to right in the photo) is a great seller of pagne wax (colorful West-African fabric) throughout the neighborhood and its surrounding area. She will use her loan to buy two lengths of rich Bazin (high-quality hand-dyed polished cotton fabric) in Bamako. Retail sales are for cash and often on credit, either at home or in the market, to a mixed clientele.

Mrs. Ami hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 60,000 CFA francs, which will be used for her children's small needs and also to expand her business. She wants to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: buy rich Bazin (high-quality hand-dyed polished cotton fabric)

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman and has been blessed with six kids who attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Mwanasha has operated a fish-selling business for over six years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in her business. With the 50,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Sabougnouman vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village Somonodougouni de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de restauration et de condiment. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  5eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Bafanta  (la 2eme femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de farine sucrée et de pâté dans le village Somonodougouni et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  1 sac de poudre de farine à fana et à konodimini chez les maraichers. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Bafanta  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 15 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The five women in the Sabougnouman group all live in traditional families. They are on average 38 years old with two children, and all live in the Somonodougouni village of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, kinship, marriage and their income-generating activities in the village. They are small retail merchants dealing in food preparations and condiments. To expand their business the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are in their fifth group loan cycle.

Mrs. Bafanta (the second woman standing from left to right in the photo) is a great seller of sweetened flour and mush in Somonodougouni and its surrounding area. She will use her loan to buy one bag of flour from market gardeners in Fana and Konodimini. Retail sales are for cash and often on credit, either at home or in the market, to a mixed clientele.

Mrs. Bafanta hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 15,000 CFA francs, which will be used for her children's small needs and also to expand her business. She wants to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: buy flour

loans.name: Edwin Okoth Ondoro

texts.en:
Edwin Okoth is  24 years old and a second born in a family of 7 siblings. He began his education in Soul Winning Nursery School and later joined Sinogo Primary School where he completed his primary level of education in the year 2004. Afterwards he joined Our Lady of Fatima Secondary School and completed in the year 2008.
In 2010 he joined Kenya Polytechnic University College and pursued a certificate in Civil Engineering and later in 2013 he began a diploma in Civil Engineering. But since then he has gone through ups and downs in terms of school fees problems. This made him locked out of university due to fees arrears as the university rules and regulations do not permit this. His fathers low income has been enough just  to cover part of the fees as he struggles to afford basic necessities like food and rent and pay for bills.
He is applying for a loan (KIVA) to enable him complete his  studies in  a course which has  been his greatest passion.

loans.use: To pay Tuition Fees

loans.name: Emmanuel Nzuki

texts.en:
Emmanuel Nzuki is 20 years of age and a final year student at Technical University of Kenya, taking a Diploma in Technology - Civil Engineering, in Nairobi.  
Emmanuel is a second born in a family of three children who are also in school. His parents are casual labourers and struggle to pay for all his school fees.
His aspiration is to be a Civil Engineer in future and facilitate the growth of infrastructure in his home area and also help his family become financially stable.
He humbly requests for a loan to pay for his studies so that he is able to complete his final year of school.

loans.use: To pay for, tuition fees, Accommodation, Food and Transport

loans.name: Afred Kombo

texts.en:
Alfred Kombo is  25 years old. He is currently a student at SOS Technical Training Institute pursuing a certificate in Electrical Installation as a second year student. 
He is struggling to pay his school fees and upkeep from his small scale farming in his rural home as the income is not enough to cover that.
He is  requesting KIVA to consider him for the loan  to enable him pay fees for his  last academic year  and be able to compete with other youths in his  beloved country and worldwide  after completing his studies.

loans.use: To pay tuition, accommodation,food and transport

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias is 42 years old. He is married with four children aged between 17 and 3 years, three of whom go to school.  He sells shoes and has been working in business for the past nine years. With the loan, he would like to buy more shoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used  to renovate his house and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Fredrick Okwany

texts.en:
Profile:
Fredrick Okwany is 24 years old. He is currently a final year student at Technical University of Kenya pursuing a diploma in Civil and Environmental Engineering.   
His ambition is to become a Civil Engineer in order to improve his life and also be able to assist his siblings. He comes from a financially unstable family and struggles a lot in paying for his academics. In addition to that it’s a struggle for his parent as his siblings are also schooling at High school and Primary school level.
  Fredrick humbly requests for a loan to pay for his studies and upkeep in school. 
 
Thank You in advance

loans.use: To pay for tuition,books,accomodation,food and tranport

loans.name: Felix Owino

texts.en:
Profile:
Felix is 20 years old. He is currently a student at SOS Technical Training Institute pursuing a Certificate Course in Electrical Installation as a second year student. 
Felix’s objective is to finish his studies and begin work to improve the financial situation of his family. His parents, who support him and his three siblings, are artisans and their pay is not enough to cover their education as well as their basic needs. 
He is requesting KIVA to consider him for the loan which he has applied for to enable him  pay for his studies. This will help him achieve his goals to become self employed in his field of study and be financially stable.
Thank You in advance

loans.use: To pay for tuition fees, books,food, transportation costs

loans.name: 05 Chiến Thắng Ngư Lộc Group

texts.en:
Hiền operates a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell.

Hiền is 36 years old and is married with two children. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 05 Chiến Thắng Ngư Lộc solidarity group. 

She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.	
	
 In 2014, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hiền has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Hiền faces in her business is the lack of capital.	
	
In the future, Hiền hopes for her children to do well in school, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en: Mathias is a58-year-old married man with eight children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. His business is cocoa buying and selling to supplement what he harvests from his cocoa garden. He started this business with an aim of raising the school fees for his children. Limited capital, seasonal changes and price fluctuations limit his business. He wants the loan to buy cocoa for resale.

loans.use: To buy cocoa for resale

loans.name: Mwajabu

texts.en: Mwajabu is a 24-year-old businesswoman from Tanzania. She has six other siblings and one child. Mwajabu spends her time as a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide at the secondary school in her community. She leads discussions with students about how to identify and overcome life challenges. Mwajabu runs her own charcoal business, as well. Her business is unique in her area; no one near her sells charcoal. Mwajabu’s profits go toward school fees for her child and household expenses. Mwajabu would like to expand her business, and she is turning to Kiva for help. She plans to use the loan to repair her store so that her charcoal can be better protected during the rainy season. One day, she hopes to buy a vehicle that she can use to transport the charcoal.

loans.use: to repair her store so that her charcoal can be better protected during the rainy season

loans.name: Eria

texts.en: Eria is a 59-year-old married man with 13 children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a cocoa farmer and his business is buying and selling of cocoa. He is very hardworking and a bad season at times affects him since this product  is harvested seasonally. He hopes to have a bigger business. He wants a loan to buy more cocoa for sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en: Mariamu is a 24-year-old businesswoman from Tanzania. She is married and has two children. As a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer, Mariamu helps students identify challenges in their lives that could lead to low school performance. She then helps them come up with strategies to confront their challenges. She encourages young girls and boys to stay in school to achieve their goals. Mariamu runs a soft drink business in a small rental shop. She likes interacting with all types of customers at her business. With the profits she earns, Mariamu supports her family and pays her children’s school fees. Mariamu would like to borrow a loan from Kiva so that she can purchase more products to sell in her shop, which would lead to more profits. She may then be able to hire another employee.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell in her shop

loans.name: Kadogo

texts.en: Kadogo is a 26-year-old businesswoman, mother, and wife from Tanzania. She is responsible for taking care of her mother and her two children. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in her community assisting young students to fight poverty in their communities by achieving in school. Additionally, Kadogo sells home products in a retail shop. She uses the profits to buy food and pay health fees. She is requesting a loan from Kiva so that she can purchase more items to sell in her shop. Then she will be able to renovate her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchas eggs, beans, soups, dry grains, sodas, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo,  vive con su compañera de vida, el se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y adicional a so también trabaja como motorista de camión, el tiene 10 años de trabajar propio en la agricultura, y saca la cosecha en diciembre y la comercializa en los alrededores de la zona, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra comercializarla y solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, el joven solicita un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, etc., y asi sacar una muy buena cosecha de maíz y poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young man, with the pixelated face because he is 28 years old and lives in a high risk zone, lives with his life partner. He makes a living from agriculture, cultivating corn, and in addition he also works as a truck driver. He has been working in agriculture for 10 years; he harvests the crops in December and sells his product in the nearby surroundings. With the earnings from what he sales, he manages to commercialize and solve some of the necessities at home. 

The young man is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, manure, etc. so that he can have a very good corn crop and be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, manure, etc.

loans.name: Medardo

texts.es: Medardo de 66 años de edad vive con su esposa, el se dedica a la siembra de cultivo de granos básicos, maíz, frijol, maicillo, el inicio por medio de sus padres que se dedicaron a lo mismo, el siembra en la época de mayo y saca sus productos en diciembre y enero y asi los comercializa, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Medardo solicita un crédito para sembrar frijol y maíz  nuevamente, y comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, etc. y asi poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Medardo is 66 years old and lives with his wife. He makes a living growing basic grains such as corn, beans and sorghum. He started this activity through his parents, who had the same job. 

He sows his seeds in May and harvests his produce in December and January to sell. With his earnings, he is able to pay for household necessities. 

Medardo is requesting a loan to sow more beans and corn, and to buy fertiliser, weedkiller, compost, and other items so that he can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser, weedkiller, compost, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs to aid her potato crops

loans.name: Juana Angelica

texts.es: Juana de 40 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida,  ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz, tiene más de 7 años de dedicarse al cultivo de granos básicos, actividad que empezó a desarrollar en su hogar junto a su padre y hermanos, la épocas fuerte para comercializar son los meses de diciembre a abril de cada año, ella le vende a comerciantes y a mayoristas de la zona donde reside, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Juana solicita un crédito para la compra de fertilizante, sulfato y formula para aplicar al cultivo de  y obtener una excelente cosecha, asi poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juana is 40 years old and lives with her partner. She works sowing corn and has over 7 years' experience growing basic grains, an activity she started to develop in her home with her father and siblings. The selling season is December to April every year, and she sells her produce to local traders and wholesalers. With her earnings she is able to pay for household necessities.

Juana is requesting a loan to buy fertiliser, sulphate and formula to apply to her crops so that she can get an excellent harvest, and offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser, sulphate and formula to apply to her crops.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es: Nicolasa es casada y vive en la ciudad de La Paz, el domicilio es propiedad de su suegro. Trabaja como comerciante de ropa y su esposo trabaja en otro departamento de Bolivia mandando una cantidad de dinero limitada al mes para su familia. Nicolasa necesita un prestamo para  la compra de bastidores y perlas, pues quiere incorporar productos adicionales a su clientela. Nicolasa tambien esta ocupada haciendo instalar gas a domicilio por lo que necesita su ayuda para fortalecer su actividad comercial
texts.en: Nicolasa is married and lives in the city of La Paz in a house owned by her father-in-law. She works as a clothes seller and her husband works in another department in Bolivia and sends his family a limited amount of money every month. Nicolasa needs a loan to buy frames and pearls, as she wants to offer these additional products to her customers. Nicolasa is also busy installing gas in her home, which is why she needs your help to strengthen her business activity.

loans.use: to buy frames and pearls.

loans.name: Rosa Irma

texts.es: Rosa de 38 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos, calzados y elabora flores artificiales, ella posee más de 8 años de experiencia e inicio con capital propio, los productos por catálogos los vende a toda época, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Rosa solicita un crédito para invertir en su negocio y poder comprar lociones, cremas, perfumes, desodorantes, etc. y hacer crecer su negocio para recibir mejores ingresos y asi poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 38 years old and lives with her husband and her two children. She makes a living selling products in catalogues and shoes, and making artificial flowers. She has over eight years' experience and started the business with her own capital. She sells her catalogue products throughout the year, and with her earnings she is able to pay for household necessities. 

Rosa is requesting a loan to invest in her business and buy lotion, cream, perfume, deodorant, etc. to expand her business and boost her income. This will enable her to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy lotion, cream, perfume, deodorant, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo,  vive con sus padres y su compañera de vida, el se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante por los mercados desde hace 2 años, vende ropa para dama y para caballero e inicio con capital propio,  y vende en toda época del año, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, el joven  solicita un crédito para la compra de fardos de ropa y tener más inventario para su venta, y asi poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The young man, whose face has been blurred because he is 27 years old and lives in a high-risk area, lives with his parents and his life partner. He has been selling clothes, moving around in the markets, for the past two years. He sells ladies' and men's clothing, and he began with capital of his own. He sells throughout the year, and with what he earns from his sales, he is able to pay for the needs that come up in his household. This young man is requesting a loan to buy bundles of clothing and have more inventory to sell, and thus be able to give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothing

loans.name: Dennis

texts.es: Dennis es soltera pero tiene un hijo, ella vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un alquiler pero al menos tiene luz, agua y alcantarillado, Dennis tiene su negocio de comida rapida (hamburguesas) y quiere un credito para comprar una plancha para freir mayor cantidad de hamburguesas Dennis es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero goza de buena salud y su evaluacion crediticia ha dado buenos resultados por lo que se recomienda otorgar credito
texts.en: Dennis is single, but she has a son. She lives in La Paz in a brick and cement house. She rents, but at least she has electricity, water and plumbing.  Dennis has a fast food business (hamburgers) and she wants a loan to buy a press to fry a larger quantity of hamburgers. Dennis is the only source of income in her home but she is healthy and her credit evaluation has had good results and that is why giving her this loan is recommended.

loans.use: to buy a press to fry a larger quantity of hamburgers.

loans.name: Carla Del Socorro

texts.es:
la señora carla es habitante del departamento de chinandega es madre soltera cuenta con un negocio de venta de comida en el mercadito de chinandega desde hace 20 años  tiene una hija en la universidad por la cual se efuerza en su negocio para poder brindarle la ayuda para sus estudios la señora es una mujer luchadora responsable , humilde que trabaja de lunes a domingo para el susutento de du familia.

la señora era ayudeante de cosina y ahorro para iniciar su pequeño negocio.
texts.en: Carla lives in the department of Chinandega. She is a single mother who has had a business selling food in the Chinandega market for the past 20 years. She has a daughter going to university, so she works hard in her business so that she can help her daughter pay for her studies. Carla is a responsible woman, a warrior, and humble, who works Monday through Sunday to sustain her family. She was a kitchen assistant and saved to start her little business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, sauces, and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es: Adilia de 43 años de edad vive con su hijo, ella se dedica al comercio de producto de tienda por mayor, posee más de 20 años en el negocio con capital propio, ella tiene su producto adquirido  a súper mayorista y  vendido a tiendas minoristas, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Adilia solicita un crédito para mejorar su vivienda, (construcción de muros) como protección de su patrimonio familiar pero no le alcanza con lo que gana por esa razón solicita dicho crédito para compra cemento, arena, hierro y pago de mano de obra y asi vivir mas seguros con su hijo.
texts.en: Adilia is 43 years old. She lives with her son. She works as a merchant selling store products wholesale. She has had her business for more than 20 years with her own capital. She gets her products from a super wholesaler and sells to retail shops. With what she earns from her sales she is able to pay for her household needs. Adilia is asking for a loan to improve her home (building walls) to protect her family assets. What she earns is not enough and that is why she is asking for a loan to buy cement, sand, iron and to pay for labor so she can live more safely with her son.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.es:
la señora Maria es habitante de chinandega es madre soltera es madre de 4 hijos uno de ellos en edad escolar la señora cuenta con un negocio de venta de comida en el mercadito de chinandega desde hace 31 años es una mujer trabajadora, humilde con deseos de superacion la señora trabaja de lunes a domingo en su negocio para poder sacar adelante  asu hijo el deseo que ella tiene es incrementar el negocio para poder asegurar los estudios y el bien estar de su hijo  y de su familia.

ella solicita financiamineto para la compra de granos basicos por mayor y verduras para la produccion de sus platios de comida.
texts.en:
Maria lives in Chinandega. She is a single mother to four children, one of whom is school-aged. Maria has had a business selling food in the Chinandega market for the past 31 years. She is a hardworking and humble woman who wants to get ahead and do well. She works from Monday to Sunday in her business so that she can take good care of her son; she wants to expand the business so that she can assure the well-being and education of her son and her family. 

She is requesting a loan to buy staple items wholesale, and vegetables, to make her food.

loans.use: To purchase hundredweights of staple grains, rice, oil, sugar, beans, and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting, rods, nails, etc. to repair the roof on her house.

loans.name: José Elenilson

texts.es:
José trabaja como vendedor de hamacas, jugueteras y equipos de sonido cuando le encargan y varios electrodomésticos para el hogar, desde hace 3 años este trabajo lo aprendió de un cuñado que antes vendía estos productos y viendo la posibilidad de seguir el negocio y sabiendo que esto le generaba ingresos decidió seguirlo y ponerlo en práctica; este  negocio le queda a una distancia de 2 horas, sale por los cantones aledaños a vender sus hamacas o cosas que le encargan en este trabajo ya invirtió en la primera ocasión con la ayuda de los préstamos y ve que es mejor para poder ir comprando más. Sale de su casa a las 7 de la mañana y llega a las 4 de la tarde o cuando le va bien y vende todo llega luego a la casa.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar hamacas y  dos jugueteras, ya que él trabaja con encargos en caso de las cosas más grandes como jugueteras y camas; pero él siempre las hamacas no le faltan para que los clientes que busquen siempre encuentren. Con el crédito anterior compro mucha mercadería y la vendió toda y le quedo mucha ganancia y de eso compro más productos.

Loa sueños que tiene son poder tener una comercial de venta de electrodomésticos.
texts.en:
José works selling hammocks, home entertainment shelving and sound systems when he gets orders for them, and various electrical appliances. He has made a living with this activity for three years. He learned this business from a brother-in-law that used to sell these products. He looked at the possibility of carrying on the business and he knew that it was generating income, so he decided to pursue the idea and put it into practice.

His business is two hours away, and he goes out into neighbouring cantons to sell his hammocks or other items that customers have ordered from him. He made his first investment with the help of the loans and sees that it is better to be able to buy more and it helps to better invest his money in the business. He goes out on his own to sell, and his wife stays home and if someone is looking for a small thing, she sells it there. José leaves home at 7:00 in the morning and gets home at 4:00 in the afternoon. When business goes well, he sells everything and then comes home. 

He is requesting the loan to buy hammocks and two home entertainment shelf units, as he works with orders in the case of larger items such as shelving units and beds. However, he always has hammocks so that the customers who want them always find them. 

With his previous loan he bought a lot of merchandise and sold it all. He made a good profit and used this to buy more products.

His dream is to have a shop selling electrical appliances.

loans.use: to buy hammocks and two home entertainment shelving units.

loans.name: Dany

texts.es: Dany es soltera pero tiene un hijo, ella vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un anticretico, al menos la casa tiene luz, agua y alcantarillado. Dany se gana la vida como comerciante de electrodomesticos y necesita un prestamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de televisores, planchas y licuadoras  para tener mayores ingresos Dany es la unica persona que mantiene a su hijo pero goza de buena salud y necesita colaboracion para mejorar su nivel de vida
texts.en:
Dany is single but she has a son. She lives in La Paz, in a brick and cement house which she rents as an anticrético (arragement in Bolivia where the renter pays the landlord a fixed sum upon entry, and this money is returned at the end of the contract when the renter moves out).  At least the house has electricity, water, and toilet plumbing. 

Dany makes her living selling electrical appliances, and needs a loan to acquire more televisions, irons, and juicers, so as to make more money. Dany is the sole provider for her son, but she enjoys good health and needs help to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to acquire a larger quantity of TVs, irons, and juicers

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
For the last 10 years, Beatrice has been in the dressmaking business. She is 45 years old  and   earns a monthly income of KES 20,000 (Kenya Shillings). She is married to Maurice and blessed with three school-going children.
	 	
She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy  more fabric materials for dressmaking.
 
Beatrice will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and open a school for dressmaking.                                  	
.

loans.use: to buy more fabric materials for dressmaking

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Battambang province, Pheap is 63 years old and a mother of three children, one of whom is in school. To secure the needs of the family, she grows rice on four hectares. She can earn an income of about 38,900 KHR per day. This is the third cycle for Pheap with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans on time. 

Pheap is the leader of this two-person group, and she will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and insecticides. In the future, she hopes that she can gain a good yield to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a thirty-six-year-old married man with six children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a cocoa garden and his business is buying and selling cocoa. This business has helped him look after his family well. He faces a challenge of price fluctuations and the general seasonal changes that affect his expected returns. He hopes to educate his children. He wants the loan to buy cocoa for resale.

loans.use: To buy cocoa for selling.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a 35-year-old entrepreneur from Tanzania. She is married and has one child. Mwanakombo volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in her community. This means that she teaches life skills to secondary students and explains the negative implications of early marriage to their parents. When she is not volunteering, Mwanakombo runs a small retail shop where she sells basic household items like soap, sugar, cooking oil, and salt. These items must be purchased in a town 12 hours away, which is costly in terms of time and money. 

Mwanakombo’s business profits go toward paying her child’s school fees and their household expenses. With a loan from Kiva, Mwanakombo intends to buy more daily-use items to sell in her shop so that she can meet her customers’ needs. She will use the extra profits to expand her shop.

loans.use: to buy more daily-use items to sell in her shop

loans.name: Leyli

texts.en:
Leyli lives with her retired husband. They both have long been involved in agriculture. They work hard to be able to earn a living. They have a business keeping cows, calves, five piglets and some hens. Leyli's husband assists her greatly in her everyday activities related to farming; he sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of the family's income. 

To continue running her agricultural business in a sustainable way, Leyli needs a loan of 1500 USD to purchase forage for the livestock and hire workers for organizing cultivation of the land. She and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will greatly appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan amount to maintain and develop their agricultural business.

loans.use: to pay for forage for the livestock and hire workers for organizing cultivation of the land

loans.name: Dalila

texts.es: Dalila de 49 años de edad vive con su hija, ella posee una tienda en su casa de habitación,  además de tienda tiene ingreso de remesas que su esposo le envía de los EE.UU. ella tiene 15 años de experiencia como comerciante, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Dalila solicita un crédito para compra de inventario como: sopas, granos básicos, azúcar, golosinas, refrescos etc. para surtir mas su negocio, y asi poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Dalila, 49 years old, lives with her daughter. She has a store in her house. In addition to her shop, she has remittance income that her husband sends her from the USA. She has 15 years experience as a trader. With the earnings from her sales, she manages to pay for the necessities of her home. Dalila is requesting a loan to buy inventory such as soups, basic grains, sugar, candies, drinks, etc. to stock her store more and thus be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soups, basic grains, sugar, candies, drinks, etc.

loans.name: José Blas Antonio

texts.es:
José de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, la esposa realiza los oficios domésticos en su casa, han procreado dos hijos de 8 y un años de edad.

José se dedica a la reparación de radios desde hace 16 años, lo aprendió de su papá que le enseño este oficio; también  se dedica a la fabricación de rocolas y el taller está en su casa, pero hace reparaciones a domicilio también. Este trabajo lo hace solo de un horario de 6:00 am a las 4:00 pm.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar dos computadoras, pleibo para fabricar dos rocolas, esto le ayuda mucho, debido a que ahorita ha tenido un accidente y se dañó el pie; pero ese trabajo no requiere estar de pie. Con el crédito anterior compro laminas y polines pare el techo de la casa esto le ayudo, ya que hoy están en casa más segura y los hijos no se mojan.

Los sueños  que tiene son siempre tener una familia unida y que el negocio de las rocolas le dé mucho más, ya que las anda de feria en feria.
texts.en:
José, 35, finished high school. His wife performs housework in their home. They have two sons who are ages 8 and 1.

José has been dedicated to repairing radios for 16 years. He learned it from his father who taught him this job. Also, he is dedicated to making jukeboxes. His workshop is in his house but he also makes repairs to his house. He does this work alone from 6AM until 4PM.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy two computers and plywood to make two jukeboxes. This will help him a lot since right now he has had an accident and injured his foot. But this work does require for him to stand. With the previous loan, he bought sheets and beams for the roof of his house. This helped him since now the house is more secure and his children don't get wet.

The dreams that he has are always to have a united family and that his jukebox business gives him much more since he shops them from market to market.

loans.use: to buy two computers and plywood to make two jukeboxes.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo,  vive con su hijo, el se dedica a la venta de pan dulce y francés, su panadería esta ubicada en su lugar de residencia, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, el joven solicita un crédito para comprar harina, manteca, levadura, miel, azúcar, etc. y asi poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y poder  darle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young man (whose face has been pixelated because he's 22 years old and lives in a high-risk area) lives with his son and earns a living selling "pan dulce" [sweet bread] and French bread.  His bakery is located in his home.  With what he earns from his sales he manages to cover the household expenses that come up.

The young man is requesting a loan to buy flour, shortening, yeast, honey, sugar, etc.  That way he can continue with his job, because it's his only source of income and way to give his son a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, shortening, yeast, honey, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Fidel Antonio

texts.es:
Fidel, con 56 años de edad, es casado y padre de 2 hijos. 

Se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, un visionario y buen negociante. 

Siempre ha trabajado como comerciante, vendiendo lotes de madera y, desde hace 13 años tiene su propio negocio.  

Ha sabido superar tiempos difíciles en el comercio y sueña con comprarse su casa propia y tener un negocio que perdure en el tiempo; es por ello que Fidel acudió a solicitar un préstamo, el cual utilizará para comprar lotes de madera que comercializa en el municipio de Tierra Alta.

Fidel es un hombre muy organizado y le gusta atender a sus clientes de la mejor manera posible, y se siente a gusto cuando visitan su negocio.  

La suma de todo estos esfuerzos le brindan a toda su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Fidel, 56, is married and the father of two children.  He's known for being a very responsible and hardworking man, a visionary and a good businessman.

He has always worked as a merchant selling bundles of wood, and he has had his own business for 13 years.

He has been able to overcome hard times in commerce and he dreams of buying his own house and having a business that lasts over time.  That's why Fidel turned to requesting a loan, which he'll use to buy bundles of wood to sell in the town of Tierra Alta.

Fidel's a very organized man.  He likes to serve his customers in the best way possible, and he's pleased when they visit his business.  The sum of all these efforts gives his entire family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bundles of wood

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard lives in Nor Artik village with her husband and two sons. Alvard's husband is a constructor working as a migrant worker in a neighbouring country. 

For more than 13 years Alvard has been involved in farming, raising wheat and also livestock (cows, calves, sheep, pig and hens). The family sells its agricultural products in the local market. To continue her farming activities in a sustainable way, Alvard needs a loan of $1,300 to buy forage to feed the livestock. 

She and her family rely on the goodwill of lenders and are thankful to them for their support in sustaining their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for forage to feed the livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Vilma Ivett

texts.es: Vilma de 44 años de edad,  se dedica a la compra y reventa de chatarra, hierro, cobre, plástico, lata, ella tiene más de 12 años de dedicarse al negocio de chatarra, porque le da más ganancia que trabajar de empleada, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar sus necesidades diarias, ya tiene clientes estables, ya que es muy conocida en la zona, Vilma solicita un crédito para la compra de mas  chatarra y asi mejorar sus ingresos, y asi  poder tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Vilma is 44 years old and works buying and reselling scrap iron, copper, plastic and tin. She has spent more than 12 years working because she can make more money this way than with a standard job. 

What she makes from making sales allows her to fulfil her day-to-day needs, as she has stable clients and is well known in her neighbourhood. A loan will help Vilma to buy more scrap to increase her income and her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy scrap iron, copper, plastic, tin etc.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: Vicente es comerciante y su esposa es cocinera. Vicente se gana la vida vendiendo comida, en especifico un platillo conocido como anticucho (el anticucho es papa y corazón de pollo asado, es de gran aceptacion en toda Bolivia e incluso tiene su popularidad en el Peru) Vicente quiere un prestamo para establecer un puesto fijo, es decir para comprar la patente que le permita trabajar por su cuenta, actualmente vende sus anticuchos en el puesto de su madre y quiere independizarse Vicente tiene un hijo y vive en La Paz, su negocio es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar, por eso necesita su ayuda.
texts.en:
Vicente is a merchant and his wife is a cook.  Vicente earns a living selling food, specifically a dish known as "anticucho."  (Anticucho is potatoes and grilled chicken heart; it's popular throughout Bolivia and even in Peru.)

Vicente wants a loan to set up a permanent stall: that is, to buy the license that will allow him to work on his own.  Currently he sells his anticuchos in his mother's stall and he wants to become independent.

Vicente has a child and he lives in La Paz.  His business is the only source of income in his household, so he needs the help.

loans.use: to buy the license to set up a permanent stall

loans.name: Veronica Yesenia

texts.es: Verónica  tiene 33 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hijo de 11 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando. Ella es la responsable de su hogar dado que su compañero de vida emigró al extranjero en busca de mejores condiciones de vida. Verónica se gana la vida por medio de la venta de ropa, sandalias y zapatos desde hace dos años. Este negocio le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar y dar a su familia lo necesario. Verónica desea reparar el techo de su vivienda dado que actualmente se encuentra deteriorado y en tiempo de lluvia el agua se filtra. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos, etc.
texts.en:
Verónica, 33, lives in her own home with her son, 11, who attends school.  She's responsible for her household because her life partner emigrated in search of better living conditions.

Verónica has earned a living selling clothing, sandals, and shoes for two years.  This business allows her to support her household and give her family what they need.

Verónica wants to repair the roof of her house because currently it's damaged and water gets in when it rains.  That's why she's asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in buying galvanized metal sheets, wood, nails, etc.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, nails, etc., to repair the roof of her house

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 4 hijos y vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es propia y tiene todos los servicios basicos Victoria tiene dos ocupaciones: vende ropa y animales domesticos pero entre los riesgos esta el de sufrir un accidente por los constantes viajes que realiza Victoria quiere un prestamo para comprar mayor cantidad de ropa Ella es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar y por eso necesita su ayuda, ademas goza de buena salud y es una persona muy entusiasta
texts.en:
Victoria has 4 children and lives in La Paz in a brick and cement house which she owns and which has all basic amenities. Victoria has two jobs: she sells clothes and also domestic animals, but this comes with risks such as suffering an accident due to the constant journeys she has to make. 

Victoria wants a loan to buy clothing in bulk. She is the only source of income in her household and so she needs help. She also enjoys good health and is a very enthusiastic person.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Celso Isaias

texts.es:
Celso es agricultor, aprendió el oficio desde que tenía 15 años de edad y se lo enseñó el abuelo, ya que él era un joven que le gustaba mucho andar con el abuelo y fue así como aprendió dicha actividad, hoy en día Celso le agradece al abuelo por haberle inculcado este oficio, además con mucho esfuerzo han comprado un terreno en el cual pretenden cultivar café, el trabajo agrícola lo hace en un horario de 6:00 AM a 1:00 PM

El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para comprar plantas de café, fertilizantes para realizar la siembra de café y pagar a los mozos, ya que el crédito anterior solo sembró la mitad  del cultivo que él tiene, esto lo hacen con la ayuda de la familia ya que el cultivo es familiar.  

Los sueños que Celso tiene son poder seguir trabajando y que un día tengan una finca muy grande y reconocida en la comunidad, ya que la familia de ellos son muy reconocidos y así darles empleo a personas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Celso is a farmer. He learned this trade from his grandfather when he was 15 years old, as he enjoyed spending time with his grandfather when he was young. Nowadays Celso is grateful to his grandfather for having taught him this trade. Also, with a lot of effort, they have bought some land where they intend to grow coffee. He carries out his agricultural work from 6 a.m. till 1 p.m.

He needs the loan he has applied for to buy coffee plants and fertilizers to help with planting the coffee, and to pay the workers, as he only planted half of the crops that he has with the previous loan. He does this with the help of his family as it is a family business.  

Celso's dreams are to be able to continue working and that one day they will have a very big farm which will be well-known in the community (as their family are already very well-known) and which will enable them to give work to people from the community.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and fertilizers to help with planting the coffee, and to pay the workers.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es: María tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 5 años de edad. Ella habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar y se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos. Ella desea mejorar las condiciones habitacionales de su familia por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, grava y arena dado que desea encementar el piso de la tierra el cual actualmente es de tierra. Expresa que espera mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda de manera progresiva.
texts.en:
María, 35, is the single mother of a five-year-old child.  She lives in her own home with her family and earns a living providing housekeeping services.

She wants to improve her family's living conditions, so she's asking FUSAI for this loan to invest in buying cement, gravel, and sand.  She wants to cement the floor, which is currently made of dirt.

María said she hopes to gradually improve the condition of her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, and sand to cement the floor of her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, washable toilet bowl, and iron in order to build a room with a washable toilet.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 31-year-old businesswoman from Tanzania. She is married and has two children. Josephine is a Camfed Learner Guide in her community; she volunteers at the local secondary school, encouraging students to study hard and face life's challenges. 
Josephine also runs a cosmetics shop and the profits of her business go toward household expenses and her children’s school fees. She is requesting a Kiva loan so that she will be able to expand her business. She would like to become a cosmetics wholesaler one day. Josephine will use the profits of the Kiva loan to support her children and start saving money in her bank account.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Josephine works hard to support her family. She has a fish selling business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. She is borrowing 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs and to make improvements to their pen

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel and bricks to build a sidewalk and cement over the floor of her house.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is a 31-year-old businesswoman from Tanzania. She is married and lives with her two younger sisters. To give back to her community, she volunteers in a secondary school as a Camfed Learner Guide helping youth learn life skills. 

Farida owns a retail shop and she loves interacting with her customers. She is requesting a Kiva loan so that she can expand her business by purchasing more products to attract more customers. 

With the profits she will earn, Farida will be able to support her family. Farida is happy to be a role model in her community. She also encourages other women to start their own businesses.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing more products to attract more customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cloth to tailor and sell to her customers.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 21-year-old Tanzanian businesswoman and mother. She lives with her parents, siblings and daughter. Irene is a Camfed Learner Guide who volunteers at the local secondary school. She focuses on helping students improve their school performance. 

She also sells bedsheets in her village. She uses her profits to support her young daughter and parents. Irene would like a Kiva loan to expand her business and rent a stall to sell and store her bedsheets.

loans.use: to expand her business and rent a stall to sell and store her bedsheets.

loans.name: Jema

texts.en:
Jema is a 21-year-old businesswoman from Tanzania. She is a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide where she encourages youth to improve their quality of life. When she is not volunteering in the local secondary school, Jema sells household items in her retail shop. 

Jema’s business profits help her take care of her mother and improve her business. Jema is requesting a Kiva loan so that she can increase the amount of products for sale in her shop. She will then earn more profits and also pursue higher education.

loans.use: To increase the amount of products for sale in her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel and bricks to construct a kitchen.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is a hardworking entrepreneur who runs a business building boxes to sell dried fish in the Philippines. She has been running her business for the past eight years and earns more income making furniture. Ana Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She has successfully repaid her previous loan.

Ana Marie is requesting a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase wood, nails, and other items to build boxes to sell. In the future, she dreams of saving money to expand her business and to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase wood, nails, and other items to build boxes to sell dried fish

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 40 years old. She is a married woman with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has a cocoa garden where she harvests cocoa for food and for selling to the cocoa agents in her area, supplemented by what she buys from other cocoa farmers. 

She works hard to look after her family financially. She is affected by seasonality changes, which reduce her profits. She hopes to have a big store and wants the loan to buy cocoa for selling.

loans.use: To buy cocoa for selling

loans.name: Aeshi

texts.en:
Aeshi is a 22-year-old businesswoman from Tanzania. She is the mother of one child. Aeshi is a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide at her local secondary school, where she encourages students to recognize the importance of education. 

Aeshi also sells rice. She buys the rice from farmers and resells it to people in her village. To help her community members get good food, she is requesting a loan from Kiva so that she can rent a stall to store her rice. She would also like to sell the rice to different areas of her region. 

She will use the profits she will earn to feed her daughter and send her to nursery school.

loans.use: To rent a stall to store her rice

loans.name: Janvier

texts.en:
Janvier is 31 years old. He is married with one child who is 1 month old. He sells building construction materials and has been working in a business for the past three years. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more ion sheets, cement and nails for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy more ion sheets, cement and nails for sale.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 30-year-old mother, volunteer, and businesswoman from Tanzania.  Lucy volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school, where she teaches life skills to young students. Lucy is also a tailor and sews bedsheets to sell to people in her village. 

Lucy has been running her business for five years, and she is known in her village as the woman who produces good quality bedsheets. Her business allows her to provide food for her family. 

Lucy is requesting a Kiva loan so that she can buy a good electronic sewing machine and materials to make the bedsheets. The sewing machine will be extremely helpful to Lucy because then she will be able to make the bedsheets faster and satisfy her growing customer base. With the profits she will earn, Lucy would like to purchase some land.

loans.use: To buy a good electronic sewing machine and materials to make bedsheets

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a 21-year-old businesswoman from Kilosa District in Tanzania. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at the nearby school, where she teaches life skills to secondary school students. Rehema enjoys discussing life challenges with the students and how obstacles can be overcome. 

Rehema supports herself by running her own clothing business. She buys and sells clothes in her community and uses the profits to buy food and other basic items and pay for her younger brothers’ school fees. 

Rehema is requesting a loan from Kiva so that she will be able to expand her business. She would like to buy more clothes to attract more customers. Rehema intends to find fashionable apparel to make her shop unique.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying more clothes to attract more customers

loans.name: Francisco Adalberto

texts.es: Francisco de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la venta de hot dog, hamburguesas, etc. su negocio lo tiene cerca de su casa, con lo que vende logra solventar algunos gastos, francisco está solicitando un crédito para poder mejorar su vivienda pero con lo que gana de su trabajo no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, por esa razón solicita un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder colocar puertas y ventanas donde muestra en la fotografía y construir un cuarto, por esa razón solicitan el crédito y así comprar cemento, ladrillos, ventanas, puertas y pago de mano de obra y si poder vivir más seguros con su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco is 35 years old and lives on his own house with his wife and two children. He works selling hot dogs, hamburgers, etc. His business is close to his house and with what he earns he manages to pay some of the expenses.

Francisco is requesting a loan to make improvements on his house but what he makes from his work is not sufficient to pay for it. For this reason he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to be able to install doors and windows as shown in the photo and to construct a room. For this reason he is requesting a loan to buy cement, bricks, windows, doors and to pay for labor so he can live more safely with his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, windows, doors and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goats to expand his herd

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to help her coffee crops once more.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 33-year-old businesswoman from the Bagamoyo District of Tanzania who has two children. To give back to her community, Asia is a nurse attendant and volunteers as a community health activist and Camfed Learner Guide in her village, where she encourages students to read in order to increase their academic performance. 

Additionally, Asia runs a small pharmacy shop. The pharmacy business helps her community obtain medicine easily. Asia uses the profits from her business to buy basic household items for her family and pay her children’s school fees. She is requesting a Kiva loan so that she can add essential medicine to her pharmacy. This will benefit the community and help her earn more profits.

loans.use: To add essential medicine to her pharmacy

loans.name: Cinyabuguma B Group

texts.fr: Bichozi est commerçante et conseillère de la banque communautaire Cinyabuguma B, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 30 ans, mère de 2 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des laits caillés au marché du port depuis 12 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle va acheter 500 kg de lait caillé. Son conjoint est un policier. Elle souhaite  acheter une parcelle, construire une maison, acheter un véhicule, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Bichozi is a shopkeeper and advisor to Cinyabuguma Group, a community banking group and client of the microfinance institution Hekima. She is 30 years old, married, and the mother of two children, both attending school. Her spouse is a police officer. 

Bichozi has been selling curds at the market near the port for 12 years. She started her business with funds she received from her husband. With the loan, she is going to purchase 500kg of curds. She hopes to purchase a plot of land, build a house, purchase a vehicle, and educate and feed her children. 

She thanks Hekima for the support they provide to entrepreneurs who lack access to finance through the traditional banking system.

loans.use: To purchase 500kg of curds.

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es:
Arminda de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, es madre soltera de 4 hijos.  El esposo viajo para Estados Unidos y la dejo con sus hijos. Vive con sus padres y sus cuatro hijos los cuales dos de ellos están estudiando, la mayor ya salió de estudiar y anda en busca de trabajo.


Arminda realiza los quehaceres del hogar y desde hace dos años elabora los alimentos para los alumnos de una escuela. Esto lo hace porque la maestra de esa escuela es muy apreciada con ella y ella cocina bien y por eso la han buscado, es poco lo que gana ahí; pero con mucho esfuerzo.

Antes ella trabajaba en una tienda, pero se salió por cuidar a los niños.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar lamina para la casa, ya que ella y sus padres están construyendo con mucho esfuerzo una casa, para que los hijos tengan un techo donde vivir, esto ayudara mucho porque gracias al préstamo van a tener la casa y serán felices.
texts.en: Arminda is 34 years old. She studied up to sixth grade. She is a single mother of 4 children. Her husband traveled to the United States and left her with the children. She lives with her parents and her four children, two of whom are studying. The oldest girl finished her studies and is looking for a job. Arminda works in household chores, and for two years she has been preparing food for the students at a school. She is doing this because a teacher at that school likes her well and called her because she cooks well. She does not earn much there, but she does it with great effort. She used to work at a store, but she left it to take care of her children. She is requesting a loan to CREDICAMPO to buy sheets of metal for the house, because she and her parents are building a house with much effort, so that her children have a place to live. This will help a lot, because thanks to the loan they will have a house and be happy.

loans.use: to buy sheets of metal for the house.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis started farming in 1987 when he was only 22 in a small village called Koroma Nduini in Central Kenya. Twenty seven years later, with a wife and 3 children, he owns a small piece of land on which he grows various crops and raises poultry. As passionate as he may be about farming, the income is not enough to meet the growing expenses. This has forced Francis to venture into other side businesses looking for something extra.

Francis has enjoyed poultry farming very much. He wants to expand this section of his farm but he is faced with serious challenges accessing adequate funds. Francis is seeking a small business loan to purchase poultry. When he was asked why he is seeking funds, he replied, "They are short term loans so as to improve my farming activities."

Profits from this investment will go towards his children's education and a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riego, posee un taller de costura en su casa de habitación, tiene mucha clientela por la calidad con que elabora su trabajo, ella vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hija, la joven esta solicitando un crédito para la compra tela, hilos, agujas, botones, etc. y continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en: The young woman's photograph has been blurred because she is 22 years old and lives in a high risk area. She owns a sewing shop in her house. She has many customers because of the quality of her work. She lives in her own house, together with her domestic partner and their daughter. The young woman is requesting a loan to buy fabric, threads, needles, buttons, etc., and to continue with her work which generates good earnings.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, needles, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria de 51 años de edad desde hace 10 años posee una venta de tortillas ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por los buenos precios, Maria Vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor y cal, y asi continuar con su trabajo que le deja buenas ganancias y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en: Maria is 51 years old. For 10 years she has had a business selling tortillas in her home. She has many customers because of her good prices. Maria lives in her own house with her husband and their son. She is requesting a loan to buy corn at wholesale prices and lime powder. This way she will continue with her work, which gives her good earnings, and be able to have a better quality of life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale prices and lime powder.

loans.name: Serieux Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Sérieux vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 47 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Darsalam de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce de bois et charbon et d’habillement. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  6eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Kadiatou (la 2eme  femme assise de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de  bois de chauffage et de charbon dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  un chargement de charrette en bois de chauffage et 30 sacs de charbon à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Kadiatou  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 40 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four women in Sérieux Group all live in nuclear families. They average 47 years of age and three children each. They all live in Darsalam, a neighborhood in Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They got to know each other through bonds of community, kinship, marriage, and through the money-earning businesses they run in the neighborhood. They retail wood, charcoal, and clothing.

In order to bolster their working capital, the members of the group decided to work with Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their sixth solidarity loan (group loan).

Ms. Kadiatou is the second woman from the left in the photograph. She's a great seller of firewood and charcoal in the neighborhood and its surroundings.

She intends to use her loan to buy a cartload of firewood and 30 sacks of charcoal in Ségou. She sells at her home, for cash and often on credit, to a mixed-gender clientele.

With this loan, Ms. Kadiatou hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 40'000, which will be used to cover her children's daily needs and also to increase her working capital. She would like to continue this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy a cartload of firewood and 30 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Tiessiri vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village Konodimini de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de condiment et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  10eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Awa (la 2eme femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiment de tout genre dans le village Konodimini et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  une grande quantité de condiment à fana et à konodimini chez les maraichers. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Awa espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 25 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four women in Tiessiri Group all live in traditional families. They average 42 years of age and five children each. They all live in Konodimini, a village in Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They got to know each other through bonds of community, kinship, marriage, and through the money-earning businesses they run in the village. They retail condiments and run food serving businesses.

In order to bolster their working capital, the members of the group decided to work with Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their tenth solidarity loan (group loan).

Ms. Awa is the second woman from the left in the photograph. She's a great seller of condiments of all sorts in the village of Konodimini and its surroundings.

She intends to use her loan to buy a large quantity of condiments from market gardeners in Fana and in Konodimini. She sells at her home and at the market, for cash and often on credit, to a mixed-gender clientele.

With this loan, Ms. Awa hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 25'000, which will be used to cover her children's daily needs and also to increase her working capital. She would like to continue this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of condiments

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a 35-year-old man married to Peris, who adds additional income to support their family welfare. They are blessed with three children. Josphat has been a farmer for a period of seven years, earning an income of 15,000 KES at the end of every month.

Josphat was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing his first loan of 30,000 KES and intends to use this amount to buy seeds and fertilizers for his farm plantation.

Josphat plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children and hopes to become a successful businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Vumilia

texts.en:
Vumilia is a 26-year-old married mother of two children from Rufiji District in Tanzania. In addition to taking care of her children, Vumilia also supports her two younger sisters. To give back to her community, she is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer and a businesswoman. As a Camfed Learner Guide, Vumilia teaches young students life skills at the local secondary school. 

To support herself financially, Vumilia weaves women’s hair and sells hair extensions. For her business, she has to travel to the city to buy her products, and she uses the profits to buy more merchandise for her shop. She is requesting a loan from Kiva so that she can pay rent for her shop and increase the amount of products she can sell. Vumilia will use the profits from her sales to increase the well-being of her family and continue to expand her shop.

loans.use: To pay rent for her shop and increase the amount of products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: pants, skirts, blouses, socks, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
