Zaida se dedica a la agricultura y siembra Papaya, utilizara el dinero del crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas con el apoyo del crédito puede comprar lo que sea necesario para la siembra de papayas. El realiza las compras en la ciudad de Ventanas todas las semanas, su sueño es tener una casa propia, enfrentara los desafíos que se le presente en la vida. En los tiempos libres se dedica a jugar futbol.
texts.en:
Zaida, age 31, lives in the canton of Ventanas in the Los Ríos province. She is single, and lives with her family and her two children, aged 5 and 13 years.

Zaida is a farmer, and she grows papaya. She will use the money from the loan to buy agricultural supplies. The loan will support her in getting what she needs to successfully plant papaya. She makes her purchases in the city of Ventanas on a weekly basis. Her dream is to have her own home, and she will face whatever challenges face her in life. In her free time, she likes to play soccer.

loans.use: buy papaya seed and fertilizers

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 42-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He grows crops like pineapples, coffee and bananas. He started the business with the hope of economically empowering his family. He faces hardships of inadequate capital and poor soil that is infertile. Besides that, he hopes to buy a car to enable him to deliver his produce to the market very quickly. 

Moses needs a loan to improve his pineapple garden by applying manure.

loans.use: to improve his pineapple garden by applying manure.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald, aged 45, lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has a produce business and earns extra income from a bar, a retail shop and farming, where he is assured of constant income throughout the year. Despite his progress, he is challenged by price fluctuations and the bad roads that make transportation of his produce to his customers difficult. However, his vision is to buy a personal vehicle to enable him to move with ease to the villages to buy produce. 

Ronald has asked for a loan to buy more beans, rice and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beans, rice and maize to sell

loans.name: Abdulkadir

texts.en: Abdulkadir is a married man with two children who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a hardworking man who buys and sells maize, gnuts (groundnuts), millet and beans. He earns other income by growing and selling bananas. He began his business in order to meet his family's needs and build a permanent house, but lacks enough capital to fulfill his dreams. The purpose of the loan is to purchase building materials to finish his house.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to finish his house

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 48 years old, married, and has six children, two of whom attend school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for one year.

Annabelle requested a loan from NWTF for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more stock such as canned goods, egg, milk, sugar, etc. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks such as canned goods, egg, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Galaciano

texts.en:
Galaciano is a 26-year-old man, married, with three children who live in Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

He owns a retail shop selling bread, soft drinks like sodas, sugar, soap, cooking oil, and general merchandise. He obtains other income from farming. He began the business, so as to be able to meet his family's needs and to supplement his income from agriculture, associated with a problem of price changes. 

Galaciano hopes to expand his retail shop, though he mainly faces a challenge of low turnover. He is requesting the loan to buy shoes and stockings to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes and stockings to sell.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 36 years old and married, with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Analyn runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like soap, shampoo, and canned goods.

Analyn has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like soap, shampoo, and canned goods.

loans.name: Rosa Amalia

texts.es: Rosa tiene 31 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos. Rosa es pequeña comerciante, ella vende variedad de sandalias y zapatos desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como junto a su compañero  de vida mantienen la economía del hogar. Rosa desea reparar el techo de la vivienda dado que se encuentra deteriorado por lo que solicita este crédito  a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para dar inicio a la mejora del techo lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 31, lives in her own home with her partner and their children. Rosa is a small businesswoman who sells a variety of sandals and shoes. She's been in this line of work for some time now and this is how she, along with her partner, are able to sustain their home and family.  

Rosa wants to repair the roof of her home since it's gotten deteriorated. She will use the money from this loan to buy sheets of galvanized steel, wood, and nails so that she can start repairing the roof as soon as possible.

loans.use: buy materials to repair the roof of her home

loans.name: Armando Leon

texts.es:
Armando es un veterano con mucha experiencia en el campo. 

Es humilde y sencillo, tiene un gran don de gente y energía suficiente para poder cualquier cultivo a producir.

El tiene un cultivo de café el cual trabaja todos los días para vender sus cosechas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Liborina.

Gracias a sus años de experiencia y enseñanzas que le dio su padre desde niño, tiene plena capacidad para trabajar y para asesorar en estos temas a los demás agricultores de la zona que necesiten ayuda con su producción.

El solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, semillas de café y pesticidas, de esta manera inyectara capital a su actividad y mejorara sus cosechas de una manera significativa.

Tiene mucha fe en su negocio y grandes esperanzas en las personas solidarias que apoyan a los campesinos trabajadores.

Apoya a un humilde agricultor para que pueda sacar adelante sus tierras!
texts.en:
Armando is a veteran with a lot of experience in the field. He's a humble, simple man, with a gift for people and enough energy to make any crop produce. He has a coffee crop that he works every day, and he then sells his harvest in the market plaza in the town of Liborina.

Thanks to his years of experience and the lessons he got from his father as a boy, he has plenty of capacity to work and to advise other farmers in the area who need help with their production. He is requesting this loan so that he can buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, coffee seed, and pesticides. The increase in capital will help improve his harvest significantly. He has a great deal of faith in his business and high hopes in the people united to support hardworking farmers.  

Help this humble farmer to improve his lands!

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies to support his coffee crop

loans.name: Natali

texts.es:
La socia se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza diferentes platos como caldo de gallina y caldo de cordero, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, carne y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower has a business in which she sells food. She prepares different dishes, such as chicken soup and lamb stew. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. The borrower has been in this business for eight years and is doing very well. Her dream is to open a restaurant. She is requesting a loan in order to buy products for cooking such as rice, meat, and chicken.

The borrower is pleased with loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, meat, and chicken.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa y vendiendo adornos de navidad, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues in her business selling clothing and Christmas decorations. She sells pants, blouses, and t-shirts. She has several years of experience in this line of work, and it's going very well for her. Her goal is to have a stand at a market. The member will use the money from this loan to buy shoes, t-shirts, sweaters, and blouses.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Marío Antonio

texts.es:
Mario de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato. Está casado y  ha procreado dos hijos que están estudiando. 

Mario posee una tienda y aprendió por medio de su papá y su mamá a administrarla. También se dedica a prestar servicios en estructuras metálicas. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, embutidos, galletas, golosinas, bebidas, pan, etc. para surtir mas su tienda. 

Él planea que su tienda crezca y que tenga más ingresos para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Mario is a 34-year-old with a high school education. He is married and he has two children who are in school. Mario has a store that he learned how to run from his parents. He also provides services doing framework. 

The loan he is requesting from CrediCampo is to purchase rice, beans, sugar, salt, lunch meat, cookies, candy, beverages, bread, etc to stock his store.

He plans to grow his store and to make a larger profit for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, salt, lunch meat, cookies, candy, beverages, bread, etc to stock his store.

loans.name: Abagambakamu Balema Silc Group

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with two children who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

She is a member of a village bank where they guarantee one another for a loan. She operates a retail shop dealing in general merchandise which she started with capital from savings in their group and group loans. She obtains additional income from a salary as a teacher. 

She experiences the hardship of low capital to buy her goods, accompanied by price fluctuations. Her vision is to be economically well off with the proceeds from her business. Mary is requesting a loan to add more beer, soap and water to the business to sell.

loans.use: to have more beer, soap and water to sell.

loans.name: Kpangmanga - Zoggu Group

texts.en:
Pagkpema is an active woman of 45 years from Zoggu in the northern region of Ghana. Pagkpema is married, and has four children. She is the person squatting in front of every other member in their group picture. 

Pagkpema is a member of Shea Nut Pickers and Shea Butter Processing Group who have been doing the business over the past 25 years. Their group is called ‘Kpangmanga - Zoggu’ Women Association. She makes good profits from the business, since she and every member of her group are been trained by Grameen Ghana and Planet finance on how to process high quality premium shea butter for shea butter marketing companies to buy and export.

Pagkpema and the group have asked for a loan of GHS 9,600. The share of the loan to Pagkpema would pay the cost of buying four bags of shea nuts for the extraction of shea butter.  By so doing, she would increase productivity and her income, and hence repay the loan, and support her three children to be in school.

loans.use: to buy four bags of shea nuts for the extraction of shea butter.

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
Santa Ana se formó en Ciudad del Este, todas ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que han decidido tomar las rienda y trabajar unidas para poder ayudar a sus familias, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para que por medio de ella puedan conocer la situación de cada una y conforme a ello poder mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra Nanci, quien poco a poco y por medio de las capacitaciones ha ido mejorando, también le ha sido de mucha ayuda su trabajo en la costura, que lo viene haciendo hace un buen tiempo, y que le ha permitido hacerse de muy buena clientela. Pide este préstamo para comprar telas en cantidad para poder cumplir con sus clientes y con los pedidos de estos.
Todas y cada una de ellas están agradecidas por la oportunidad que reciben de mejorar las condiciones de vida de cada una.
texts.en:
“Santa Ana” is a group that was formed in Ciudad del Este.  All of these women are heads of household, so they have decided to take the reins and work together so that they can help their families.  They have taken the poverty elimination survey, which helps them become familiar with their individual situations so that they can make changes to improve their lives. 

One of the members is Sra. Nanci, who has made gradual improvements as a result of the training.  It has also been a great help in her work as a seamstress, a profession that she has been in for quite some time.  Nanci has been able to build up a very good clientele.  She is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics in quantity so that she can satisfy her customers by completing their orders.  

All of these women are grateful for the opportunity they have received so that each one can improve her own living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabrics in bulk.

loans.name: Jose Emiliano

texts.es: José de 59 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos una niña de 16 años y un varón de 13 años de edad. Él es un hombre que se esfuerza por salir adelante cada día y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia por medio de su trabajo en una llantera en la cual se encarga de cambiar, reparar y vender llantas a los clientes. José desea mejorar el techo de su vivienda, ya que actualmente se encuentra deteriorado y es por el deseo de mejorarlo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para terminar de construir un cuarto en su vivienda.
texts.en: José is 59 years old and he lives in his own house along with his wife and 2 children, a girl who is 16 years old and a son who is 13 years old. He is a man who works hard to get ahead every day and give his family a better quality of life. He does this through his work in a tire store that changes, repairs, and sells tires to customers. José wants to improve the roof on his house because it is currently deteriorated. In order to fix it, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase: galvanized metal roofing sheets, c-beams, and bolts so he can finish building a room in his house.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal roofing sheets, c-beams, and bolts so he can finish building a room in his house.

loans.name: Rosa Candida

texts.es: Rosa de 42 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida, su madre y su hija, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de mondongo, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar cada necesidad de su hogar, Rosa solicita un crédito para la compra de mas mondongo asi como muestra en la fotografia para producir más ganancias, Para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rosa is 42 years old and lives with her life partner, her mother, and her daughter.  She buys and sells tripe for a living; her business is located in her home and she uses the earnings from her sales to cover all of her household necessities.  Rosa is requesting a loan to buy more tripe, which we can see in the photo, to make more income so she can offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more tripe

loans.name: Janice Marie

texts.en:
Janice Marie is 33 years old and single.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, groceries, etc. 

Janice Marie has been in this business for one year.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is 53 years old and married with eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, groceries, etc. 

Genara has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years, and also earns an income from raising pigs and retailing gasoline.

Genara aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert a hardworking man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He started selling motorcycle spare parts, alongside being a mechanic, to earn a better living. 

He wishes to increase his stock, despite competition. Robert is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for selling.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies that will help with supporting and maintaining her coffee crops

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Badeya est composé majoritairement de femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 48 ans et 7 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (oignons), habits et charbon du bois. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Aïchata  (femme arrêtée en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des condiments (oignons). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 8 sacs  d’oignons en gros au grand marché de Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila à une clientèle de femmes. Madame Aïchata  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Badeya group is composed mainly of monogamous women who average 48 years of age and seven children each. They all live in Kanadjiguila, commune of Mandé, in the Kati circle, and they know one another as neighbors. They sell condiments (onions), clothing and charcoal.  

To bolster their working capital, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is their 4th group loan cycle.

Mrs. Aïchata (standing second from the left in the group photo) is a leading reseller of condiments (onions). She will use her loan to buy eight sacks of onions wholesale at the big market in Bamako. She retails her stock in Kanadjiguila where her clientele consists of women. 

With this loan, Mrs. Aïchata expects to earn an average monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA, which she will reinvest in her activity. 

With the help of Soro Yiriwaso, her long-term goal is to purchase some land to live on.

loans.use: to buy condiments for resale.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: Martín de 53 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos dos niñas de 6 meses y 12 años de edad y un varón de 5 años de edad. Él es un hombre que busca cada día la manera de sacar adelante a sus hijos desempeñándose  como albañil independiente en los cantones cercanos a su localidad y en municipios cercanos. Martín siempre buscando mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia desea construir un baño con pila y lavadero en su vivienda, para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un baño con pila y lavadero en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Martin is 53 years old. He lives in is own house with his life companion, and his 3 kids. Two girls who are 6 months old and 12 years old respectively, and a boy who is 5 years old.

This is a man who everyday tries to look for ways to support his kids. He is an independent construction worker. He works in the villages next to his city, and in nearby towns.

 Martin is always trying to improve his family's life conditions, and he wants to build a bathroom with a sink and a washing place. This is why he is requesting to loan to FUSAI, to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a bathroom with a sink and a washing place.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a bathroom with a sink and a washing place in his home.

loans.name: María Lilibeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jaramijo se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo que es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señorita Lilibeth, tiene 22 años de edad y es soltera, ella estudia el cuarto año de medicina lo cual para ella es lo más importante. Vive en casa de sus padres. 
Doña Lilibeth con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto solventar sus gastos de estudios hace tiempo atrás surtió un pequeño negocio en su casa, allí vende pañales, toallas sanitarias, paños húmedos y varios productos relacionados al cuidado y aseo de los bebes, entre otras cosas, allí también vende productos Avon  (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), estos los vende en su local y también en su centro de estudios ya que sus compañeras son sus mejores clientas, tiene más de 4 años con su negocio el cual le da para salir adelante en sus estudios
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pañales, toallas sanitarias, paños húmedos y varios productos que ella vende. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace  3 años y le gusta porque con los créditos sigue adelante. Sus sueños terminar su carrera y ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
The Credit Jaramijo Group meets every 15 days in the county of Jaramijo which is known for its beautiful beaches.  Here most people are hard-working and dedicated to the work at sea.

This is where Lilibeth lives.  She is 22 years old and single. She has reached the fourth year of study of medicine which is most important to her. She lives with her parents.

Lilibeth has the intention of getting ahead on her own and in order to cover the cost of her studies, she has for some time had a small business at home. She sells diapers, personal hygiene products, wet wipes and products for babies among other things. She also sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, fragrances and accessories for women).  She sells them in her shop and also in the school because her classmates are her best clients.

She has more than 4 years in this business which helps her get ahead in her studies.
This loan is to buy diapers, sanitary napkins, wet wipes and various products she sells.  She has been in the Credit Group for 3 years and likes it because credit continues. Her dreams are to complete her studies and be a great professional.

loans.use: to buy diapers, sanitary napkins, wet wipes and various products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens for fattening and to repair the chicken shed.

loans.name: William Monday

texts.en: William is a hardworking married man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He sells motorcycle spare parts alongside farming to earn money to pay school fees for his children. He is a loving father who does not want his children to be like him, who never attained education. William is hoping to set up a modern garage despite competition for the local market. He intends to use the loan to buy motorcycle spare parts for selling.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts for selling.

loans.name: Pastor

texts.es:
Pastor es casado  no tiene hijos vive en casa en alquiler en la ciudad de El Alto.
El  estudio hasta el nivel secundario. Se dedica a la venta de humintas. Su esposa es ama de casa.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de víveres como maiz, queso, aceite y otros para incrementar la cantidad de humintas que vende al dia. Pastor es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar y necesita su ayuda 
El sueño de Pastor es tener su pasteleria. En la foto aparece junto a su esposa
texts.en:
Pastor is married and has no children.  He rents a house in the city of El Alto.  He studied up to secondary school.  His wife is a homemaker.

He needs the loan to buy corn, cheese, oil, and other provisions to increase the number of "humintas" [tamales] he sells every day.  Pastor is the only source of income in his household and he needs your help.

Pastor's dream is to have his bakery.

He appears with his wife in the photo.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, oil, and other provisions

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Mujeres Unidas, está integrado  por  19 integrantes, donde están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza que les ayudará a poder conocer la situación de cada una y conforme a ello poder esforzarse por salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gloria , quien comenta que su préstamo lo usara para la compra de insumos para la fabricación de sillas rusticas ,trabajo que lo realiza con su marido, A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza.
La Sra. Gloria está agradecida por la oportunidad que están recibiendo y que les permitirá ayudar a sus familias y a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group is called “Mujeres Unidas” and is made up of 19 members who are participating in the elimination of poverty program, which helps them learn of each-other’s situations and motivates to them to move ahead.

Gloria is one of the members who says that she will use her loan to buy supplies for making rustic chairs, which she and her husband do.  She is improving her life through application of her work and important behaviors.

Gloria is grateful for the opportunity they are receiving and this helps her family and loved ones.

loans.use: to buy chair making supplies.

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es: Sandra de 35 años de edad vive en casa familiar ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, ya tiene diez años de experiencia, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal y a quienes les vende son personas que viven en el centro, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades de su hogar, Sandra solicita un crédito para la compra de maíz  por quintales y cal, para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sandra, 35, lives in the family home.  She earns a living selling tortillas and already has 10 years of experience.  Her business is located in the town market and she sells to people who live downtown.  She's able to pay for her household necessities with what she earns from her sales.

Sandra's requesting a loan to buy corn by the quintal and lime so she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal and lime

loans.name: G.s. La Fe Group

texts.es:
El  g.s La Fe está conformado por cinco integrantes cuatro mujeres y un hombre, originarios  de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de la región, y se caracteriza por ser una zona productora de Leche, cuajada, queso estas personas se conocen  por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar y se vieron obligados a  trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos, y  proporcionarles mejores oportunidades de vida.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante, la cordinadora es Martha y  tiene por actividad económica la compra y venta de cerdos en pie. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. g.s. la fe agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo dingo.
texts.en:
The "La Fe" (Faith) communal bank is made up of five members, four women and one man.  They are natives of Leon, which is located in an area of a region known for producing dairy products, like cheese curds and cheeses.  The people are known for being hard-working, responsible and having a great desire to improve their personal situations.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, the communal bank members weren't able to go to school and instead needed to start working at young ages to help with the household expenses.  They now work hard day after day to provide better futures for their children, to provide them with better opportunities in life. 

Martha is the coordinator of the group and thanks to her desire to get ahead, she has a business, buying and selling live pigs.  The business is located in her home.  She spends about ten hours a day selling her products.  The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock up her business so that in the not-too-distant future she can earn a better income.  The members of the "La Fe" communal bank are grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to low-income people from poor countries, like Nicaragua, so they can earn a dignified living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock up her business of buying and selling live pigs.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza, a 34-year-old married mother of three children, one of whom is in school, has been farming rice in the Philippines for 10 years. She also earns  income from a general store.

Riza is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 47-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer growing bananas and coffee, and he also burns bricks in order to boost his income. He faces the challenges of pests and diseases, 

 James is requesting a loan to rehabilitate his banana plantation and burn more bricks. He has hopes of offering quality education to his children and completing his house construction.

loans.use: to rehabilitate his banana plantation and burn bricks.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon, a 34-year-old married father of three children aged between ten and two years, has been selling clothes for the past six years. With this loan, he would like to buy more skirts, shirts and shorts to sell. 

Simon will use his business profits to renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy more skirts, shirts and shorts to sell

loans.name: Luz Y Vida Group

texts.en:
From rural San Francisco el Alto, in the southwestern region of Guatemala, we are pleased to introduce you to the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Luz y Vida,” meaning “Light and Life”.  There are 11 ladies in the group, three of whom are new members. They are excited to receive their first loan that they will invest in their various businesses. The ladies are motivated to succeed and are seeking opportunities to generate income and improve their standard of living. 

The President of the Trust Bank is 43-year-old Ceferina. A married mother of seven, Ceferina has a textile business and works with her husband to make traditional skirts called “cortes”.  They sell the “cortes” by the dozen to various locales. Ceferina is requesting a new loan that she will use to purchase a variety of colorful, woven fabrics and other supplies.

Ceferina and the ladies in the “Luz y Vida” Trust Bank not only improve their lives with small loans but also with educational seminars given at their monthly meetings.  These seminars are interactive, and the ladies learn from one another. They learn how to manage their loans and increase their income with topics like budgeting, marketing, customer service and accounting. The women learn about empowerment, leadership, women’s rights and sexual abuse. They also gain useful information about health, nutrition and the use of medicinal plants. 

The women greatly appreciate the opportunity to participate in the Microcredit Plus Program of Friendship Bridge. Their newly acquired tools (loans and education) will help them empower themselves, sustain or expand their small businesses and eliminate poverty. They will watch as their children have opportunities that they never had, like attending school and possibly graduating from the university. KIVA investors are valuable partners with Friendship Bridge in this effort. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase a variety of colorful, woven fabrics and other supplies

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El señor Roberto se dedica a la venta de leche, ya que cuenta con doce vacas lecheras, también compra y vende productos de plástico para su comercilizacion.
Hace aproximadamente cuatro meses tambien incremento su actividad comercial ya que cuenta con una camioneta de multiuso, en lo cual se dedica a la compra y venta de productos de mercería, ropería y enceres de la casa, y cobra en forma semanal (macate). 
El señor Roberto vive en San Lorenzo con su familia, tiene cuatro hijos, quienes le ayudan en la distribución de todos los productos que vende. Su idea mas adelante, es la de mejorar su vehículo, comprando uno mas nuevo. 
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar productos de mercería, ropería y enceres de la casa, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Roberto sells milk and has 12 dairy cows.  He also buys and sells plastic articles.

He increased his activity about four months ago, now that he has a multiuse truck, which he also uses to buy and sell merchandise, clothing, and household items.  He collects payments every week.

Roberto lives in San Lazaro with his family.  He has four children who help him with distribution of his products.  His greatest idea is to buy a newer vehicle.

He is asking for this loan so he can buy clothing and household items so he can continue making sales as he has been doing.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Patricia Yanira

texts.es: Patricia de 23 años de edad habita en vivienda propia desde hace 21 años, actualmente vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo de 2 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que gracias a su esfuerzo ha sabido apoyar a su compañero de vida en la economía del hogar, prestando sus servicios domésticos en una tortillería del mercado central. Patricia desea encementar el piso de su vivienda que como se observa en la fotografía actualmente es de tierra por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Patricia, 23, has lived in her own house for 21 years.  Currently she lives with her life partner and her two-year-old child.

She's a woman who has been able to help her partner with the household budget, thanks to her effort offering cleaning services in a tortilla shop in the main market.

Patricia wants to cement the floor of her house.  Currently it's made of dirt, as seen in the photograph, so she's requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, and gravel to cement the floor.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel to cement the floor of her house

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Shirley works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from rice retailing.  Shirley is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Shirley has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a 31-year-old married man with 2 children. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells maize and at the same time grows bananas. He faces challenges of poor roads and price fluctuation. Besides those challenges, he has hopes of having a poverty-free life. He needs a loan to invest in farming by buying maize flour and beans for selling.

loans.use: to invest in farming by buying maize flour and beans for selling

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana, tiene 61 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos y dos nietos, reside en el Municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio vendiendo productos de belleza por catalogo y ropa. Lleva 6 años de haber establecido una pulpería para vender productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser azúcar, arroz, frijoles, harina, café, sal, manteca, productos de aseo, lácteos, refrescos y achinería. El préstamo que solicita es el tercer ciclo con la institución y es por 15,000 lempiras el que invertirá en la compra de achinería, productos lácteos, productos de aseo, refrescos, golosinas y granos básicos para surtir y vender. Su idea es seguir incrementando su negocio como su fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana, age 61, is a single mother with four children and two grandchildren.  She resides in the town of Tela, Atlántida.  Ana has always been in the business of selling beauty products through catalogs, as well as clothing.  
Six years ago, she established a store where she sells basic household products such as sugar, rice, beans, flour, coffee, salt, lard, cleaning products, dairy products, soft drinks, and knickknacks.  The loan she is requesting is her third one with ODEF.  It is in the amount of 15,000 HNL and will be invested in the purchase of knickknacks, dairy products, cleaning products, soft drinks, snack foods, and basic grains so that she can restock her store and sell them.  Her plan is to continue expanding her business as her source of income.

loans.use: to buy knickknacks, dairy products, cleaning products, soft drinks, snack foods, and basic grains to sell out of her store.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Bekuo Group

texts.es: Doña Filomena es una clienta con mucha trayectoria en Fundación Mujer, esta mujer indígena de 70 años, es jefa de hogar, y actualmente vive solo con su hijo menor, ambos trabajan en una pequeña finca propia donde siembran plátano. Su edad no es impedimento para trabajar y seguir luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y las de su comunidad. Es una mujer muy activa y líder comunal, que pertenece a una Asociación de Mujeres Indígenas de Talamanca, que luchan por obtener condiciones favorables para el Cantón, donde la agricultura es la principal actividad económica, y para ella una forma de autoempleo para poder hacerle frente a sus necesidades básicas. Los créditos le han permitido fortalecer su negocio, y sacar adelante a su familia a través de los años. Esta nueva inversión será para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, insecticidas, abonos, bolsas y otros insumos, y así poder aumentar la producción de su cultivo. El grupo lo conforman 4 socias más que también van a invertir en actividades de agricultura.
texts.en:
Filomena is a is a member with a strong path in Fundación Mujer. She is 70 years old, a native of Costa Rica, the head of her household, and currently lives with only her youngest son. Both of them work on a their own small farm where they plant plantains. Her age does not slow her down in her work, and she keeps striving to improve their quality of life, and the community's as well.

She is a very active woman and a community leader. She belongs to the Asociación de Mujeres Indígenas de Talamanca [Native Women's Association of Talamanca], which works to obtain favorable conditions for the village where agriculture is the main source of income. For her, agriculture is a form of self-employment that helps her face her basic needs.

The loans have allowed her to strengthen her business and move her family ahead through the years. This new loan will be used to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, compost, bags, and other inputs, and will help increase production of her crops. The group is made up of 4 other members that will also be investing in agricultural activities.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, compost, bags, and other inputs.

loans.name: Cleto

texts.es: Cleto es habitante de la comunidad de Arajllanga y vive en la casa de sus padres Cleto se gana la vida como agricultor y corre el peligro de que su ganado no produzca leche Cleto quiere un prestamo para la compra de ganado vacuno para mejorar sus ingresos Cleto es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Cleto lives in his parents' house in the community of Arajllanga.

Cleto earns a living as a farmer, and runs the risk that his cows won't produce milk.  He wants a loan to buy cattle to improve his income.

Cleto's the only source of income in his household, so he needs your help.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Jovenes Artesanos Group

texts.es:
El Comite esta conformado en total por 6 jovenes con aspiraciones, sueños y propósitos por lo cual están dedicando el máximo empeño,ellos son estudiantes, pero quieren poder aportar un poco para los gastos de la casa.
Alberto, uno de los integrantes, se dedica a la venta ambulante de todo tipo de productos, y pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas, artículos varios y demás.
Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe que le permitirá seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The committee is made up of six young people with aspirations, dreams, and purposes for which they are dedicating maximum effort.  They are students but would like to contribute some toward their household expenses.

Alberto is one of the members.  He sells all types of products on foot and is asking for a loan so he can buy clothing, various items, and other things.  He is grateful for the opportunity that will allow him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing an other items.

loans.name: Las Milagrosas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las milagrosas  está en su ciclo número 7º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante., son mujeres muy luchadoras que se están esforzando por ayudar a sus seres queridos a través del esfuerzo en conjunto.
La Sra. Edelira es la Tesorera de Grupo se dedica a la venta de gallina y huevos,  ella misma maneja el negocio, por lo tanto el préstamo que retira es para la compra de sus productos para la elaboración de sus empanadas, Sándwiches, comidas en gral., y de esa forma poder implementar la venta de alimento, ayudando a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The “Las Milagrosas” group is in its 7th cycle of the Committee for Women’s program, where they all work and help one another get ahead.  They strive very much and are making a united effort to help their loved ones.

Edelira serves as the group’s treasury and sells chicken and eggs.  She manages the business herself.  She is asking for this loan to buy supplies to make empanadas, sandwiches, and food to sell and help out her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 54 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like crackers, candies, groceries, etc.

Teresita has been in this business for 2 years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like crackers, candies, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Luís Alfredo

texts.es:
Luís de 32 años de edad, es bachiller, esta casado. Su pareja trabaja oficios domesticos y ademas se dedica a la venta de lociones (cosmeticos). Tiene un hijo que vive con él. 

Luís trabaja con ganado bovino (repasto) lo ha hecho por unos 2 años y lo aprendio de unos familiares y decidio hacerlo para buscar un ingreso economico extra, ademas trabaja la agricultura y con estructuras metalicas, antes solo era empleado de jornal. La distancia esta como a 3 cuadras y viaja a pie o en vehiculo. Se involucra su esposa. Su horario es de 7:00 am a 4:00 pm de lunes a sabado. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar un ganado de repasto, le mejorara mucho su condicion de vida ya que puede comprar de una vez y asi tener mayores ganancias y por lo tanto mejor calidad de vida. La necesidad satisfecha es que puede comprar ganado sin tener que vender lo que ya posee. 

Sus sueños son que su hijo estudie y se prepare academicamente y él espera trabajar de la mejor manera para poder crecer en el negocio.
texts.en:
Luís is 32 years old, has his school diploma and is married. His partner does the housework and also sells lotions and cosmetics. He has a son who lives with him.

Luís has worked with cattle for around 2 years. He learnt the trade from family members and decided to start it in order to have an additional income. He also works in agriculture and with metallic structures. Before that he was just a day laborer. He walks the distance of about 3 blocks or goes in his vehicle. His wife also helps out. He works 7am - 4pm Monday - Saturday.

The loan he is asking for is to buy other grazing livestock. This would improve his living conditions greatly as he can buy it and then have a greater income and so a better quality of life. The need satisfied by the loan s that he can buy livestock without having to sell what he already owns.

Luís' dream is that his son will study and be academically prepared, and he hopes that he himself will be able to work in the best possible way to be able to grow the business.

loans.use: to buy grazing livestock.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago es casado, tiene casa propia en la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio hasta el nivel secundario. Para vivir atiende un depósito en el cual se guarda quinua,naranja, papaya. Trabaja de lunes a sabado, anteriormente se dedicaba a la costura pero por motivos de  salud tuvo que dejar esta actividad 
 El crédito lo requiere para comprar arroz, aceite y otros viveres ya que Santiago esta abriendo un lugar donde va a vender pollos a la broaster y quiere potenciar este negocio, el cliente no tiene a quien acudir por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Santiago is married and has his own house in the city of El Alto. He studied up to Secondary level. For his living he takes care of a warehouse where quinoa, oranges and papaya are stored. He works from Monday to Saturday. He used to sew but had to leave this trade due to health reasons. He needs the loan to buy rice, oil and other foods. Santiago is opening a place to sell roasted chicken and he wants to develop this business. Customers have no place to get this so he needs your help.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and other foods.

loans.name: Tetyana

texts.en:
Tetyana is married. She has a 4 year old daughter. She lives in a one-storey house with her family.

Tetyana works as a nurse in the orphanage.  Also she sells milk, homemade sour cream and cottage cheese. Tetyana is an open and nice person.  

Tetyana is asking for a loan in the amount of 15,000 UAH to change the front door and windows of her house.  This will help to keep heat in the house and will cost less money in winter.

loans.use: to change the front door and windows of her house.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan es de la localidad de Santaní, está casado, es una persona muy trabajadora, es dueño de una despensa, comedor y hospedaje, hace 15 años que trabaja en esto y por medio de su trabajo es que pudo dar a su familia lo que necesitan para una vida sin privaciones.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder surtir su despensa, con comestibles, bebidas, frutas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su negocio, y trabajando por mejorar día a día.
texts.en:
Juan is from the town of Santaní. He is married and is a very hard working person. He owns a store, restaurant and an inn. He has been doing this for 15 years and through his work he has been able to give his family what they need for a live without deprivation.   

He is asking for this loan to invest in buying materials to stock his store with food, beverages, fruit and more. This way, he can continue with his business, working to improve day to day.

loans.use: to buy food, beverages, fruit and more.

loans.name: Happy Ayllu Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “HAPPY AYLLU”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vilma ella es soltera y tiene 29 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende chompas, pantalones y polos entre otras ropas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m llevando a diferentes lugares como instituciones o sus amigos, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda donde pueda vender la ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chompas, medias, polos pantalones y casacas.

Los socios que están pegados a la foto grupal pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo y los fotos son de uno de los prestamos anteriores. 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de sabanas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de productos de belleza.
texts.en:
These are the members of the communal bank “Happy Ayllu”, located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the Cusco province in the Cusco Department.

Vilma is one of the members. She is 29, single, and has a child. She works selling clothes such as sweaters, pants and shirts, from 08:00 am until 08:00 pm. She visits different places and sells to her friends, and this is how she progresses together with her child. She has been doing this for five years and does very well. Her dream is to own a store where she can sell her clothes.

Vilma is requesting a loan to buy sweaters, socks, shirts, pants and jackets.

The pictures at the bottom, to the left and right, shows the members that could not come to the meeting when the picture was taken because they had to work. The members of this group work selling clothes, selling bed sheets, selling groceries and selling beauty products.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, socks, shirts, pants and jackets to sell.

loans.name: Placidie

texts.en: Placidie is 46 years old. She is married with three children between 19 and 16 years old and all of them go to school. She sells shoes and has been running this business for 10 years. After getting her loan, she would like to buy more shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be reinvested in the business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
Flor de 33 años de edad,  estudio hasta noveno grado, el esposo se dedica a la albañilería, en esta relación ha procreado dos hijos  de 10 y 5 años de edad.

Flor se dedica a los oficios domésticos, anteriormente se dedicaba al comercio de venta de zapatos y ropa en el mercado; pero por cuidar a los hijos no ha buscado nuevamente el trabajo y el esposo se encarga del sostén de la casa y de la familia; pero flor se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y aun cerdo que compra para engordarlo y así buscarle venta y de esa manera le ayuda al esposo. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar una ternera, para cuidarla hasta que sea una vaca y continuar teniendo leche.

Los sueños que tiene son siempre darle  lo mejor a los hijos y que se preparen dedicadamente y que en un futuro sean profesionales todo con esfuerzo se puede y con la ayuda de Dios
texts.en:
Flor, 33, has a ninth-grade education.  Her husband earns a living in construction.  They have had two children, ages 10 and 5.

Previously she sold shoes and clothing in the market, but she hasn't looked for another job because she takes care of the children.  Her husband's responsible for supporting the household and the family.  Flor helps her husband, though, by raising hens and a pig she bought to fatten for sale.

The loan she's requesting is to buy a calf to raise until it's a cow and continue having milk.

Her dreams are to always give her children the best and for them to be dedicated students and become professionals in the future.  Anything is possible with effort and God's help.

loans.use: to buy a calf to raise to produce milk

loans.name: Assia

texts.en: Assia, age 29, is married with one child, seven years old, who is in primary school. She sells foodstuffs and has been selling in this business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more onions, bananas and potatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more onions, bananas and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Gubkatimali - Nagdigu 1 Group

texts.en:
Fuseina is 43 years old and has five children. She is a member of a shea nut processing women’s group from Bagurugu in the northern region of Ghana. Their group is called ‘Gubkatimali - Nagdigu 1’ Women Association.
 
Fuseina has been in this business with 15 others in the group for the past three years. Her share of a new loan of GHS 4,500 will support her to buy four bags of shea nuts and to pay for fuel to power stoves for the processing of premium shea butter. There are off-taker organizations and individuals who buy the shea butter that Fuseina and her colleagues process for both local and exporting.

She intends to expand the business venture, and thereby increase her income and sustainability. With the increased income, she will be able to repay the loan, stay in business, and also support her five children to have better education and better food to eat.

loans.use: to buy four bags of shea nuts and to pay for fuel to power stoves for the processing of premium shea butter.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in hand-carved masks and drums. He would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, polish, and stains.

Daniel has been selling through NOVICA since 2007. This is his story:

"I'm married and I have four children, but I also look after five other children. I had already worked in carpentry when my brother-in-law taught me the art of carving. I specialize in traditional masks and African drums, and I usually get a good response from people. However, due to financial constraints I'm not able to produce more work to meet the demand. I love to create new designs, so I constantly work to diversify my collection. I have taught more than ten people how to carve, and they are also well-established in this trade."

"I thank each of you in the name of Jehovah. I truly appreciate your continued support."

Use the link below to view Daniel's hand-carved masks and drums on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/6552

loans.use: to invest in purchasing raw materials, including wood, polish, and stains

loans.name: José Saúl

texts.es:
José de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta 9° grado, está casado y su esposa es empelada, tiene 1 hijo que vive con ellos, el señor además de su familia vive con sus padres. 

Tiene 5 años de ser empleado como vendedor en una comercial, es su primer empleo donde se desenvuelve, se transporta en motocicleta todos los días y tarda unos 12 minutos para llegar a su horario es de 8:00 am a 4:00 pm. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para instalar la energía eléctrica en la casa donde piensa vivir e independizarse de sus padres, tiene que comprar los postes ya que donde tiene la vivienda está alejada de la calle. 

Desea Eseguir trabajando para salir adelante y estar más estables para tener más hijos en un futuro.
texts.en:
José, 32, has a ninth-grade education.  He's married and his wife is employed.  He has one child who lives with them.  His parents also live with him and his family.

He has been employed for five years as a salesman at a shopping center.  It's his first job.  He goes to work every day on a motorcycle; it takes him around 12 minutes to get there.  His schedule is 8 a.m. to 4 p.m.

The loan he's requesting is to install electricity in the house where he plans to live and become independent from his parents.  He has to buy the poles because the house is away from the street.

José wants to keep on working to get ahead and be more stable so he can have more children in the future.

loans.use: to install electricity in the house where he plans to live

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra has been making and selling different kinds of scarves and sarongs since 1980. The earthquake destroyed her shop in 2010. Thanks to a US $4,000 Zafen loan, she re-launched by buying paint and textile fabrics directly from China. She has two big shops in Grenada and in the States. She successfully repaid the loan within a year. Now, she is looking for funds to build a production workshop and a storefront in the space she has now. The money will be invested in buying wood, corrugated metal sheets and iron bars for the workshop. A slight improvement is also needed in the stock room as well. Your contribution will put her economic activity to the next level.

loans.use: To buy materials to build a workshop, a stock room, and two bathrooms and to buy three sewing machines.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es: Daniela esta divorciada desde hace 4 años y tiene 4 hijos Daniela vive en Viacha en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un alquiler, la casa tiene luz, agua y alcantarillado pero presenta un defecto: el piso de cemento se encuentra desgastado Daniela es vendedora de comida en un puesto callejero y necesita un prestamo para pagar el tratamiento de una de sus hijas que sufrio un accidente Daniela es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar y necesita su ayuda Daniela goza de buena salud y su evaluacion es buena
texts.en: Daniela has been divorced for 4 years and has 4 children. Daniela lives in Viacha in a brick and cement house where she pays rent. The house has electricity, water and sewerage, but it has a bad thing: the cement floor is very worn out. Daniela sells food at a street stall, and she needs a loan to pay for the medical treatment of one of her daughters who suffered an accident. Daniela is the only source of income in her household and she needs your help. Daniela is healthy and her assessment is good.

loans.use: to pay for the medical treatment of one of her daughters who suffered an accident.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es viuda y necesita un credito para refaccion de vivienda Rosa vive en El Alto  y percibe una renta Rosa tiene un hijo y es poseedora de una casa de ladrillo y cemento Rosa es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda Ella quiere tener una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: Rosa is a widow and needs a loan to repair her house. Rosa lives in El Alto and an income. Rosa has a son and has a house made of brick and cement. Rosa is the only source of income for her household, so she needs your help. She wants to have a have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina San Cayetano es un grupo unido, numeroso, cada vez más fortalecido, está integrada por 22 mujeres emprendedoras, se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres. Mantienen la firmeza en seguir trabajando con el grupo, porque expresan que uniéndose y ayudándose mutuamente pueden llegar mucho más lejos.
Cabe destacar a la Sra. Maria, integrante de este comité, por su deseo y empeño en mejorar su condición de vida y la de sus hijos; trabaja como empleada en una casa de familia, con el préstamo que pide planea montar un pequeño negocio en su casa y así poder generar un ingreso secundario, el cual consiste en una pequeña despensa con productos varios. Así también sus compañeras están muy motivadas y con espíritu emprendedor trabajan activamente.
texts.en:
The San Cayetano communal bank is a close-knit group with many members, getting stronger all the time.  It is made up of 22 enterprising women and is in the fourth loan cycle of the women's communal bank program.   They remain determined to continue working with the group, because they say that by joining together and helping one another they can get much further ahead.

Maria,  a member of this group, is worth highlighting for her drive and effort in improving her standard of living and that of her children.  She works as a housekeeper in a family home, and with the loan she is requesting plans to set up a small business in her home and this way generate a secondary income.  This consists of a small grocery store with a variety of products. In the same way, her fellow group members are highly motivated, and work energetically, with an enterprising spirit.

loans.use: To set up a small grocery store with a variety of products.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es una mujer de 52 años de edad, casada, madre de un hijo de 19 años y su negocio es la pesca.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, luchadora, fuerte, responsable, buena madre y trabajadora. Su labor la realiza en la comunidad ‘Cachilaya’ que se encuentra a una altitud promedio de 3900 metros sobre el nivel del mar y al lado Lago Titicaca, el clima del lugar es frío y los rayos solares bastante fuertes.
Paulina es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello largo negro trenzado, su vestimenta es típica (pollera, manta y sombrero), su lengua materna es el aymara y también habla español. Su trabajo diario es la pesca de peces del lugar como;  ispi, karachi, pejerrey, trucha, boga, suche, mauri y ahora también la trucha dorada que es única en el mundo. Su labor la realiza en bote, y ya lleva 30 años de experiencia recorriendo grandes distancias. Su hijo la acompaña haciéndose cargo de las redes porque su esposo se encarga del cultivo de la tierra. Ella sueña navegar con seguridad en el lago, su deseo es realizar la compra de un bote porque el que tiene esta muy viejo y no brinda la seguridad necesaria.
Es por esos motivos que Paulina solicita un préstamo para la compra de un bote de pesca que brinde seguridad al navegar.
texts.en:
Paulina is a 52 year old woman. She is married, has a 19 year old son, and her business is fishing.
She is enterprising, independent, tenacious, strong, responsible, a good mother and hardworking. She works in the community of ‘Cachilaya’ which is located at 3900 meters (12,795 feet) above sea level, next to the Titicaca Lake. This place has cold weather and very strong sun rays. 
Paulina is dark skinned, of medium height and long braided hair. Her dress is native (skirt, shawl and hat). Her native language is Aymara, but she also speaks Spanish. Her daily work is fishing regional fish such as: ispi, karachi, silver smelt, trout, boga, suche, mauri, and now also the golden trout which is unique in the world. She works on a boat, and she already has more than 30 years of experience traveling long distances. Her son accompanies her and takes care of the nets because her husband works cultivating the fields. She dreams of navigating the lake safely. Her wish is to buy a boat because hers is very old and not safe enough. For this reason Paulina is requesting a loan to buy a boat that is safe to navigate.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat that is safe to navigate.

loans.name: Leonel Alfredo

texts.es: Leonel tiene 47 años  de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos  hijos de 18 y 13 años de edad. Leonel se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado bobino y vacuno desde hace 10 años. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Este negocio es la principal fuente de ingresos de Leonel por lo que desea invertir en la compra de otras cabezas de ganado vacuno y bobino para mantener el negocio activo y poder cubrir un mercado más grande. Dado que no cuenta con el efectivo para hacer la inversión solicita este crédito a FUSAI para proceder a la compra del ganado.
texts.en: Leonel is 47 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and two children, who are 18 and 13 years old. Leonel has bought and sold cattle for 10 years. This is how he earns a living and brings sustenance to his household. This business is the main source of income for Leonel, so he wants to invest in the purchase of additional cows to maintain his business actively and to be able to cover a larger market. Since he doesn’t have the cash for the investment, he requests this loan from FUSAI to proceed with the purchase of the cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle for his business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan proviene de una Familia muy unida, se desempeña como oficial de créditos de una financiera.
 Su objetivo es crear su propia empresa y así aplicar sus conocimientos que ha adquirido por medio de sus estudios en la carrera de administración de empresas, es un hombre muy luchador y emprendedor.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en las cuotas de su carrera, de manera a poder seguir luchando por cumplir su meta de ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Juan comes from a very close family.  He works as a loan official in a finance company.

His goal is to start his own business and apply the knowledge he has acquired in his studies to his career in business administration.  He's a very persevering and enterprising man.

Juan's requesting this loan to be able to pay his program fees so he can continue striving to fulfill his goal of being somebody in life.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
At the age of 56, Yem is living in a community of Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has two married children and one unmarried child. To support the family, she is working very hard on her own cassava field and sells the crop to the local dealers and customers in the market. The net profit that she can generate is $5 USD a day. 

To keep her cassava growing well with more fruit, she normally uses natural fertilizers in her farmland. However, now she can’t afford the fertilizer. She is now requesting a loan to buy some fertilizers to use. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy some fertilizers.

loans.name: Vilma Isabel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Sagrado Corazón se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Vilma, tiene 64 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Vilma con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudar con los gastos del hogar  se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, trabaja todos los días por ratos ya que no cuenta con horarios fijos, ella también le da parte del crédito a su marido para que él lo emplee en su  carro ya que él trabaja realizando fletes por toda la ciudad, y el carro necesita de ciertos repuestos y adecuaciones para brindar un mejor servicio. Ella lleva más de 5  años en su negocio el cual le da para salir adelante cuando su marido no gana mucho en su labor. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa de todo tipo y repuestos que necesita su marido para el carro. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho a ella y a su marido. Sus sueños son tener otro carro nuevo.
texts.en:
The community bank Sagrado Corazón meets every 15 days in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are visited throughout the year and for being a city with unparalleled beauty with lots of tourist  attractions. 64-year-old Vilma lives in this place. She is married and has three adult children from the relationship. One of them lives in her house. Her husband is a driver. 

Vilma sells all types of clothing in order to have her own income and help with household expenses. She works for awhile every day although she doesn't have a fixed schedule. She will also give part of the loan to her husband and he will spend it on his car since her makes trips throughout the city and the car needs certain parts and adjustments to provide the best service. She has worked in her business for 5 years and it helps her get ahead since her husband doesn't earn much. This loan is going to be used to buy all types of clothing and the parts that her husband needs for his car. From the beginning of the Sagrado Corazón group, she has enjoyed being a part of it because the credits help her and her husband a lot. Their dream is to have another new car.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her business and car parts for her husband's driving service.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 30 years old and married with one child who is in school. Christine works very hard to provide for them.

Christine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Christine has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and school supplies. 

In the future Christine would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 36 years old and has three children. She is married and two of her children are in school.

Arlene is in the agriculture business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for three years.

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is 38 years old and is married. She has four children; two of her children are in school.

Julita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Julita has been raising pigs for two years.

In the future, Julita would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 49 years old and married with six children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lilibeth has a recycled-materials business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of recycled materials to sell.

Lilibeth has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Myleen

texts.en:
Myleen works hard to support her family. She is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Myleen requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Myleen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz es madre de 2 hijos a los cuales siempre ha procurado por sostenerlos con lo mejor, siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia. 

Hace un tiempo montó su venta de huevos, para lo cual tiene una cantidad de gallinas que le permiten tener algunas ventas. 
Con un crédito podrá surtir su negocio con más pollos de engorde y alimentos para sacarlos adelante y poder venderlos.

De esta manera sus ventas se incrementarán considerablemente, además de que su negocio resurgirá y podrá salir adelante. 

Además, Luz espera que con mayores ingresos sus hijos puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida y el acceso a una mejor educación. 

Luz sueña con tener un gran negocio donde pueda utilizar toda la capacidad que pueda para sacarlo adelante y así ofrecerle a su hijo un futuro económico estable.
texts.en:
Luz is the mother of two children whom she has always managed to support with the best. She has always had the strength to get ahead and continue progressing with her family. Some time ago she started a business selling eggs so she has a quantity of chickens that allow her to have some sales.

With a loan she could stock her business with more chickens to fatten and food to raise them and later sell them. In this way her sales will increase considerably and her business will rebound and she can get ahead.

Luz also hopes that with more income her children can enjoy a higher quality of living and access to better education. Luz dreams of having a large business where she can utilize all it's potential to get ahead and offer her children an economically stable life.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed for them.

loans.name: Munkhtuya

texts.en: Mrs. Munkhtuya, 41 years old, lives with her husband and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as janitor at a private firm. Her husband is a sales manager at a retail company. Their daughters both study at university. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to pay tuition fees of her daughters. Her daughters are studying hard and showing success in academics. After graduation, her daughters will secure jobs and contribute to family's well being.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her daughters.

loans.name: Munkhbat

texts.en: Mr. Munkhbat is 42 years old and lives with his wife and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running an automobile repair shop since 2002. His wife is unemployed and stays at home, taking care of domestic work. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and shingles for house renovation. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal for heating.

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Villa Bonita Group

texts.es:
El grupo Emprendedoras de Villa Bonita está en su ciclo número 12º  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 1 de ellas se encuentra por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Maria, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de las ventas varias en su mercería esta saliendo adelante y mejorando cada dia mas.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo  para la compra de remeras, short, camisas , lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The “Emprendedoras de Villa Bonita” group is in its 12th cycle in the Committee for Women program, where they all help each other get ahead.  They are participating in the elimination of poverty survey, where one of them shows up below the poverty line.

Maria, who showed as a level two in the most recent poverty survey, is getting ahead through her merchandise sales and is improving each day.

She is asking for this loan to buy t-shirts, shorts, and shirts that will help solidify her business plan.  This will help improve her income.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es:
El señor Hilario tiene 31 años , es casado, y comenta que   tiene dos  hijos por quienes, tanto el como su familia se estan esforzando.
El señor Hilario tiene una gomeria bien equipada, tiene casa propia. Comenta que se inició como empleado luego puso su propio negocio, que hasta hoy le va muy bien, con clientela ya bien formada por su antigüedad en el rubro.
Solicita el prestamo para capital de trabajo e invertir en herramientas para su taller.
texts.en:
Hilario is 31 years old, married, and says that he has two children for whom his family is striving.

Hilario has a well-equipped tire shop and a home of his own.  He says that he started as an employee and later set up his own business that has been doing well.  He has steady customers because of his experience in this field.

He is asking for this loan to buy tools for his workshop.

loans.use: to buy tools for his workshop.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban de 60 años de edad vive con su esposa y su hija, el clienta se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frijol y maicillo principalmente en su fuente de ingreso,  adicional a eso tambien tiene el molino nixtamal y una crianza de pollos de engorde ya tiene más de 20 años de experiencia, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades de su hogar, Esteban solicita un crédito para la compra de  fertilizante, insecticidas, semilla, controles de plagas, etc.  y darle a su familia un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en: Esteban is 60 years old and lives with his wife and daughter. He works growing mainly corn, beans and sorghum as his source of income. He also has a nixtamal (corn) mill and raises chickens. He has 20 years experience doing this and with what he makes he manages to pay some of the household necessities. Esteban is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, seeds, pest control, etc. He wants to provide his family with a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, seed, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos, ella vive en Tipampa en una humilde casa de adobe que es propia, la casa tiene luz y agua Elsa es agricultora y quiere un credito para comprar una vaca lechera que le sirva para aumentar su produccion de leche Elsa recibe ayuda de su pareja que es consultor independiente en instituciones agrarias pero eso no alcanza para las necesidades de la casa por eso Elsa quiere su ayuda
texts.en:
Elsa lives in a common-law relationship and has two children.  She lives in Tipampa in a modest adobe house that she owns.  The house has electricity and water.
