Elsa's a farmer and she wants a loan to buy a dairy cow to increase her milk production.  Elsa receives help from her partner, who's an independent consultant in farming institutions.  It's not enough for the household needs, though, so Elsa wants assistance.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to produce more milk

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Bebiana works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming corn, coconut and sugarcane. Bebiana is borrowing  25,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Bebiana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 50 years old, married and has five children. Two of her children are in school.

Marilou is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for two years.

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 48 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. Mercedita works very hard to provide for them.

Mercedita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mercedita has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Mercedita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 54 years old, married and has five children, one of whom is in school.

Tita is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Tita requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm. Tita has been farming rice for eight years.

In the future, Tita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is 62 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Aida has a plastic-wares retail business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of plastic-wares to sell. Aida has been in this business for 20   years. In the future, Aida would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of plastic-wares to sell.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: Rashid is a 36-year-old married man with 6 children. He operates a transport business and also sells produce in Kagadi, Uganda to earn income. Rashid desires to construct his house and stop renting. Despite being hard working and honest, he is challenged by disrespect from the community and is requesting credit to buy iron bars, bricks, cement and sand to construct his house.

loans.use: to buy iron bars, bricks, cement and sand to construct his house

loans.name: Roberto Karlo

texts.es:
Roberto de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta 3° grado, está acompañado y su pareja es comerciante en pequeño de ropa, tienen 2 hijos que vive con ellos y que aún no estudian, aparte de su familia vive con sus padres y hermanos.  

Actualmente trabaja en una hacienda de corralero y además se dedica a la agricultura siembra más que todo maíz en un terreno que está a unos 20 minutos de su hogar y se va en bicicleta,  trabajar de 6:00 am a 5:00 pm.


El crédito lo necesita para comprar pesticidas, herbicidas y abono para sembrar maíz. 

Espera que su cultivo sea bastante bueno en la cosecha para tener más ingresos, así solventar los gastos  alimenticios, pagar el crédito a tiempo, y poder sembrar siempre ya que es una fuente de ingreso del cual se beneficia.
texts.en:
Roberto is 29 years old and lives with his partner and two children, who are not in education yet. He completed third grade at school and his partner is a small-scale clothes vendor. Roberto and his family also live with his parents and his siblings. 

At the moment he works on a ranch and he also works in agriculture, mostly growing maize in a field about 20 minutes from his home. He travels there by bike and works from 6am until 5pm. 

He needs this loan to buy pesticides, herbicides and fertilizer in order to grow maize. 

He hopes that his crop this harvest will be good enough to earn him a higher income and so pay for food and living costs and allow him to repay the loan on time. Roberto also hopes that he will always be able to farm, as it is a source of income from which he has benefited greatly.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, herbicides and fertilizer in order to plant maize.

loans.name: Ayawoavi

texts.fr: Agée de 24 ans  AYAWOAVI est  marée  et  mère d’un enfant résidant  à baguida. elle a commencée son activité de  commerce en  vendant des cuire dents, des pâtes dentrifices et des brosses à dent. elle s'approvisionne  2fois  par mois au marché de Lomé et à Akodessewa  et  revend par vente ambulante dans les environs de son quartier.  AYAWOAVI  sollicite  un crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de profit.
texts.en:
Ayawoavi is 24 years old, married, and the mother of one child. She lives in Baguida. 

She started her business by selling toothpicks, toothpaste, and toothbrushes. She buys her supplies twice a month in the Lomé and Akodessewa markets. She resells her goods on foot in her neighborhood. 

Ayawoavi is asking for a loan in order to grow her business, satisfy her clients, and increase her profits.

loans.use: buy two dozen tubes of toothpaste and 3 bundles of toothpicks.

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en: Mrs. Bayarsaikhan has used her previous loan for improving her clothes sales business, which is the main family income source. Her husband gets a disability pension from the state. This time, she is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place, where less coal is burned and fewer pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to buy building materials to renovate her house in order to burn less coal for heating.

loans.name: Villa Flamenco Group

texts.es:
Villa Flamenco está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Guillermina, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, lo que quiere decir que esta en un nivel medio, luchando por ir mejorando.
Guillermina  se dedica a la venta de frutas, y solicita de este préstamo para la compra de frutas, lo que le ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben y que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
“Villa Flamenco” is in its second cycle in the program and they are completing the elimination of poverty survey.  Guillermina demonstrated a level two on the poverty scale in the last survey, meaning that she is at mid level and is striving to improve.

Guillermina sells fruit and is asking for this loan to buy fruit, which will help solidify her business plan and help her improve her income.  All of the members are grateful for the opportunity, which will be a great help.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy eggs, basic grains, snacks, bread, soft drinks, soup, etc.

loans.name: Juventud Unida Group

texts.es: El grupo “JUVENTUD UNIDA” está conformado por socias dedicadas al giro del comercio minorista y a prestar servicios. Jenny tiene 33 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de menú hace 01 año y a la vez se dedica al lavado de ropa para una pensión. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de utensilios para su negocio. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Jenny es la segunda persona parada del lado derecho viste casaquilla ploma.
texts.en: The “Juventud Unida” (United Youth) group includes members who are dedicated to retail business and to offering services. Jenny is 33 years old and is in a common-law marriage with two dependent children. She has sold food from a menu for a year, while also washing clothes for a pension. She will invest the loan in the purchase of utensils for her business. The group is thankful to the Kiva lenders for the loan offered. Jenny is the second person standing on the right side, seen in the gray jacket.

loans.use: to buy utensils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement and sand to repair the walls of his house

loans.name: Alona

texts.en: Alona is a 40-year-old, married woman and a mother of two children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than seven years now. Her husband is a fisherman.  Alona is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. With this, she will be able to improve her hog raising business, thus allowing her to grow healthy pigs, which she can sell in the market after several weeks.  Alona dreams of making her business a success in the future. Moreover, she wants to save enough money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed.

loans.name: Romela

texts.en: Romela works hard to support two children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Romela has requested a PHP 4,600 loan through NWTF to buy a Solar Lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses. Romela is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Ariunjargal

texts.en: Mr. Ariunjargal, 32 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. He has been rendering a taxi service to local people since 2006. His wife teaches English at university. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cements, and fiberglass in order to make an extension to his house. After the extension, his house will preserve more energy and lose its heat slowly after one good heating. Also his family will burn less coal for heating and then release fewer pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to make an extension to his house.

loans.name: Maria Eulalia

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que se gana la vida de una manera honrada por medio de la venta de prendas variadas y de muy buena calidad, y comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en la compra de prendas variadas, y de esa forma fue luchando y mejorando sus ventas.
Ella pide de nuevo este prestamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de vaqueros,remeras y bermudas lo que le ayudará a seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking and enterprising woman who earns an honest living by selling good quality clothing.  She says that she used her earlier loan to buy a variety of clothing.  In this way she strived to improve her sales.

She is asking for a new loan to buy jeans, t-shirts, and Bermuda shorts so she can continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana es soltera pero tiene un hijo ella y su retoño viven en Ticuyo en una casa de adobe que le pertenece a sus familiares Juana es agricultora y vende leche  y quiere un credito para compra de ganado vacuno para incrementar su produccion de leche Juana es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero goza de buena salud y necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Juana is single, but has a son. She and her little one live in Ticuyo in a house made of adobe that belongs to her family members. Juana is a farmer and sells milk. She wants a loan in order to buy cattle to increase the production of milk. Juana is the only source of income in her household, but she enjoys good health and needs your help.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily, a 33-year-old, mother of two settled for a living in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She earns a living from selling grocery goods in their village, and has been doing this for over nine years. She has repaid successfully her previous loan from Gata Daku MPC, which she used for buying goods to sell. 

Improving her business became easier with her access to GDMPC micro credit. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods for her retail store.  In the future, she wants to build a house and to provide better education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods for her retail store.

loans.name: Bibikhojar

texts.ru: 38-летняя Бибихочар является профессиональным пекарем таджикских лепешек. На протяжении 6 лет она работает в пекарне и занимается выпечкой и продажей лепешек. Ей помогает старший сын. Бибихочар многодетная мать. У нее шестеро детей. Сыновьям по 17 и 15 лет, а дочерям 13, 10, 6 лет и самой младшей 4 месяца. Муж Бибихочар работает вдали от семьи, а старшие дети учатся. Бибихочар любит свою большую семью и свой малый бизнес. Она сейчас нуждается в кредите для покупки запаса муки и для ремонта своей пекарни. Бибихочар хочет расширить свою деятельность и за счет прибыли накопить сбережение для поступления своего старшего сына в ВУЗ. Ее сын в этом году окончит школу и Бибихочар очень надеется, что она за счет своей деятельности накопит деньги для оплаты годового контракта за учебу в ВУЗе.
texts.en: 38-year-old Bibikhojar is a professional baker who makes Tajik lepeshki. She works in a bakery and has been making and selling lepeshki for over six years. Her eldest son helps her with the business. Bibikhojar is the mother of many children. She has two sons, ages 15 and 17, and four daughters, ages 6, 10, and 13, while the youngest is just four months old. Her husband works far away from home and the older children are in school. Bibikhojar loves her big family and her small business. Right now she needs a loan to buy flour and to renovate her bakery. She wants to expand her business and use the profits to save money for her eldest son to go to university. He will finish school this year and she hopes to save money to pay for his tuition.

loans.use: to buy flour and renovate her bakery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for marketing for his business and for working capital.

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Rory está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité es un grupo que se unió para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio del trabajo en equipo.
La Sra. Maria es la presidenta de este grupo, una mujer muy trabajadora que tiene una despensa bien surtida en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día, y con lo cual ayuda a su familia por medio de sus ingresos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, bebidas, frutas, y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo, luchando por mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
This group, called Kuña Rory, is in its first cycle of the program.  The members formed the group in order to help each other as a team.

Maria serves as the group’s president.  She is a very hardworking woman with a well-stocked grocery store, where she begins working from early morning.  She helps her family with her income.

She is asking for this loan to buy vegetables, beverages, and other things so she can continue working toward improving her life.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, and beverages.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel hoy tiene 44 años, trabaja arduamente en su profesión de taxista, por medio de su trabajo esta saliendo adelante y lucha cada día por ir mejorando mas y mas en todo lo que hace. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en la compra de una batería para su taxi que le ayudo bastante para ir mejorando.
Miguel pide este préstamo nuevamente para la reparación y mantenimiento de vehículo, que le será de mucha ayuda para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en: Miguel is 44 years old and works arduously in his field as a taxi driver.  He is getting ahead through his work and is improving each day in all he does.  He says that he used his previous loan to buy a battery for his taxi and this helped greatly.  Miguel is asking for a new loan to do maintenance on his vehicle, which will be helpful in allowing him to continue working.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood, varnish, glue, sandpaper, tools, etc.

loans.name: Emida Alicia

texts.es: Emida de 42 años de edad vive con sus hijas, ella posee un negocio de venta de tortillas en su casa de  habitación y tiene ya 20 años de experiencia, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades de su hogar, Emida solicita un crédito para la compra de maíz,  cal y además insumos del negocio y mejorar sus ingresos económicamente para ayudarle a su familia en todas las necesidades que se le presenten.
texts.en: Emida, 42 years old, lives with her daughters. She has a business selling tortillas in the house where she lives. She has 20 years of experience. With what she earns from her sales she is able to cover the necessities of her household. Emida is asking for a loan to buy corn and lime, as well as business supplies, and improve her income in order to help her family with all the needs they have.

loans.use: to buy corn and lime as well as business supplies

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener  23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, vive con su hijo en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo, ya tiene más de dos años de experiencia vendiendo los productos como: lociones, jabones, shampoo, etc.  el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de domicilio, con lo que vende logar solventar las necesidades de su hogar, la joven solicita un crédito para la compra de mas de productos por mayor para aumentar la ganancia que le genera su producción,  y darle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young woman's face has been pixelated because she's 23 years old and lives in a high-risk area.

She lives with her child in her own house and has earned a living for more than two years making catalogue sales of lotion, soap, shampoo, and other products.  The business is located in her house.  She manages to pay for her household needs with what she sells.

The young woman's requesting a loan to buy more products wholesale to increase her profits from her sales and give her child a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy lotion, soap, shampoo, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Diego

texts.en:
Diego cultivates his half-hectare vegetable farm, and one point five (1.5) hectares of corn farmland. He particularly plants and harvests eggplant and green bell peppers. He is 33 years old, married, and blessed with four children. Three of his children attend school, while his youngest child is still an infant.

Diego sells his own harvested vegetables to his local community. He and his wife aim to have a better way of living, to educate their children, and to improve their vegetable and corn farming business. To make his goal realized, he is seeking a loan of PHP 5,000 to be use to buy fertilizer and vegetable seeds for his vegetable farm. He hopes to obtain this amount of loan, in order to sustain his vegetable farm with complete nutrition, which will enable him to harvest plentiful vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and vegetable seeds for his vegetable farm.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 34-year-old married woman who adds additional income to support their family's welfare and who is blessed with four children. She has been operating a motorcycle transport business and a grocery stall as a secondary business for a period of five years, earning an income of 20,000 KES at the end of every month.

She is now servicing her second loan of 30,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya, and intends to use this amount to buy cabbages, fish, tomatoes, green vegetables, fresh fruits and potatoes to sell to her customers on a daily basis.
 
Caroline plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, fish, tomatoes, green vegetables, fresh fruits and potatoes.

loans.name: Sithan

texts.en:
Sithan, pictured in the photo, aged 36, has been driving Tuk Tuk taxis since 2004.  In the past, they were commonly known as "tuk tuks" (a three-wheeled motorcycle taxi), but they are now officially called "moto kangbei" by government authorities.

Sithan's wife’s business is in pig farming. She plans to expand her pig farming by buying ten more piglets and pig feed.  Hence Sithan decided to apply for a loan in order to help provide capital for his wife's business.
 
Sithan’s family lives in a village on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometres from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to buy ten more piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Demeurant  à  Lomé dans le quartier Adidogomé,  Lydia  est  âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée  et  mère  de 4 enfants.Lydia  vend les  tomates, des piments, aubergines et les condiments. Elle   s’approvisionne  2 fois par  mois  à  Kati et  revend  devant  sa maison  . Lydia sollicite un prêt pour agrandir  son commerce et faire plus bénéfice.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, peppers, and eggplants for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta is 34 years old,married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with four children. She runs a retail shop and has been in the business for four years now. Her spouse also provides additional income to support the family.

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of rice,sugar and maize flour. She will use the anticipated profits to improve the living standards of her family.

This is her second loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in future she hopes to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy more stock of rice,sugar and maize flour.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty,  la cual es una zona que queda a grande distancia de la zona céntrica de la capital.
La Sra. Jovina es una de las integrantes, ella tiene su pequeño negocio de crías y ventas de animales, donde por medio de su esfuerzo esta ayudando a su familia.  Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de las capacitaciones ira mejorando.
Solicita de este prestamo para la compra de animales y otros. Y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The group, called Kuña Guapa, is in its first cycle of the Committee for Women program in the city of Curuguaty, which is an area far from the capital.

Jovina is one of the members and has her small business where she raises and sells animals.  She helps her family through her efforts and wants to improve through training as time passes.

She is asking for this loan to buy animals and other things so she can continue growing in her business and be able to provide her family with what they need to have a life without deprivation.

loans.use: to buy animals.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.fr:
-  
Lydia âgée de  66ans célibataire ,mère de 3 enfants  résident à Adidogomé. Elle  vend  des  bassines et des sceaux en plastique. Elle s'approvisionne 2 fois par mois au   grand marché de lomé et revend au   marché assiyéyé. Lydia sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de faire plus de profit
texts.en: Lydia is 66 years old and lives in the Adidogomé neighborhood in Lome, Togo. She is single and the mother of three children. She sells buckets and other plastic goods. She buys her supplies twice a month in the Grand Market of Lomé. She resells her goods in the Assiyéyé market. Lydia is asking for a loan in order to grow her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy buckets and plastic goods.

loans.name: Adonia

texts.en:
Adonia aged 45 years is a well known business man. He has been running a retail shop since August 2007. He is also a farmer, mainly banana farming. He is married with five children aged 21, 19, 18, 16 and 14 respectively and all are in school. He has managed to sustain his family of five children and his wife who is a midwife and also contributes to the family income. 

He has applied for a loan of 5,000,000 UGX to buy more stock of corn flour, rice, sugar and beverages among other items for sale in the retail shop. He also will get some mulch for his banana plantation at Bwegiragye to increase his harvests of Matooke for his family and to sustain his daily activities. He is an honest man at work, in his business and works for 10 hours a day. His clients are people around the Bushenyi district. 

He is faced with the challenge of limited capital to buy a wide range of items for sale in his business but will defeat this challenge after getting a loan and boosting his business. He hopes to complete construction of his house and modernize his agriculture.

loans.use: to buy retail stock for his store and mulch.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 34-year-old single female living in Masindi, Uganda. She runs a retail shop that sells general merchandise like soap, biscuits, sugar and rice. Margret will use the loan to buy general merchandise like soap, biscuits, sugar and rice.

Due to high demand of her family, she decided to start up rentals to add on her income. She hopes to educate her children although she has a difficulty of inadequate capital to support her business.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like soap, biscuits, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.en:
-  
Demeurant  à  Lomé dans le quartier Tokoin,  yawa  est  âgée de 32 ans. Elle est Célibataire  et  mère  de 2 enfants. yawa vend  des Pagnes et  s’approvisionne  2 Fois par  mois  au  Grand marché de lomé  et  revend a un  emplacement  de son atelier  . yawa sollicite un prêt pour agrandir  son  commerce et  faire plus  bénéfice

loans.use: to buy traditional pagnes and Dutch fabrics.

loans.name: Nandin-Erdene

texts.en:
Mr. Nandin-Erdene, 36 years old, lives with his wife, son and mother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as car driver at a private firm since 2010. His wife is a cook and works at a cafeteria. His mother has retired from work, and gets a state pension. 

He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam for a house renovation. 

After the renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Erdenebulgan

texts.en:
Mr. Erdenebulgan, 43 years old, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been renting out his house rooms since 2008. Last year, he used his previous loan for house insulation. 

This time, he is requesting a loan of 3,600,000 MNT to buy bricks, cements and fiberglass for a house renovation. After the renovation, his clients will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating, and then less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to make his clients satisfied

loans.name: Los Progresistas De Cupiche Group

texts.es: El grupo “LOS PROGRESISTAS DE CUPICHE” está conformado por socios dedicados al comercio minorista y a prestar servicios. Maribel tienen 36 años de edad es casada con 03 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de pollo broaster y gaseosas en las afueras de su vivienda. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas mercaderías pollo aceite papas y bebidas El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA  por el préstamo brindado a los inversionistas KIVA. Maribel es la primera persona sentada del lado derecho.
texts.en: The "Los Progresistas de Cupiche" group is made up of members who work in retail business and services. Maribel is 36 years old and is married with 3 dependent children. She sells rotisserie chicken and soft drinks in the area surrounding her home. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise, chicken, oil, potatoes, and drinks. The group thanks the KIVA lenders for the loan provided. Maribel is the first person seated on the right side.

loans.use: to buy more chicken, oil, potatoes, and drinks

loans.name: Liêu

texts.en:
Liêu, a 48-year-old married mother of three, lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province where she has been farming for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns Liêu is not having a hygienic latrine. She is therefore requesting her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

From her farming, Liêu hopes to make enough money to provide for her children and to buy a bicycle.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Kasenyi United New-Monika Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kabira, a widow, is an old client with the Kasenyi United New-Monika group. She does fish trading as her main source of income, and her clients are all categories of people around the landing site. She does fish trading from her local area of residence in Kasenyi, Lake Katwe, Kasese District. She also has a retail shop where she earns income to support her and her grandchildren. 

She has requested a loan of UGX 4,000,000 for her fish business. She started her businesses in the year 1998 to have a steady source of income to look after her family. She is a hardworking woman, giving her businesses eight hours a day and six days a week. This has enabled her to grow the business from one level to another. She is, however, faced with the challenges of poor weather in the dry season, since fish trading does well in the rainy season, and also debtors, but she has learned to manage them. 

She hopes to be financially stable in the future. She thanks UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd. (MDI) for the financial support they are rendering to them as a group. They are committed to keep performing well to maintain the partnership.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and boats.

loans.name: Mashhura

texts.ru: Машхуре 32 года  она замужем и у нее 2 детей. Дети подросли и учатся в средней школе. У Машхуры среднее образование.  У нее свой бизнес благодаря которому  она поддерживает  финансовое состояние своей семьи. Она очень любит своих детей и хочет  дать им хорошее образование в будущем. Для этого ей необходимо расширять бизнес и получать немного больший доход. Муж Машхуры находится на заработках и по мере возможности старается , чтобы его семья не бедствовала. Машхура  уже пользовалась услугами «Арванд»  и является клиентом с хорошей кредитной историей. Получив кредит и купив хозяйственные товары она надеется  получить возможность достичь желаемых результатов в будущем.
texts.en:
Mashhura is 32 years old. She is married and has two children. Her children have grown and go to high school. Mashhura has secondary education. She has her own business, thanks to which she can support the financial situation of the family. 

Mashhura loves her children very much and wants to give them a good education in the future. For this she needs to expand her business and get a somewhat larger income. Mashhura's husband is a migrant worker and he strives as much as he can in order for his family to not be poor. 

Mashhura already used Arvand's services and is a client with a good credit history. After having received the loan and having purchased household goods, she hopes to be able to achieve her desired results in the future.

loans.use: to purchase household goods to sell

loans.name: Majorle

texts.en:
Majorle is a 43-year-old married woman, and a mother of two children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than three years now. Fishing has provided them the income that they need.

Majorle is asking for a loan to buy materials for fishing like nets, lead weights, hooks and other things. 

With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Majorle dreams of expanding their fishing venture.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing like nets, lead weights, hooks and other things

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth, 42, lives in Katete, Zambia. He is asking for a loan so that he can obtain a water pump to help him irrigate and expand his garden crops.

Kenneth has been growing tomato, onion, cabbage and fresh greens on his farm to supply local markets in Katete. Using buckets, he has been drawing water from a nearby stream to irrigate his crops. This is an extremely labour intensive task, especially now that the dry season has begun.

Rent to Own has worked with Kenneth and will deliver a water pump directly to his farm. Rent to Own also provides Kenneth with training on how to properly use and maintain the water pump, and will check in to provide support until he has paid off the loan.

With the water pump, Kenneth is planning on growing potatoes throughout the dry season, supplying the busy markets in Zambia’s Eastern province.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than five years now. This is the source of their income.

Maribel is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other supplies. With this, she and her husband will be able to improve their catch, thus allowing them to sell more fish in the market.

Maribel wants to expand their fishing ventures so that it will generate more revenue necessary for their needs, especially for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other supplies.

loans.name: Altansukh

texts.en:
Mr. Altansukh, 48 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running a grocery store since 2008. Before this business, he worked at construction sites, but due to a fire accident, he was injured. 

He quit his job and began running the grocery store. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy foodstuffs in large amounts in order to run his business without worrying about inventory shortage.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs in large amounts.

loans.name: Hạnh

texts.en:
Mrs. Hạnh operates a food stall/restaurant selling rice noodles. She has been involved in this business for six years.

Hạnh is 29 years old and she is married, with one child. She lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hạnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Hạnh faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Hạnh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Ashuron

texts.ru: Ашурчон 64 года она пожилая женщина , которая одна вырастила сына. У нее  неполное среднее образование. Она пенсионерка но пенсия у Ашурчон небольшая и не хватает на жизнь.   Сыну уже 32 года и он на заработках в России.  Ашурчон не сидит сложа руки и не собирается  висеть на шее у сына она занимается тем , что продает  на рынке мелкие товары первой необходимости и хоз.товары. Ашурчон хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить в будущем  дополнительный доход.  Она уже получала поддержку  в МДО  «Арванд» и у нее хорошая кредитная история.  Так как Ашурчон довольна тем как обслуживают  в Арванде  она обратилась и в этот раз за помощью.  Ашурчон заранее благодарна  «Арванд» в оказании помощи.
texts.en:
Ashuron is 64 years old and an elderly woman, who has raised her son alone. She didn't finish high school. She is a pensioner, however, Ashuron's pension is small and is not enough for living. Her son is already 32 years old and he is a migrant worker in Russia. Ashuron does not sit idly by and does not intend to burden her son. She is engaged in selling small essentials and household goods at the market. 

Ashuron would like to expand her business and get an additional income in the future. She already received support from MDO Arvand, and she has a good credit history. As Ashuron was happy with the services from Arvand, she also turned here for help this time as well. Ashuron thanks Arvand in advance for the assistance.

loans.use: to purchase household goods to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 31 years old and single. She lives with her parents in a rural community. Due to insufficient income, she would like to re-start her small retail store. She aims to acquire more stocks of grocery items to resell but she has insufficient capital. 

For this reason, she would  like to access additional capital from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5,000 to buy candies, junk foods, beverages, seasonings, canned goods, noodles, laundry soaps and soft drinks to resell. She is hoping that this financial assistance will enable her to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy candies, junk foods, beverages, seasonings, canned goods, noodles, laundry soaps and soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie lives with her family in Militar in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. For over nine years of operating her retail store, Elsie was able to support the needs of her family, especially to her children. 

She had repaid her previous loan successfully. Her previous loan was used for buying items for her store. She works in the store with determination in order to have a better source of income for the family. To increase her sales, she took a new loan recently to buy additional grocery goods for her retail store.

She has started saving a portion of her revenue for the future needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods for her retail store.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is a married woman and a mother of six children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has been engaged in a fishing business for more than five years now. She works hard to earn a living so that she will be able to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family.

She is asking for a loan to buy materials for fishing, like nets, hooks and lead weights. Through this loan, Riza will have the chance to improve her business. She also wants to save money so that she can support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing, like nets, hooks and lead weights.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 46 years old, married and blessed with four school-going children. She sells small and big fish and earns an income of 35,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) in a month. 

She has applied for this second loan of 45,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan to buy more stock of fresh fish for sale.                                                                         

Caroline will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children and also provide for the family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fresh fish for sale.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia settled with her family in San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She started her business by selling  food in their village and later she has been selling used clothing, and she earns good income from this activity.

She used her previous loan from Gata Daku MPC for buying additional used clothing and the loan was successfully repaid. Business is her way of living and she wants some improvement for this. She took a new loan recently to purchase more used clothes to sell in her retail store. 

She wants to expand her business, and hopefully improve the general living situation of the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to sell in her retail store.

loans.name: Zubaydullo

texts.ru: Зубайдулло – мужчина 30 лет ,женат . Живёт в сельской местности и с детства работает на поле, выращивает урожай, ухаживает за домашним скотом. В настоящее время имеет  12 гектаров земли  ,где содержит  7 голов крупного рогатого скота. Также на своем участке земли выращивает овощи : помидоры, огурцы, картошку,  которую продаёт на рынке .  Овощи ,выращенные с заботой и любовью , хорошо скупаются .Зубайдулло хочет приобрести корм для скота ,но на данный момент не имеет нужной суммы .Поэтому Зубайдулло обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой . Зубайдулло рад,что существуют такие организации как МДО Арванд ,которые делают жизнь людей со средним и низким уровнем жизни проще.
texts.en:
Zubaydullo is a man of 30 years. He is married. He lives in a village, and has worked in the field since his childhood, growing crops and caring for the livestock. Currently he has 12 hectares of land, where he keeps 7 heads of cattle. He also grows vegetables on his plot of land: Tomatoes, cucumbers and potatoes, which he sells at the market. The vegetables, grown with care and love, sell well. 

Zubaydullo wants to purchase fodder for the cattle, but currently he does not have the required amount. Therefore he turned to MDO Arvand for financial support. Zubaydullo is happy that there are organizations such as MDO Arvand exists, which help make the life of poor and middle class people easier.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline, 30 years old, is married with three children between two and four years old. One of them goes to school. She has been selling food to restaurants for one year. With the loan, she would like to buy more food to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more food to sell

loans.name: Det

texts.en:
Det, 54, lives with his wife in a small village of Kampong Cham province. Det and his wife are farmers with a small rice farm near their house. This couple has two dependent children who are farmers also. They have been involved in this career since 1980 with an average income is USD 5.00 a day.

After taking veterinary training courses, Det is now knowledgeable about being a veterinarian. He is able to treat some normal diseases that happen with cattle. For this reason, he wants to buy some animal drugs to cure his cattle. He also wants to sell this animal treatment service to people in his community in case they need it. 

With the support from this loan, he hopes that he can keep his cattle healthy and earn more money from selling his animal treatment service. He also thanks all the lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to buy some animal medicines.

loans.name: Jose Erick

texts.es: José de 29 años de edad es padre soltero de 2 niñas de 5 y 10 años de edad, habita en vivienda propia desde hace 14 años. Él es un hombre admirable ya que después de la muerte de su esposa ha logrado sacar adelante a sus 2 hijas apoyado en su trabajo como asistente administrativo de una empresa cercana a su localidad. José siempre busca la manera de darle lo mejor a sus hijas y es por ello que desea construir una pared para formar un cuarto para darles mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijas, y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir una pared para terminar de construir un cuarto en su vivienda.
texts.en:
José, age 29, is the single father of two little girls, ages 5 and 10 years old. He has lived in his own home for 14 years. He's an admirable man who, after his wife's death, managed to get his two daughters ahead, supported by his work as an administrative assistant for a nearby business.

José is always looking for ways to give his daughters the best, which is why he wants to build a wall. The room he's making will provide better living conditions for his girls. The loan he is requesting from FUSAI will be used to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron bars for building a wall that will finish a room in his home.

loans.use: buy building supplies to build a wall to finish a room of his home

loans.name: Hay

texts.en:
From Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Hay, 49, is an experienced and active farmer. At home, she is a lovely mother of two dependent children and one married child. She is the owner of a small rice field. By operating her farming business, she can earn around USD 2.50 a day to support her family's daily expenses. So far, she has been involved in this career for fourteen years.

To keep her rice growing well and more fruitfully, Hay is going to use natural fertilizers on her farmland. Because there is a shortage of money, she would like to get a KIVA loan via HKL to buy fertilizers to use in her farming process this season. With the support from this loan, she hopes that the fertilizers will make her rice grow better and produce more crops for her. She also thanks all the lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy dagaa to make chicken feed and resell medicine

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
In the year 2004, Julieta started her banana plantation in Baliangao. She has sought financial assistance from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for her needed capitalization. To this day, Julieta feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for this business. 

Recently, she availed herself of a loan to pay for labor costs. She has a new land area she wishes to cultivate and she is confident this would help her increase her income. She hopes to sustain her business and be able to supply bananas in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Lary

texts.en: Lary signed up her membership with  Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative in 2007. She has sought financial assistance for her farming activities. She was able to manage her business well and was able to purchase another farm area to cultivate. Recently, she availed herself of a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparation for the next cropping season. She wishes to sustain her business and be able to put up a market stall in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel, 31 years old, lives in Mobod, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental with her husband and three children. Her husband is a fisherman. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through snack and food vending. It began with selling a small amount of viands and snacks to their neighbors. She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her Suman Malagkit (steamed sticky rice roll) business. She became a MIGS member, which is why she has received loans several times already. Now, she is applying for 7,000 PHP to buy ingredients for her steamed sweet sticky rice rolls. She hopes that her business will continue and someday she will have a food house.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her steamed sweet sticky rice rolls

loans.name: Erenciana

texts.en: Erenciana has high hopes for her family. She takes care of her business in Baliangao, where she busies herself with her farming activities.  She availed herself of a loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation. Erenciana  perseveres and always believes in reaching her goals to continuously provide for her family, especially the education of her children.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: In the year 2005, Carmelita learned about Paglaum MPC and availed herself of a loan for her banana plantation. She is happy to see the good turn out of her business and wanted to increase her capitalization for added sales. Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Carmelita wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply corn to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan is a hardworking married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He rears bees and at the same time grows tomatoes, cassava and onions. He faces challenges of price fluctuation. Besides that he hopes to start to harvest venom from bees. Jonathan needs a loan to buy beehives.

loans.use: to buy beehives

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard lives in Magunga, in Homa Bay county in south-western Kenya, close to Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Benard is married and has three children. He runs a small business of grain-bulking and reselling. He also does farming with his wife. They have been farming for five years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, bananas, sugarcane, sunflowers, and gravellia. Benard is excited about beekeeping since it will earn him some income from the sale of honey and provide him with honey for food and medicine.

This is Benard’s first loan with Honey Care Africa and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to expand his business and buy more beehives. Benard’s hope for the future is to become a model beekeeper.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Frederic

texts.en: Frederic is 30 years old. He is married and has one child, who does not yet go to school. Frederic has been selling clothes for seven years. With the loan, he would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Abdumajid

texts.ru: Абдумаджид добрый  мужчина он очень любит свою семью. Он работает директором ветеринарной станции. Его дети  уже выросли и учатся в ВУЗах. ОН мечтает, что бы его дети, как он сам были врачами. Но только старшая его дочь пошла по стопам Абдумаджида и окончила медицинский университет и хочет продолжить обучение в ординатуре. Но  она еще ни где ни работает и оплатить за обучение она сама не сможет. Абдумаджид  хочет помочь своей дочери осуществить свою мечту. Потому он считает что его долг обеспечить  счастливое и здоровое будущее его детей и будущих внуков. По словам Абдумаджида в каждой семье должен быть врач, поэтому он также стал врачом, хоть и ветеринар, но также он многое понимает в болезни людей также. У Абдумаджида очень умная дочь которую он любит и помогает ей во всем. Абдумаджид и его дочь очень рады что могут осуществить свою мечту при помощи поддержки Арванд.
texts.en: Abdumajid is a kind man, who loves him family very much. He works as a director of a veterinarian clinic. His children are already grown and attend universities. He dreams for his children to become doctors like he is, but only his oldest daughter followed in his footsteps and graduated from a medical university and wants to continue her education with residency. However, she does not work anywhere yet and cannot pay for the education herself. Abdumajid wants to help his daughter to realize her dream because he thinks that it is his duty to provide a happy and healthy future for his children and future grandchildren. According to Abdumajid, every family should have a doctor, and this is why he became one. And even though he is a veterinarian, he understand a lot about people's illnesses as well. Abdumajid's daughter is very smart, and he loves her and helps her with everything. Abdumajid and his daughter are very happy to realize their dream with the help and support of Arvand.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's education

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac lives in Kitale, in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. 

The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Isaac is a widower with eight children. He is a farmer. He has been farming for forty-eight years now and he is currently growing maize, potatoes, vegetables, bananas and tea. Isaac is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollinating his crops. 

This is Isaac’s first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to educate his children. Isaac’s hope for the future is to see his children through life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: This is Patrick. He is a farmer and a father of 5 children. He carries out a dairy farming in Kericho county, Kenya. He has 18 years experience keeping dairy cows. An extra dairy cow producing 20 liters of milk will boost his milk production to help him save enough money and repay his loan at ease. He is happy that income from milk has enabled him pay school fees for his children and maintain their health. A loan from Kiva will enable Patrick improve his family's livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase one dairy cow to add to his current herd

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip lives in Kitale, in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Trans-Nzoia is one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest, solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Philip is married and has four children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for four years, and currently they are growing maize, beans and cassava, and they also keep livestock. Philip is excited about beekeeping, as the bees will help to pollinate his crops.

This is Philip’s first loan with Honey Care. He plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to provide for his family’s needs. Philip’s hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials, and begin honey production.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.en:
Le groupe DANAYA est constitué de  6 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier  DOUGOUNINA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 4ème prêt. Les 3 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de poissons  et de la restauration à l’image de BA DIALLO qui est la 2ème femme debout dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 100kg de riz, 30kg de poissons et 50kg de poissons avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes de plats alimentaires au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies for her catering business

loans.name: Delva Gergina

texts.es:
La señora Delva de 59  años de edad, vive con sus hijas  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 6  años al negocio de venta de ropa usada, vende piezas de ropa como juegos de camera, cortinas, toallas, pantalones, camisas, chores, ropa de niños y etc. vive en la cuidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras.
Doña Delva es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de blusas, vestidos, faldas, pantalones, camisas, etc. con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente con deseos de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y bien surtido y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Hondura - Septiembre de 2014.
texts.en:
Delva, age 59, lives with her daughters in her own home. For the last six years, she has been in the business of selling used clothing. She sells items like bed linen sets, curtains, towels, pants, shirts, shorts, children's clothing, and more. She lives in the city of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras.

Delva is an enterprising woman with a drive to get ahead. She fights every day to improve her quality of life, and she is requesting this loan to buy clothing like blouses, dresses, skirts, pants, shirts, and more. With help from this loan, she will strive to improve her income and also her quality of life. She wants to keep working with Prisma.  Her goal is to have a well run and well stocked business while at the same time improving her and her family's future.

loans.use: buy more clothing for resale

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de 55 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida, el cliente es comerciante de ganado bovino y tiene venta de cerdos, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades de su hogar, Manuel quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo unos cuartos donde muestra la fotografía, pero con o que gana no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón  solicita un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, arena, ladrillos, laminas, puertas, pago de mano de obra, etc. para que el y su familia puedan vivir comodos y seguros.
texts.en: Manuel, age 55, lives with his long-time partner. He sells dairy cows and pigs, and with what he earns, he manages to make ends meet for his household. Manuel wants to improve his home by building some rooms in the area shown in the photograph, but what he earns won't stretch to make it happen. He is requesting this loan so that he can buy construction materials like cement, iron, sand, bricks, sheets of metal, and doors, and pay for manual labor. This will ensure that he and his family can live comfortably and safely.

loans.use: pay for materials and labor to build a new room of his house.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Evacueta finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities, which includes planting vegetables and bananas. Not only is she fond of doing it, she earns an income as well. At her age of 62 and married, she fully occupies herself in order to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full fledged member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative with giving her capital to support her gardening activities. 

Recently, she applied for a loan of Php 3,000 to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. In the future, Saturnina wishes to become the supplier of vegetables and bananas in the public market and neighboring towns as well.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia, 44 years old, is married and a resident of Southern Looc, Plaridel, Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman. The fish he catches are sold to the public market or to their neighbors. Julia and her husband have been in this business for many years already. Since Julia wants to be more productive, she has now decided to enter into business herself by purchasing fish in bulk for resale at the market. In July 2012, both Julia and her husband agreed to join Paglaum MPC to request a loan to buy fishing nets. But aside from financial assistance they received, they say that they also enjoyed the add-on benefits such as insurance and savings.  

Julia is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy fish to sell. She hopes that with Paglaum’s help, along with her husband’s patience and diligence, she will be a successful vendor and someday will own a stall in the public market.

loans.use: to buy fish to resell

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 42 years old and married. She is from Lao Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Together with her husband, Nida works vending fish. This is the main source of income for their family. Nida applied for membership with PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the Coop. 

Nida is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy more stock of fish to sell. She hopes that her loan will expand her resources and increase her income to sufficiently provide for the needs of their family. Nida plans to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Wise Women Group

texts.en:
Susan is the chairlady of Wise Women group, based in Waterfalls, Harare. Susan is a pastor’s wife who helps her husband with his Ministry. She gives her time to church commitments and she helps her husband in conselling sessions in their church.

She is in the poultry business. Susan started rearing chickens in batches of 50 each 6 weeks. There were times that she was challenged for getting chicken feed but she persevered in the business until she increased her batches to 100 chickens at a time. 

Susan plans to grow her chicken business with her loan that has been granted to her by Thrive Microfinance. She has hopes and aspirations of rearing batches of 1000 chickens, and she hopes to get a bigger loan amount on her next loan application from Thrive so that she grows her business. She has also gotten lucrative contracts with food outlets to sell her chickens.

loans.use: to expand her chicken-rearing business.

loans.name: Esterlina

texts.en:
From Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Esterlina earns a living through her retailing business. She sees to it that she has enough inventory to continuously provide for her family. For her capital needs, PMPC has stood by her since the start of her business. 

She is happy that she is able to survive the odds of business with determination and with her family as her inspiration. To earn more, she applied for a loan to purchase more inventory of clothing, cosmetics and lingerie to sell. Melanie hopes to live comfortably with her children as they finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more inventories of clothing, cosmetics and lingerie to sell

loans.name: Yanira Elizabeth

texts.es: Yanira de 40 años de edad es una mujer admirable por su actitud positiva hacia la vida, ya que actualmente habita con sus 2 hijos de 12 y 14 años de edad y su compañero de vida. Ella siempre busca las condiciones para apoyar a su compañero de vida en los gastos económicos del hogar por medio de su pequeño negocio de elaboración y venta de productos como: bufandas, gorros, portacelular, manteles, monedero, etc. los cuales distribuye por docena y por unidad en los mercados cercanos.  Yanira desea construir una galera en su vivienda, además el techo de su vivienda se encuentra a medio construir por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo de piso, cemento, arena, grava, lamina galvanizada, polines y pines para terminar de construir el techo y construir una galera en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Yanira, age 40, is a woman to be admired for her positive attitude toward life. She currently lives with her two children, ages 12 and 14 years, and her partner. She is always looking for ways to support her partner with the household expenses. She runs a small business making and selling products such as scarves, caps, cell phone holders, blankets, wallets, and more. She then sells these individually and by the dozen at nearby markets.

Yanira wants to build a hen house in her home, and additionally, the roof of her home is only half built. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in a bricked floor, cement, sand, gravel, sheets of metal, support beams, and pins to finish building her roof and build the hen house.

loans.use: finish the roof of her home and add a hen house

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 43 years old. He is a widow with four kids, two of whom are infants. Edgar lives in Divisoria, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He works selling fruit and has rented a space in the public market to display his fruits. Edgar earns a promising income to support his family. He has signed up to become a member of PMPC and has received several previous loans without records of default. 

Edgar is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase more kilos of fruit to sell. Edgar hopes to sustain his business and he dreams of sending all of his children to school.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Kilachi

texts.en:
Hello lender, meet Kilachi. Kilachi is a 38 year-old dairy farmer from the outskirts of Litein, Kenya. The father of 4 has been doing farming for 8 good years. On his 3 acre land, he grows tea, potatoes and vegetables. He also keeps poultry and dairy cattle for selling eggs and milk. 

Kilachi is seeking a KES 65,000 loan to purchase a high-yield dairy cow. His passion is deep rooted in dairy farming. Milking is what he finds to be the most enjoyable about it. He has nick-named his cow Lelkina after a female person. 

Your loan will help Kilachi to significantly improve his livelihood. The additional cow will increase the amount of milk sold at the market. With more milk output, Kilachi can also look into value addition to grow his profit margins. 

The money he makes off this investment will go towards his children’s education. When asked how this loan will be of benefit to his family, he replied, “It will increase the income of the family.”

loans.use: to  purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Eden Gladys

texts.en:
Eden Gladys is 27 years old. She is a hardworking mother who is a businesswoman. She is engaged in a retail business selling rice.

Eden Gladys is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan from Paglaum MPC to purchase bulk rice to sell. She will use her loan to increase her inventory, sell more rice, and earn more money. Eden Gladys’s loan will allow her provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase bulk rice to sell

loans.name: Kabarachonjo Group

texts.en:
This is a group of women who mainly operate small businesses such as selling clothes and food in a small hotel. They live in Huruma, a slum in Nairobi, Kenya.

They all use charcoal for cooking. With traditional cook stoves, there is a lot of indoor air pollution which leads to respiratory diseases and also there is a lot of charcoal consumption by traditional stoves. Currently, on average, each member spends USD 1.3 on charcoal everyday. 

The loan will enable them purchase high efficient cook stoves JIKOKOA that will save them up to 50% of their daily consumption on charcoal. These cook stoves also reduce smoke and carbon emissions from the charcoal thus creating a better and cleaner environment for their families.

The families will be able to save USD 0.65 daily from the reduced consumption on charcoal. This translates to USD 234 every year for at least 5 years, the lifetime of the cook stove. This money will be saved and used for other needs like paying for their children's school fees, paying rent and making their lives better.

loans.use: to pay for a high energy efficient cook stove

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is 34 years. She is married with one child, who is 3 years old and does not yet go to school. She has a shop and has been selling from her business for the past 3 years. 

With the loan requested, she would like to buy more soap, sugar, biscuits and millet for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar, biscuits and millet for sale.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru:
Рустам является мастером-отделочником в своем районе Шахритус. Его работа сезонная и по наступлению холодов он остается без заказов и без источника дохода. В связи с этим Рустам решил начать новый бизнес в сфере торговли. Он планирует заняться купле-продажей миндаля и сухофруктов. Он будет закупать товар у жителей сел по дешевой цене и затем продавать на местном рынке по прибыльной цене. 
Рустам женат. Ему 39 лет. Его жена и старший сын сейчас находятся в России на заработках. Рустам имеет начальный капитал в размере около 300 долларов, однако для закупки товара ему еще не хватает немного денег. Эту недостающую сумму он просит в кредит. Рустам надеется на поддержку и верит, что он успешно начнет свой новый бизнес.
texts.en:
Rustam is a handyman-finisher in his district of Shahrituz. His work is seasonal and, with the onset of cold weather, he is left without orders and a source of income. Due to this, Rustam decided to start a new business in retail sales. He is planning to get involved in reselling almonds and dried fruits. He will buy products from village residents at low prices and then resell them at a local market at profitable prices.

Rustam is married. He is 39 years old. His wife and oldest son now work in Russia. Rustam has an initial capital of about 300 dollars, but is short some money to buy the products. He is requesting this remaining amount as a loan. Rustam hopes for the support and believes that he will successfully start his new business.

loans.use: to buy almonds and dried fruits in order to start his new business

loans.name: Las Estrellitas Group

texts.es: El grupo “LAS ESTRELLITAS” esta conformada por socios anciosos por por mejorar su economia familiar. Diego tiene 21 años de edad es soltero dedicado a la venta de gorros y llaveros actividad que aprendio cuando ayudaba a su madre. el credito lo invertira en la compra de mas gorras llaveros para poder expenderlos a sus amigos y conocidos. El grupo agradece a los inversionsitas KIVA por el credito brindado. diego es el primero del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
The group "Las Estrellitas" (The Little Stars) is composed of members who are all eager to improve their families' economic situations. Diego, a single young man of 21 years, is in the business of selling cap and key chains, work that he learned from helping his mother. He will use his loan to invest in the purchase of more caps and key chains so that he can sell them to his friends and acquaintances. The group would like to thank Kiva investors for the credit provided to them. 

Diego is pictured at the far left.

loans.use: buy more caps and key chains for resale

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, 50, is an agri-business entrepreneur from Kebeneti, in the South Rift region of Kenya. The father of 5 has been actively doing this work for 15 good years. He makes a decent income selling milk, eggs, tea and other crops he produces at the local market. He is also engaged in other personal businesses to make additional income. 

Poultry farming has worked out particularly very well for David, mainly because of the growing demand for chicken products and by-products. He also attributes his success to the passion and vision he has for the business. He also enjoys plucking tea leaves during harvesting and feeding Salat, his dairy cow. The biggest risks his business faces are outbreaks of disease and market uncertainties. 

David is seeking a loan to purchase more poultry. With this money, he will expand his business by buying a brood of hens which will lay more eggs to resell.  

David has a nurtured 'saving culture.' He will use the money from this investment to build his savings account and provide his family with a balanced diet and better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase poultry for his chicken-rearing business

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es: Ana de 29 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo de 11 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad ha logrado sostener la economía familiar por medio de su negocio de venta de tostadas en los lugares cercanos a su localidad. Ana desea cambiar el techo de un cuarto de su vivienda ya que como se observa en la fotografía, este se quebró y a debido colocar pedazos de lamina lo que tampoco da mucha seguridad, además desea encementar el piso de la acera por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: duralita, cemento, arena y grava para cambiar el techo de un cuarto y encementar el piso de la acera.
texts.en: Ana, age 29, lives in her own home with her 11-year-old son. Thanks to her hard work and dedication, she has managed to sustain her household through her business selling tostadas at several places in her area. Ana wants to change out the roof of one room of her home. As you can see in the photo, the current one broke and it's starting to drop pieces of laminate, which doesn't give her much security.  She also wants to do the floor of the walkway in cement. The loan that she is requesting from FUSAI will be invested in roofing material, cement, sand, and gravel so that she can make these improvements.

loans.use: repair the roof of a room in her home and cement a walkway

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth started farming when he was 20 in the year 2010. His farm is situated in Kericho, a high-altitude, tea-growing region of Kenya which has a cold-wet climate. His primary income source is tea and milk. The major challenge with tea farming he has come to experience is that there are so many market uncertainties that lead to greatly reduced profit margins or, at times, outright losses. This forces farmers to get involved in other personal businesses to mitigate risks and sustain their livelihood.

Kenneth is seeking a loan investment of KES 60,000 from Kiva lenders to venture into the poultry business. He will use half the money to purchase a brood of hens, KES 20,000 to buy feed, and KES 10,000 to buy chemicals. 

From this investment, Kenneth projects a substantial increase in income that will enable him to afford other business-related expenses that will arise in the future of this business. He plans to reinvest profits into the business. 

When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?" Kenneth replied, "Improved quality of life."

loans.use: to purchase poultry, feed, and chemicals.

loans.name: Unity Teachers Group

texts.en:
This is a group of primary school teachers in a school in Nairobi within Umoja Estate. They are in their late 40's and they all use charcoal for cooking. With traditional cook stoves, there is a lot of indoor air pollution which leads to respiratory diseases and also there is a lot of charcoal consumption by the traditional stoves.

Currently, on average, each member spends USD 1.3 on charcoal everyday. The loan will enable them purchase high efficient cook stoves JIKOKOA that will save them up to 50% of their daily consumption on charcoal. These cook stoves also reduce smoke and carbon emissions from the charcoal thus creating a better and cleaner environment for their families.

The families will be able to save USD 0.65 daily from the reduced consumption on charcoal.  This translates to USD 234 every year for at least 5 years (lifetime of the cook stove).  This money will be saved and used for other needs like paying for their children's school fees, paying rent and making their lives better.

loans.use: to buy an improved high efficient cookstove

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is 35 and the father of three children. He is a hardworking man who earns a living by raising and selling cattle. He earns extra income from dairy products he makes and sells such as ghee and milk. He dreams of educating his children and expanding his business into urban markets, but faces a lack of capital and access to transportation to serve new areas. Fred is seeking a loan to buy more cattle to fatten and sell.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to raise and sell.

loans.name: Aquah Allah Group

texts.en:
Aquah Allah is a group from Kwadadwe in the Assin Fosu District of the Central Region of Ghana. 

Gilbert, 24 years old, is the leader and representative of the group. He is married with one child. His child is 2 years old and has just begun school. He has been a maize and cassava farmer for the past 3 years. He earns his living from the sale of maize and cassava to support his family. Due to deforestation within their community, it is very difficult these days to find firewood after a hard day's work on the farm. Gilbert and his group members decided to purchase an Elsa Clean cook stove that uses virgin pellet (palm kernel shells) to improve their cooking and protect their forests. Virgin pellet is very abundant in their community. 

However, Gilbert lacks the necessary initial bulk funds that will enable him to purchase the stove. A micro-loan will help Gilbert buy an Elsa Clean Cook stove to save him from long hours of looking for firewood, and will also save the remaining forest within his community. He will be able to repay the loan from the sale of his cassava and maize. Gilbert thanks all his micro lenders for their kind support.

loans.use: to buy a clean cook stove.

loans.name: Jose Martir

texts.es: José de 36 años de edad vive con su grupo familiar él se dedica a la venta de pescado y pesca artesanal junto a su familia y ya tiene 19 años de experiencia, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades de su hogar, José solicita un crédito para la compra de equipo de trabajo como redes, trasmallo, etc. para continuar con su trabajo y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 36 years old and lives with his family group. He makes his living selling fish and through artisanal fishing with his family. He already has 19 years experience, and with what he earns from selling fish manages to cover the needs of his household. 

José is requesting a loan to buy new equipment such as fishing nets, driftnet, etc. to continue his work and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, driftnet, etc.

loans.name: Irma Gladis

texts.es: Irma vive con su hija, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tamales de gallina, de elote y atol elote desde hace  15 años, se ha dedicado a este  empleo para poder ayudar económicamente a su esposo con gastos de alimentación, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades de su hogar, Irma solicita un crédito para mejorar el cuarto donde ella realiza la venta que es el que muestra la fotografía, por eso solicita dicho crédito para comprar cemento, arena y piso cerámico y pago de mano de obra para tener un mejor lugar para vender.
texts.en:
Irma lives with her daughter. She has been making chicken and corn tamales and a corn-based drink for 15 years. She has done this work so that she can help her husband with the cost of food. Her business is located in her home. She uses the money she makes from her sales to cover the household necessities. 
Irma is requesting a loan to improve the room where she sells her food, which is shown in the photograph. To do this, she is requesting a loan to buy cement, sand, and floor tiles and to pay for the labor so she can have a better place to sell her products.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and floor tiles and to pay for labor.

loans.name: May Ann

texts.en: May Ann is the mother of two children and lives in Concepcion, Iloilo. For the last six years, she and her husband have earned a living by fishing. She supplements her income by raising pigs, and is requesting a loan to buy additional piglets and supplies for her fishing business, including nets and lead weights. Her goal is to expand her business and increase her income so that she can be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing supplies and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is 43 years old and has two children. Marilyn has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now. She is also engaged in a hog-raising business. 

Marilyn is asking for a loan to buy materials for fishing like nets, hooks, and lead weights and additional piglets to raise. With this, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income. Marilyn hopes to expand her ventures so that they will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing like nets, hooks, and lead weights and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice, 28, is a mother of 2 children who is based in Kiboswa village in the Kapsowar division of Kenya. Kapsowar would appeal to anyone fed up with the urban lifestyle: here, the air is clean, schools are good, way of life is slow, crime is low and life is simple. Kiboswa constituents primarily practice livestock farming since the landscape is not conducive to large-scale crop farming. For the last 2 years, Eunice has been doing commercial dairy farming and subsistence crop farming. 

Eunice has aspirations to expand her business and increase her income. She is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. With this amount, she will also have the cow insured in order to mitigate risk of losses in the case of death of the animal. 

With your funding, Eunice plans to reinvest the profits into the business to ensure stability and growth. She said that her children will be impacted by the loan since she will be in a better position to pay for their education.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Ramathan

texts.en:
Ramathan is a 23-year-old single man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

He sells matookes;  a business he started with the hope of employing himself. He faces challenges of business personalities and price fluctuations.
 
He has hopes of buying land and building a permanent house. Ramathan needs a loan to buy matookes to sell.

loans.use: to buy matookes to sell.
